pickleballReviews.author: Joe Joe H
pickleballReviews.text:
Nice little park in the Skyline neighborhood with great views of Canyon Country, especially at sunset.

There's a Pickleball and a Basketball court available which is a plus!

pickleballReviews.author: Kevin Webb
pickleballReviews.text: Yet another gem in the SC Parks division.  Photos from just before official opening which should be 2/24.  It is less than half a mile away from Plum Canyon Park which is a bit odd but speaks to the growth of the Skyline area of Canyon Country.   All the amenities you've come to expect of SCV parks.  Tennis courts which can also accommodate Pickle ball which is a first in my SCV park experience, the pickle ball.   Baseball/softball field.   Basketball courts that go full court in two directions.  Landscaping was about 60% today but it looks good and you can see the finished product when complete.  Very nice addition to our parks catalog and  typical high quality presentation.

pickleballReviews.author: Dave Colburn
pickleballReviews.text: Beautiful new park in the SCV with great views and amenities. Huge baseball field and several Pickleball courts. Basketball courts and kids playground. Great place to spend an afternoon

pickleballReviews.author: Trevor Mersch
pickleballReviews.text: Great park, clean and well thought out  It opened in April though, so there aren't a lot of trees for shade yet. There are shade-tented eating and playing areas, and great multi-purpose tennis/pickleball courts here.

pickleballReviews.author: Tommy Guns (Legend)
pickleballReviews.text: This was my first visit to this park and my 3rd park I visited. I want to let my partner and Service Dog Sabbath have a day I devote for his adventures. This is a small park but the walk was enjoyable and it's is an intresting park. It has an old swimming pool and looks like it's been used in recent years, it still has water. Its small but would be fun when hot. It has 2 tiny play areas as will a places to have a picnic. The bathrooms are single use not sure how they look inside. It has 2 tennis courts, handball and basketball courts a community center and a kiosk for covid19 testing not sure when it's available. It has 2 parking areas and a few home free people but they kept to themselves.

pickleballReviews.author: EddyAnne Garcia
pickleballReviews.text: There's a Narcotics Anonymous meeting daily at 12pm, a kids playground and a covered picnic area. Parking is limited, but plenty of street parking on the north side of the  park. They also have a handball court, and tennis courts nearby.

pickleballReviews.author: William Duece Biggaload Morris II (Beverly HillsBilly)
pickleballReviews.text: Love this place!!   It’s so peaceful and always pleasant people enjoying the park and tennis courts.  I have got to try the pickle ball though. It looks like so much fun!!!  I usually hangout and do some drawing or write. I get so inspired while I’m there. I think it’s cause it’s a little taste of nature in the middle of the city. Absolutely love this place though!!!

courts.name: Pickle Pop
courts.address: 1231 3rd St, Santa Monica, CA 90401, USA

pickleballReviews.author: H-Pop Local Guide
pickleballReviews.text:
Popped in for Pickle last week! What a terrific location & pickleball set-up for open pickleball.

It was easy to make a reservation online.  I signed up for the women’s intermediate session.  The other players were very friendly & welcoming.  Very good players that play with each other regularly. They offer a monthly or reasonable drop-in rate.

Three courts that rotated the players. There is plenty of seating to watch the games & concession area for drinks & relax.  Let’s have a pickleball party!

Great way to reuse the 3rd street mall space into something fun & productive! The space is bright & inviting.  Easy to find parking all around area.  Thanks for experience!

pickleballReviews.author: Hardin Meinardus
pickleballReviews.text: This place is so cute and I had a blast! We came during a slower hour and ended up being short a player. One of the workers, Peyton, stepped in for us and had us laughing so hard. He gave us great advice and we were really improving our game! Please open a court in Magnolia, Texas! If I won the lottery, I would fly to California once a week, just to recreate that experience:)

courts.name: PICKLETOWNLA
courts.address: 1431 Lincoln Blvd, Santa Monica, CA 90401, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Mayer Mayer
pickleballReviews.text: This is how Pickle Ball should look be played and be taught.  Mary Pat is a phenomenal teacher, a generous host and I think this place is awesome. Highly recommend this for all levels of play and today I rented the Pickle Ball thrower and had such an amazing workout.

pickleballReviews.author: Robin Kothari
pickleballReviews.text: I play here all the time. The lessons are great because Mary Pat is a phenomenal instructor! Court rentals are reasonably priced as well. And there’s a ball machine to rent if you wanted to practice by yourself.

pickleballReviews.author: Ked Fisseha
pickleballReviews.text: We had a group of 10 people and had a BLAST at Pickletown LA.  Our pro was an amazing instructor and the entire setup was excellent.  They even put out some snacks for us, which was a nice surprise.  The mix of both indoor and outdoor courts, which are connected via a large door, and the overall facility made things easy and fun for a large group. Many of our group had never played before and by the end were pickleball converts.  Recommend it fully for your next large group activity!

courts.address: 7007 Marvin Trail, Redding, CA 96001, USA

pickleballReviews.text:
Very nice park now that they've replaced the dilapidated playground. Lots of open fields, tables, and a basketball court and tennis court.
Easy access, but not much parking, only street parking.

pickleballReviews.author: Pizza The Hut
pickleballReviews.text: Cool place to hang out with friends or family. 2 water fountains, full basketball court, expanded grass fields great for sports like soccer. The only thing I'd say is bad is being there after 7-9. It can be really sketchy in the dark as can any playground be. This one is especially sketchy since there is a back path behind the park.

pickleballReviews.text:
We play Volleyball out there.  The facility is clean, family friendly and has lights on the courts. The organization of the Volleyball schedule is the best it has ever been,  I'm guessing thanks to Tracey. Summer '17.
Our team of 8 , love it at BLD's.

courts.address: 230 Washington St, Weaverville, CA 96093, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Bob Kowalski
pickleballReviews.text: Holds nice events for the community, Easter egg hunts for the kids, fourth of July festivities, rodeo grounds right next door along with a skate park, pickle ball courts, softball and little league diamonds, and the community pool.  Also has a playground area and the Lyons cook shack with a large BBQ grill.

courts.name: Enterprise Park
courts.address: 4000 Victor Ave, Redding, CA 96002, USA

pickleballReviews.author: William “Walker” Bailey
pickleballReviews.text: Love either here. Weather I'm babysitting at the park, playing pickleball, disco golf, playing in the water, events, or just hanging out in the sun. The people are always friendly. The grass is always green. Lots to do to enjoy yourself!

pickleballReviews.author: EH L
pickleballReviews.text: No lights otherwise this facility is perfect. 🙂 6 dedicated pickleball with each having fence. Another 6 were set up in a floor hockey ring with portable nets.

pickleballReviews.author: Casey “Doc Holliday” Pearce
pickleballReviews.text: Great place to take your kids, families, business or corporate summer pot luck or just hang out, hey we in their awesome, very well done, water extravaganza! It is true! The water park they created is just awesome! The save it for last, "bad news".  The only thing they could have done (only in my opinion) expanded the water to make it larger. In fact I would go as far as to say, not only expand it, but make the water attraction the main event, in fact, they could rename it, snake the water attraction elements throughout the rest of the park, maybe create a mote? That encircles the play structure, goes around the area where the swings are, and terminates, but better, had it reconnect back to the main attraction area. Anyway, disc golf for those who enjoy that, basketball courts upper level, huge area, I would suggest you bring your own drinks, water, sodas, anything. It belief it only has two water fountains in the lower playground area. The water gets a two ⭐ rating, it's warm, tastes bad, and generally... I'd rather bring my own. Anyway highly recommended, free, and your kids will love it!

courts.name: Sun Oaks
courts.address: 3452 Argyle Rd, Redding, CA 96002, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Elise Hawkins
pickleballReviews.text:
I want give a special shout out to the childcare staff and management at Sun Oaks. They have been so kind and accommodating to my children and their needs— and my daughter says it’s her favorite part of the day every time we go! Thank you Mimi, Eli, and all the wonderful staff who truly make a difference for our little ones and their development and social experiences! I’m so grateful for people who truly care and go the extra mile to provide a safe and healthy environment for our babies to thrive while we take care of our mental and physical health as parents at the gym!

Another special shout out to Garrett who runs the pickleball clinic for our daughter and runs the Kings court pickleball program. This was the reason we became members here, and the pickleball community at Sun Oaks is such a fun and welcoming community. I almost don’t want to say anything because it’s a hidden gem of a place and I don’t want the secret to get out!

All that to say, this place has it all— one stop shop— ideal for families. Very nice people. It’s the best gym in town, hands down.

pickleballReviews.text: My children gave this park an A+++++++.  My youngest daughter wouldn't stop saying "plus" for a couple of minutes.  Two different play structures, one for children age 5 and older and one for those younger then five.  Park also contains a basketball court, a large grass field for soccer or whatever, and a beautifully covered picnic/party area.  Dad gives it a nine out of ten... a really nice park.  Go visit it.

pickleballReviews.text:
There are some really cool slides and also the swinging bars to build upper strength in arms.

Great and popular tennis and/or pickleball courts.

Even some benches under nice shade trees for those of us who just want to kick back and relax in this heat wave we are currently having.

I consider it to be a nice, safe park that is well-maintained and in a great area.

pickleballReviews.author: Michael Mullins
pickleballReviews.text: Nice park in a pretty good area. Decent place to play pickleball. Could use some slats or netting on the fence to break up with wind from the Western side.

courts.name: Spencer's Park
courts.address: 3228 W Clinton Ct, Visalia, CA 93291, USA

pickleballReviews.author: DS Ds
pickleballReviews.text: Great park to run around and enjoy some recreational activities. There is a nice Baseball field, benches, tennis courts, and grills for BBQ. Restrooms are clean too.

courts.name: Pickleball court
courts.address: 315 E Nees Ave, Fresno, CA 93720, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Pickleball System
pickleballReviews.text: This is a dedicated pickleball facility with multiple courts. Great place to play!

courts.name: Brentlinger Park
courts.address: 1325 Stillman St, Selma, CA 93662, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Jair
pickleballReviews.text: It's a nice and calming park. It has a baseball field and a tennis court! It's a nice place to go with your friends and have some fun. Although the downside to this park is there will sometimes be some creepy homeless guys around or even in the park. So do be aware of this. Although even if they are near they don't cause much trouble as long as you give them some space. Overall a good park itself. Worth visiting.

courts.name: Top Level Sports
courts.address: 3788 W Richert Ave, Fresno, CA 93722, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Trent Hammond
pickleballReviews.text: We held our end of the season soccer/flag football party here. The facility was in great shape and clean. Plenty for the team to do. They spent two hours playing football and soccer and loved it. The lobby area was a great spot for the parents to relax and watch the games. There were even a couple of tough matches on their two pickleball courts. The only thing we didn't utilize was the baseball area. I would definitely recommend this place.

courts.name: Vinland Park
courts.address: 4695 E Gettysburg Ave, Fresno, CA 93726, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Brian Wilds
pickleballReviews.text: Pickleball every morning weather permitting from 8-11 on 8 temporary courts however the courts are well maintained. Friendly people with varying skill sets and ages.

pickleballReviews.author: Olaf Kreutz
pickleballReviews.text: Yes, great place for Pickleball and waterpark in the summer for the kids

pickleballReviews.author: RUTH Hernandez
pickleballReviews.text: We come to this park for soccer practice.  It has a large layout for multiple teams to practice.  There's a water play for kids and playground.  The play structure is a bit small and could use an update.  Lots of people always playing pickle ball at the tennis courts.

courts.name: Thorburn Park
courts.address: 33 Alamos Ave, Clovis, CA 93611, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Ace Dunn
pickleballReviews.text: Nice little park with tennis and pickleball courts.  Also has a baseball diamond, jungle gym and a little water park for summertime fun!  😎 👍 🥵

pickleballReviews.author: Bishop Sherrod Cotton
pickleballReviews.text: This park DOES NOT have a basketball court

courts.name: Panzak Park
courts.address: Fowler, CA 93625, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Brittanie Adaire Hikes
pickleballReviews.text: I really love this park, something about it feels nostalgic, that could  be due to the fact that Fowler is still a communal town that puts on community events, which most events take place in this park. There is a playground with swings, plenty of trees for shade, amphitheater for shows, picnic tables, large cemented area for a party with picnic tables and an awning, there is also a small court for paddle games, it's not large enough for tennis though. Perfect park to spend the day reading, having a picnic, and just enjoying the sun.

pickleballReviews.author: Robert Diaz
pickleballReviews.text: Small but nice park.  They have swings and nice area with slides for kids to play.  There was a Pickleball tournament being played while we were there.  Lots of trees and grass.  There's a large covered seating area with fixed benches that can be rented for a period of time or all day.  It's surrounded by stationary barbecue grills.

courts.name: Logan Park
courts.address: 5450 N Santa Fe Ave, Fresno, CA 93711, USA

pickleballReviews.author: bifocals4my
pickleballReviews.text:
Invited to play pickleball. One decommissioned tennis court lined out for 2  pickleball courts. Must have your own net(s).
Also has one full service tennis court next to it. Nice park!

pickleballReviews.author: B Bear
pickleballReviews.text:
I like how the playground is gated & there is PLENTY of running space. There was no handsoap in the restrooms, so we had to bring our own. There was another family having a little party & so the only trash can in the area with tables was overflowing. We brought trash bags, thinking we could toss the full ones in the garbage dumpster. We walked over to the brick wall & found there was no dumpster. The kids had fun even though the slide was blocked off. There is a basketball court & a baseball diamond, for those wondering. They also have a few BBQ grills & cement benches/tables.
Attached: a photo of one of my twins passed out from playing so hard 😁

courts.name: Tennis Courts
courts.address: Parking lot, Fresno, CA 93720, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Max Tickman
pickleballReviews.text: These tennis courts cascade down a mild slope away from the school in three terraced levels reminiscent of Andean maize farming. Each terrace contains four courts for a total of twelve. At night, timed overhead court lighting may be turned on by pressing a button located on an electrical box near each court which, along with the terracing, lends to an overall feeling of verdant growth. A feeling that if we only stay under those lights for long enough we will surely become healthy, husky, and full of kernels ready to take the heat and pop off, fully realizing our potential as delicious popcorn people. 5 stars - would recommend.

pickleballReviews.author: Robert Diaz
pickleballReviews.text: Courts are free.  Lights can be used until 11pm.  Not sure how to rsvp, but we had to leave once a group of people showed u saying they had the courts for a tournament.  Old and young people.

courts.name: Clovis Area Recreation Center
courts.address: 3495 Clovis Ave, Clovis, CA 93612, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Tee Knight
pickleballReviews.text: Great indoor basketball Court.. The only one in Clovis, $50.00 an hr, only cash. I took my Son and his 4 friends to go practice some hoops for a couple of hours. They enjoyed it and even had me out there playing, even tho I suck... Had a blast and will be going again, just need more people... My Son plays on the AAU for BHS... Trying to get him to the NBA... If you like to ball or have kids that want a indoor court, in Clovis... This is your place...Thanks Clovis Rec.

courts.name: Sierra Sport & Racquet Club
courts.address: 2626 W Alluvial Ave, Fresno, CA 93711, USA

pickleballReviews.author: adam pickar
pickleballReviews.text: Best tennis club in the area. Full fitness center. 20 tennis courts, 18 of them with lights for night play. Ball machine available. Home of the Fresno City Championships tournament & Fresno Tennis Academy, led by former ATP pro Fransisco Gonzales.

courts.name: Orchid Park
courts.address: 3420 W Fir Ave, Fresno, CA 93720, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Evan Gramis
pickleballReviews.text: Wonderful neighborhood park with lots to offer. Great play structures, swings, and lots of green space for running around. Plenty of trees for shade. There are public bathrooms, tennis/pickleball courts, and a baseball field. Always a favorite outing for the kids.

courts.name: Lacey Park
courts.address: 112 Florinda St, Hanford, CA 93230, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Mo Wurie
pickleballReviews.text:
Nice, family-friendly park

I visited this park on a beautiful sunny day. It feels very safe around here there was a police vehicle routinely patrolling the area, and the park recreational areas and basketball courts are  very clean.

Surely a good place to relax, play baseball or basketball.

courts.name: DICK'S Sporting Goods
courts.address: 3380 W Shaw Ave, Fresno, CA 93711, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Hung Phan
pickleballReviews.text: IF you are a golfer, beginner or veteran, come to this Dick's store for your golfing needs.  You will be greeted with respect and courtesy no matter how many questions you have.  I am a fairly new golfer and I have never been treated better and with more respect and courtesy.  Matt from the Golf Department is super knowledgeable and an all around cool guy, I honestly don't think you will find a better experience with any Golfing Service than at this particular store.

courts.name: Sport Court
courts.address: Fresno, CA 93720, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Sajan Badhan
pickleballReviews.text: This is someone’s house not a tennis court

courts.name: KC Park
courts.address: Dinuba, CA 93618, USA

pickleballReviews.author: A
pickleballReviews.text:
This park is always well maintained. There's a small playground next to four picnic tables with a gazebo, a water fountain, trash cans and a bathroom. Could use more large trees because this is the only area with decent shade.

Theres a large walking path that circles the entire park. Perfect for morning jogs. As well as a court to play racket sports, and a beginners level discolf course.

It gets busy on weekends because they hold soccer and baseball games here, so plan your trip accordingly. They could use significantly more parking because of this and have more bathrooms open, as sometimes there's only one open.

pickleballReviews.author: Juan Ruiz
pickleballReviews.text: Played at the new Dinuba Bball courts. Good grip, good backboard, No restrooms in the immediate area, may have to take a little walk from the courts. You can see the video of us playing on YouTube- TheChosen1uan XMAS EVE HOOPS

pickleballReviews.author: Mckinley “Mac G” Gilmore
pickleballReviews.text: Up and coming park of Dinuba. Disk golf is great for beginners or if you work in the area, you can get through 9 holes twice in 1 hour. Pickle ball court is being built. Basketball and tennis court is in the near future. Gymnasium for the kids and lots of grass for your dogs to play fetch on. Make sure to pick up after your animals to keep this park clean. One bathroom stall is always open :)

courts.name: NoWalls Fitness
courts.address: 1030 Shaw Ave #103, Clovis, CA 93612, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Maggie A.
pickleballReviews.text:
This is a very friendly gym. The proprietor is down to earth and welcoming.  I enjoyed the free pickleball lesson on Saturday. It was fun!
😃👍

courts.name: Student Recreation Center
courts.address: 5010 N Woodrow Ave, Fresno, CA 93740, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Toon Tran
pickleballReviews.text:
Pros:

Diverse Facilities: The Student Recreation Center at California State University, Fresno, offers a wide array of sports and fitness options across its two floors. The availability of basketball and volleyball courts, squash, and table tennis areas means there's something for everyone, whether you're looking to engage in team sports or prefer solo activities.
Spacious and Well-Maintained: The center is notably clean and well-maintained. The equipment and courts are kept in excellent condition, which enhances the overall user experience. The spacious layout also helps in managing the flow of students and prevents the facilities from feeling overcrowded.
Inclusive Environment: The atmosphere is welcoming and inclusive, encouraging students of all skill levels to participate. This supportive environment is a big plus for those who might be trying out new sports or are looking to improve their fitness levels in a non-intimidating setting.
Cons:

Peak Time Crowds: Like many university fitness centers, the Recreation Center can get quite crowded during peak hours, especially in the early evenings and after class hours. While this shows its popularity, it can sometimes lead to waiting times for equipment and facilities.
Limited Advanced Equipment: While the center excellently supports general fitness and sports activities, those looking for specialized training equipment might find the offerings a bit limited. Adding more diverse and advanced fitness equipment could enhance the experience for fitness enthusiasts.
Conclusion:
The Student Recreation Center at California State University, Fresno, is a fantastic facility that serves the student body with a variety of recreational and sports activities. Its well-maintained courts and friendly, inclusive atmosphere make it a valuable asset to the campus life. While there might be occasional crowding and a desire for more specialized equipment, the center adequately meets the needs of most students looking to stay active and healthy. A great spot for Fresno State students to unwind and keep fit!

courts.name: Harlan Ranch Community Recreation Center
courts.address: 1620 N Leonard Ave, Clovis, CA 93619, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Rachael Awad (Most Awesome Realtor)
pickleballReviews.text:
Harlan Ranch Community is a vibrant and inclusive neighborhood that offers residents a unique blend of modern amenities and small-town charm. Nestled amidst picturesque surroundings, this community provides a serene escape from the hustle and bustle of city life while still being conveniently located near urban conveniences.

The neighborhood boasts beautifully landscaped streets, lush parks, and scenic walking trails, perfect for leisurely strolls or outdoor activities with family and friends. Residents can also enjoy a variety of recreational facilities, including community pools, playgrounds, and sports courts, fostering a sense of camaraderie and an active lifestyle.

Harlan Ranch Community prioritizes a strong sense of community, organizing events and activities throughout the year to bring neighbors together and create lasting bonds. Whether it's a summer BBQ, a holiday celebration, or a community cleanup day, there's always something happening to connect residents and foster a strong sense of belonging.

Additionally, the community is served by excellent schools, making it an ideal place for families to settle down and raise children. With its tranquil ambiance, array of amenities, and tight-knit community spirit, Harlan Ranch is more than just a neighborhood – it's a place to call home.

courts.name: Manuel Hernandez Community Center
courts.address: 247 W Ferguson Ave, Visalia, CA 93291, USA

pickleballReviews.author: ernie gonzalez
pickleballReviews.text: It's offers great activities and full size basketball court indoor and outdoors just the building is a little run down they need to upgrade the facility and the area it's located is a rough neighborhood

pickleballReviews.author: Leo Swordsman
pickleballReviews.text: Love this area. great for basketball players to play and hang. lots of courts and lots of room for setting up games. Has a pokestop and gym close by

courts.name: Maxie L. Parks Community Center
courts.address: 1802 E California Ave, Fresno, CA 93706, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Carl Johnson
pickleballReviews.text:
Great place for kids
Nice basketball court
The staff is awesome

courts.name: Highway City Community Science Center
courts.address: 5140 N State St, Fresno, CA 93722, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Shy Gurl, SL WSGTN
pickleballReviews.text: Great scientific class for kids to build their knowledge, very nice and clean park also have BBQ and basketball court!

pickleballReviews.author: Luis Miranda
pickleballReviews.text: Very nice place to take children. The park is nice as well and has a basketball court

courts.name: Yosemite Lakes Park Rec Center
courts.address: Long Hollow Dr, Coarsegold, CA 93614, USA

pickleballReviews.author: W. Kyle Hamilton
pickleballReviews.text: Great little park, has a baseball diamond, basketball court, bbq pit, and bathrooms. Be sure to visit the Revis family cemetery nearby for some local history

courts.name: Riverway Sports Park
courts.address: 3611 N Dinuba Blvd, Visalia, CA 93291, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Daniel S. Chavez
pickleballReviews.text: Nice place to watch a soccer game, kids have a playground, lots of trees for shade. Restrooms open for public, tennis courts, barbecue pits, basketball courts, good park to rest or sleep for a while.

courts.name: Soroptimist Park
courts.address: W Buena Vista Ave, Visalia, CA 93291, USA

pickleballReviews.author: 杏子 Anne Lirio-Mayari
pickleballReviews.text: Awesome park! It has a play structure for 2-5 yrs and older kids. A half court basketball area, shaded seating/picnic table by the play structure and a few benches placed around the park. It has a large field in the middle and a walking/running path that encircles the whole park. It is also a great area to walk your dog with a leash, they also provide a dog poop bag dispensary. There is also a water fountain with a mini side water fountain for your dog to drink. Great area to also ride your bicycle or roller blade.

courts.name: Ledbetter Park
courts.address: 45779 Rd 128, Cutler, CA 93615, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Giancarlo Bruno
pickleballReviews.text: A pretty nice community park with lots of good shade trees, nice arbors, and some playgrounds and sports courts. They just announced that they have received some grant funding to improve the park, which is great.

courts.name: Stallion Park
courts.address: 6245 N Polk Ave, Fresno, CA 93722, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Milagro Arcia
pickleballReviews.text:
Good park to take your dog for a walk and to even get a quick workout. Park could use a little more attention to some areas imo but since it’s a city park they have in so many resources to keep it as clean as I would like. Great field size to have some outdoor games and a decent basketball court, restrooms are decent enough but the playground at least from the last time I was there smelt like pee but that’s completely out of the cities control since it is an open park.

Overall good park for the area and it’s not really too busy like some of the other city parks.

courts.name: Cesar Chavez Park
courts.address: Florence Ave. & Faller Ave., Sanger, CA 93657, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Yvette Blanco
pickleballReviews.text: I love this park 😍 its just about the only one in town where they don't do drugs and no gangsters or family just loves it here. Very friendly. The jungle gym it's perfect for the kiddos the basketball court the soccer field where a families get together and play a little soccer football and the restrooms are also close

courts.name: Selma Layne Park
courts.address: V783+989, 2065 E Shepherd Ave, Fresno, CA 93720, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Jay
pickleballReviews.text: Decent size park on the corner of Shepherd and Maple in North East Fresno. This park contains a baseball field, 2 soccer fields, a play ground and basketball court. There are restrooms and plenty of picnic tables. Usually people come here to walk around the park with their dogs.

courts.name: Roeding Park Tennis Center
courts.address: 1165 W Olive Ave, Fresno, CA 93728, USA

pickleballReviews.author: d trump
pickleballReviews.text: There are a lot of tennis courts. We went during a Wednesday evening, so the lights for the courts nearest Olive Ave did not turn on. Also, there was either a tournament or a league going on, so they took up all the rest of the courts. I still think the courts there are still the best in fresno. But you might get those days like I did where there's something going on and end up with no court to play on. Also, the homelessness has gotten ridiculous there. For the most part, they mind their own, but I've had my share with them. Look out for the broken meth pipes and needles. I would not recommend bringing animals there are a lot of stray dogs the homeless have that are not on a leash. Further, make sure to use the bathroom elsewhere before going. The bathrooms are very dirty and homeless use it constantly. Yes they shower using the sink.

pickleballReviews.author: Ghullam Amini
pickleballReviews.text: Tennis courts are kept clean and nicely managed.

courts.name: Melody Park
courts.address: 5935 E Shields Ave, Fresno, CA 93727, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Julieann Alvarado
pickleballReviews.text: Courts were in good shape. Park was pretty empty on Sunday afternoon. Areas I utilized were clean. Some interesting activity going on in the parking lot

pickleballReviews.author: Kim Wiley
pickleballReviews.text: Nice park with a water and splash park daily. Tennis and basketball courts. Small skate ramps. A community center serving free lunches for kids nice play area and plenty of room  with big shade trees small  picnic area and small BBQ. Very good neighborhood park and recreation center

pickleballReviews.author: nadz bee
pickleballReviews.text: I wish there are few more picnic tables. It’s a very convenient park location, clean and has soccer field, recreation center, skating area, basketball court outdoor and waterpark!

courts.name: Fink White Park
courts.address: 535 S Trinity St, Fresno, CA 93706, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Hunter Markham
pickleballReviews.text:
The best basketball courts in Fresno! They have 2 sets of double courts facing different directions. This means you can always find a basket to shoot on where the sun isn’t in your eyes. Plus, the trees by the courts add shade on hot summer days. The park is quiet and trouble-free.

I took off 1 star because park staff doesn’t clean the place well. I’ve seen broken glass left on the courts and sidewalks for days. Now, I bring a broom and dustpan to clean up the courts myself. The parks department needs to take better care of the place. Kids deserve places to play without the danger of broken glass.

pickleballReviews.author: Sunnayna Singh
pickleballReviews.text: It's a great little park. Especially when there is no one else there. My children(2&5) and I usually come when school is in session, the other kids(ages 5-13) are really rowdy rude and use a lot of foul language. I wouldn't recommend coming here when it's busy if you keep to yourself and you don't want to have your kids pushed around. For kids who love space it's a great place, especially when it's empty. There's a large field, a gazebo, soccer nets, a tennis and basketball court. They also do after school recreation for kids ages 6 and older from 3-6pm. I wish the county would do more to keep it graffiti and vandalism free although it is pretty clean and I usually don't see garbage everywhere. Today however one of the rocketship a windows had been kicked out. It also looks as if someone set a fire inside the rocket ship... definitely a place to take your kids if you're in the area and it's empty. I recommend avoiding on weekends.

courts.name: Pickleball
courts.address: 1402 Hanover Way, Tustin, CA 92782, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Pickleball System
pickleballReviews.text: This is a dedicated pickleball facility with multiple courts. Great place to play!

courts.name: Bouquet Canyon Park
courts.address: 28127 Wellston Dr, Santa Clarita, CA 91350, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Chandler Barnes
pickleballReviews.text:
Bouquet Canyon Park is an absolute gem in the community! This park has so many fantastic amenities, including a top-notch playground that caters to all ages—toddlers, kids, and even older children. The playground is the highlight for us, especially the zip line swings, which my son absolutely loves! The climbing structures and slides are so well-designed and fun, and the entire playground area is impressively large.

Beyond the playground, the park also offers basketball courts, pickleball/tennis courts, and a baseball/softball field. There’s plenty of grassy space to run around and relax, as well as lots of benches perfect for a picnic. It’s a great spot for families to enjoy some outdoor fun.

While it can get a bit busy at times, if you visit during a quieter moment, it’s an unbeatable experience. This park has something for everyone, and it’s easily one of the best parks in the Santa Clarita. Highly recommend!

pickleballReviews.author: Kevin Webb
pickleballReviews.text: What a fantastic park.  It's buried in a neighborhood off Bouquet Canyon Road but well worth it and not like you're driving way out of your way.  Superb amenities.  Pickleball, tennis, full court basketball and all the kids playground stuff.  Also has good hiking trails off the back of the park.  Really dig this place.  Highly recommended.

pickleballReviews.author: Jay
pickleballReviews.text: Very well maintained park. The tennis court is surprisingly very busy every time we come. Parking spaces are ample, but get tighter as you get closer to the tennis court area since people are lining up for an open court. Nights, I wouldn't recommend walking solo. Sometimes, I'll see a few homeless gentlemen camping out closer to the far field near the homes, so I can't say what possible situation could happen, but it does seem maintenance or some kind of security drives them away temporarily, but when is an entirely different matter. Aside from that, my only 2 complaints would be that the lack of traditional swings would be a great addition, and the other the strong slant on the slides. It doesn't really affect older kids, but for your younger ones or ones with disabilities, you may want to soften that impact and slow them down.

pickleballReviews.author: Raine Villa
pickleballReviews.text:
Another absolute gem of a park. Nestled at the foot of a grassy ridge within a residential neighborhood in Saugus. Visit during late autumn when the tree leaves change colour.

Features a large grassy area with walking paths, a series of tennis courts that always seem to be busy, a very large children’s play area, large public restrooms, and a large parking lot.

pickleballReviews.author: Keri Aaver
pickleballReviews.text: Beautiful park, playground, and pickleball courts. The pickleball courts don't seem to use it conducive to public play, so you'll want to have your own group of 4 to play with if you go or you may be on your own or out of luck.

courts.name: Wolf + Bear Indoor Pickleball
courts.address: 14911 Calvert St, Van Nuys, CA 91411, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Pickleball System
pickleballReviews.text: This is a dedicated pickleball facility with multiple courts. Great place to play!

courts.name: Warner Center Pickleball
courts.address: 6336 Canoga Ave Trillium Parking Structure 7th Floor Rooftop Tennis Center, Woodland Hills, CA 91364, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Pickleball System
pickleballReviews.text: This is a dedicated pickleball facility with multiple courts. Great place to play!

courts.name: Granada Hills Recreation Center
courts.address: 16730 Chatsworth St, Granada Hills, CA 91344, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Andy Gomez
pickleballReviews.text: Fantastic pickleball courts! The area is well-maintained, and there’s a broom nearby in case the court needs a quick sweep for leaves. The players are incredibly friendly; someone even took the time to teach my friends and me how to play.

courts.name: Maple Hill Park
courts.address: 1355 Maple Hill Rd, Diamond Bar, CA 91765, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Alicia Romero
pickleballReviews.text:
Small, cute park with ample green space, tennis courts and seating for picnicking. It's located across from Maple Holl Elementary in a quaint neighborhood.

I didn't explore it all as I didn't have time, hence the 4-star rating.

pickleballReviews.author: Channary Voeng
pickleballReviews.text: Try to get here to play pickle ball today but saw the sign saying the park is under renovation from until summer 2025. There’s no lights at night, either. We had to look for another park to play at.

pickleballReviews.author: John Pena
pickleballReviews.text: People don’t like to rotate out at the pickleball courts. Group of 8 on 1 court; group of 7 on another court, group of 7 on the 3rd court, and a guy training a couple on the last court. Definitely won’t be back here.

pickleballReviews.author: Jorge Avalos
pickleballReviews.text: People are friendly,  courts are mostly empty during the weekdays.

courts.name: Tanager Park
courts.address: 1780 Hummingbird Dr, Costa Mesa, CA 92626, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Christy Thede
pickleballReviews.text: Poorly designed. Everything is shoved into one corner of the space, it’s basically a nightmare for parents of small children. The equipment is directly next to the pickleball and basketball courts with no barrier. The pickle ball courts which are constantly in use utilize flimsy plastic barriers to try to keep children off the courts. There is also work out equipment in this crowded area. Last time I was there, adults had tripods set up filming themselves on it. Just another place to keep my kids away from. Annoying is an understatement. Wish someone had thought this through a little better. There’s so much space, why is everything crowded together? Also, no bathrooms. And plenty of off leash dogs as is the case in most public parks in Costa Mesa despite signs posted that dogs must be on a leash.

pickleballReviews.author: Sister Nancy
pickleballReviews.text: Beautiful park! Basketball, tennis, volleyball courts and lots of open grass area. Also a workout area. No bathrooms though.

courts.name: Somerset Park
courts.address: 1500 E Carson St, Long Beach, CA 90807, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Joseph Aulai
pickleballReviews.text: Took down the volleyball poles, hoping they’ll add it back. Overall a good park, quiet neighborhood for the most part. Relatively safe park to be at. There are tennis courts, one full-court basketball court, two separate playgrounds for both kids and toddlers, and a nice open area for picnics and parties.

pickleballReviews.author: David
pickleballReviews.text: Great park. Pretty clean on the field. The outside bathroom was very clean and didn't smell like most public bathrooms do. I play basketball here. There is a workout outside area next to the basketball court, and you can freely rent workout gear as well. Lots of shade. Plenty of smiles too

courts.name: Huntington Beach Pickleball
courts.address: 15744 Goldenwest St, Huntington Beach, CA 92647, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Pickleball System
pickleballReviews.text: This is a dedicated pickleball facility with multiple courts. Great place to play!

courts.name: Tuffree Hill Park
courts.address: 2101 Tuffree Blvd, Placentia, CA 92870, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Sharlina Keshava
pickleballReviews.text:
Pickle ball players are rude and do not follow court rules. People ride their bicycles, skate boards, and scooters on the courts. Pickle ball players stand around in groups and setup chairs, and their children play in the alley on the tennis courts. They will even start warming up or hitting the pickle ball behind the tennis baseline while a tennis match is in play. These are all safety hazards, tennis players beware.

However, the courts are in good condition. ⭐ ⭐

pickleballReviews.author: S W
pickleballReviews.text: Came here on an afternoon to play pickleball for the first time as a visitor. It’s only my 3nd time playing so I was a little nervous. People are inviting & encouraging. Got invited to join other solo players to play as a group with other teams. People of all skills play here. Just be forewarned — use the bathroom before u come because the bathrooms across the park may not be opened. Weekday mornings are for the experienced & more aggressive players. If u are a novice like come, come on a weekday afternoon.  It was a great time

pickleballReviews.author: Jim Kara
pickleballReviews.text:
This small obscure park is known for team sports on the fields, as well as team and individual play of tennis, pickleball and handball on the courts.
The Gym rec center has a basketball court inside and is open on select days. Outside access is provided for the restrooms.
Also, there’s a some picnic tables for only a few people to sit and eat at.
Parking is available via Tuffree Blvd. , just north of Bastanchury Rd. or thru Tri-Cities Park, at the lower south ‘lot.

pickleballReviews.author: Luis Jasso
pickleballReviews.text: Pickle ball players set their stuff up on the tennis side, which is not allowed. Please follow the posted rules so that everyone can enjoy the facilities. They treat the tennis side like its a park sparawling blankets and lawn chairs. Do that somewhere else.

courts.name: University Community Park
courts.address: 1 Beech Tree Ln, Irvine, CA 92612, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Jeff Albillar
pickleballReviews.text:
The place is like an oasis for kid's.
There are a ton of large Lego blocks that the kids can make stuff with.
Shade everywhere.
2 restrooms, but it alright.
There is also a larger park with volleyball courts and another playground.
If you have kid's, they will have fun while you sit in the shade.
Or you can play with the Legos as well😊👍

courts.name: Murdy Park & Community Center
courts.address: 7000 Norma Dr, Huntington Beach, CA 92647, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Rebecca C
pickleballReviews.text:
Murdy Park and Community Center is a large 16.04-acres park settled near neighborhoods. There is decent parking, a community center building, a playground area and a handful of amenities surrounded by an all grassy area.

🚻 Restrooms

🐕 Bring your dogs

🧺 Benches for picnics or sitting.

🏞 Large Grass areas

🌳 Trees for shade

🚗 Parking on the street around the park or in the lot

💧 Water Fountain

🗑 Trash bins

🎾 Tennis Courts (about 6)

🏀 Basketball Courts

⚾️ Baseball Diamonds

⚽️ Soccer Field

🚲 Trail or path thru the park

🛝 3 Playground Units

The playground area is rather large sand area with rubber matting at the landings of the 2 newest playground units, with swings! 2 for infants and 2 full sized swings.

The older red/ blue/ beige playground structures are surrounded by sand and intended for ages 2-5 and another for 5-12 years old. Both structures offer slides and stairs to run along. The playground structure intended for 5-12 years old offers some climbing ladders, monkey bars, 2 slides, an off-center spiral pole and Fireman Pole. There is also swings with 2 for infants and 2 full sized swings.

In that same space is another, more modern playground unit, with many climbing and twirling components aged 5-12 years old. This unit is teal and red and has a beanstalk ladder, monkey bars and more.

Finally apart from the other unit the last of the playground structures is a large brown/green unit intended for ages 2-12 years old. There is a long ramp but it too has stairs to get to slides and the majority of the playground.

Aside from the MANY options here, Murdy Park Community Center is a huge community resource with most city sports and activities being held here. HBSands.com has more info on their latest offerings if you are interested in more details.

pickleballReviews.author: josh kim
pickleballReviews.text:
Clean tennis courts but two courts out of the four are mentioned to be under construction.

Child tennis lessons for the summer from morning until 1 pm. June 24 to aug 15 2024

Rules for reservation posted on tennis courts.

Seems pickleball court lines are not placed on tennis courts.

Pickleball lines are taped on the basketball courts and can only be used when basketball doesn't have reservations during the summer.

Reservations after 730 pm are not filled, likely available for pickleball then

Court reservations via QR code, website, or calling

pickleballReviews.author: Rosie Becerra
pickleballReviews.text:
It hurts me to know we are just covering all the good memories and fields we have in this fine city. I grew up in this country and I remember about 40 or 50 other boys running our hearts out on this field to try to make try outs for the Huntington Beach dolphins. And now there taking the memories and totally building over them. Why do we need more courts and more building that will eventually fall one way or another. Trees never grow ugly like man made materials. This park was beautiful the way it was.
Kids need fields to run and play what ever games or sports they choose. Not ones our parents or society wants.

pickleballReviews.author: M Scott
pickleballReviews.text: Awesome Bocce courts surrounded by grass and Shady trees. Great spot, lottsa fun!

courts.name: Marina Park
courts.address: 5562 Cross Dr, Huntington Beach, CA 92649, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Dyan Marion
pickleballReviews.text: This park has the best breeze first of all. At times it's hard to find parking due to the fact that it is a 6 or 7 baseball field, 4 tennis court, 8 raquetball, handball, pickleball walls, 4 basketball court park. There's a small library, 2 playgrounds, bathrooms, snack bar, 3 picnic tables, plenty of shade trees, lots of grass area very dog friendly and the people are chill here. Love this park.

pickleballReviews.author: Rebecca C
pickleballReviews.text:
Marina Park is a large 9.34 acres park settled near neighborhoods, behind Marina High School. There is decent parking, a small library, a playground and a handful of amenities surrrounded by an all grassy area.

🚻 Restrooms

🐕 This park is ideal to bring your dogs to

🧺 Benches for picnics or sitting.

🏞 Large Grass areas

🚗 Parking on the street and in a small lot

💧 Water Fountain

🗑 trash bins

Handball Courts (about 10)

🎾 Tennis Courts (about 6)

🏀 Basketball Courts

⚾️ Baseball Diamonds

The playground is rather large sand area containing 2 playground units and swings with 2 for infants and 2 full sized swings.

One of the playground structures is intended for ages 2-5 and another for 5-12 years old. Both structures offer slides and stairs to run along with the larger unit having some more climbing options added

Overall this is a great park to spend the day at and plan for a picnic or watch a baseball game.

pickleballReviews.author: Omar Barboza
pickleballReviews.text: Another beautiful park with plenty of parking spaces, baseball fields, tennis 🎾 courts and lots of space to havrle fun. Enjoy your visit and have fun.

pickleballReviews.author: Smevin Bravis
pickleballReviews.text: Park is perfect. Sweet trees with tons of shade, four tennis courts, three baseball diamonds, two basketball courts, and a huge handball/racquetball court. Add picnic tables, lots of grass, and the most adorable miniature library you've ever see, and you've got yourself a bangin park. Love it here, can't wait to be in the area again!

courts.name: Heritage Community Park
courts.address: 14301 Yale Ave, Irvine, CA 92604, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Mr. Tustin - Mauricio Roque
pickleballReviews.text: This beautiful park is a great place for families, it has a very large palyground for toddlers and bigger kids, there is also a water features (motion activated) super fun, our daughter LOVES IT! The playground is fun, and very well kept. There's basketball courts for adults and a small court for kids. Overall this is a great place to spend some family time. Our favorite part is the giant lake in the middle, it's full of ducks, turtles, geese, etc. The park also features lots of parking spaces. Fun place to visit

pickleballReviews.author: Nidnarg
pickleballReviews.text: Very nice and quiet. Enough amenities to spend all day there. My favorite amenity would be the tennis court. There are around 10, though it does get busy there at times, but a walk around the lake will help pass the time as you wait for a court.

pickleballReviews.author: Anton Rasem
pickleballReviews.text: A stunning park with scenic views and a large playground. It features a lake with ducks and geese, a small splash pad, pickleball, tennis, and basketball courts, as well as expansive grassy areas. The park is well-maintained and incredibly kid-friendly.

courts.address: 4400 San Fernando Rd, Glendale, CA 91204, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Nahrie Norvell
pickleballReviews.text: We’ve had a hard time finding good/open pickleball courts in East LA and heard about Smash Dink. Went on a Sunday morning, got to meet the owner Carolina who was so friendly & made us feel right at home off the bat. Play was great on the courts, folks were all kind, music selection is on point, and we loved it! Can’t wait to have a party here sometime 👌

pickleballReviews.author: wes west
pickleballReviews.text: Prior to visiting SD our party of four had never played pickle ball. Lauren gave us a quick lesson, it was quick to pick up. We had a great time.

pickleballReviews.author: Kevin Lee
pickleballReviews.text: Went for company outing. The environment was great, with great pickleball court, friendly owner, and incredible vibes all around. 10/10, critics rave, good owner, great dog.

pickleballReviews.text: This is a dedicated pickleball facility with multiple courts. Great place to play!

courts.address: 1495 139th St, Gardena, CA 90249, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Reynald Ruizza
pickleballReviews.text: went tonight, a Monday night. not too crowded for open play.  they had  "Live ball" going on and everyone was friendly. great place to play pickleball if your near central LA/Southbay.

courts.name: Grijalva Sports Center
courts.address: 368 N Prospect St Building B, Orange, CA 92869, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Jim Kara
pickleballReviews.text:
An upscale quality sports complex, this place is super in amenities and meticulous in maintenance!
Thanks to Amber, Josie and staff for a great job helping to keep things going here and at the park. Their exuberance is appreciated!
The building is located on the backside of Grivalja Park, beyond the outside of the basketball courts.
There’s plenty of parking at the front of the building.

pickleballReviews.author: Libby Burgtorf
pickleballReviews.text: I was only at the inside basketball courts but looked like a very, very nice facility.

pickleballReviews.author: Mike Tekle
pickleballReviews.text: Great Basketball gym where they run adult leagues out of. Two legit full courts and relatively clean floors.

courts.name: Poinsettia Recreation Center
courts.address: 7341 Willoughby Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90046, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Malgorzata Sowa
pickleballReviews.text: This park is a great spot for pretty much everyone. It's got loads of space, making it feel never too crowded. The basketball and tennis courts, along with two baseball fields, mean there’s always a game to join or watch. Dog owners will love how welcoming it is for their furry friends, and the vibe is super friendly overall. There are bathrooms, so no worries about long days out, and it's packed with fun stuff for kids and teens to do. If you're looking to get active or just hang out, this park's got you covered.

pickleballReviews.author: Jordan Jones
pickleballReviews.text:
Poinsettia Recreation Center is such a gem! It has everything—basketball, tennis, baseball, and even some gym equipment. There’s tons of open space, perfect for a field day or just letting the dogs run around. The handball courts are a nice touch too. It’s got that great local, neighborhood vibe, and it always feels really safe.

Whether you’re looking to sit and relax in the sun or get active with some sports, Poinsettia has a bit of everything. It’s the perfect spot to enjoy the outdoors and soak in some good energy. Definitely a great place to spend time with friends or family!

pickleballReviews.author: Hugo Kuylen
pickleballReviews.text: Great Place to play with your dog, family and sports like tennis. The park attendants are strict on playing on the pay to play courts. Not the best back board for playing alone.

courts.address: 19211 Studebaker Rd, Cerritos, CA 90703, USA

pickleballReviews.author: DBL.G.
pickleballReviews.text: Liberty Park and fitness center is an amazing park with plenty of activities to do here ,, plenty of tennis courts to enjoy as well as volleyball, frisbee golf , indoor fitness gym, track field for walking/jogging...along side of liberty Park is the upper San Gabriel River bike trail that is about 9 miles from seal beach for those who like cycling this is a great rest stop with maintained bathrooms.. great for family and  gatherings or just to unwind after a long days work.. recommend any who enjoys outdoor activities to come check out Liberty Park,, plenty of parking available.

pickleballReviews.author: Jon Reynoso
pickleballReviews.text: Very nice and clean park. Kids playground area is very modern and up to date with a few pickle ball courts and a walking track. They have a gated off area that residents can reserve for private events.

pickleballReviews.author: Ghanshyam Ramnani
pickleballReviews.text: This part is one the best park I ever been. It has track for running,tennis court,volleyball, indoor GYM children playground,disc catcher not oly that it has easy excess to river bed for bicycle race. This park has always busy you will be never alone.

pickleballReviews.author: LLH
pickleballReviews.text:
Nice park!! Play area great for kids!

Has track, volleyball, and tennis courts.

I like the Frisbee golf also which is simple 9 hole course..most holes 150 to 180 yards.

courts.name: iTennis/iPickle Whittier Narrows
courts.address: 1201 Potrero Ave, South El Monte, CA 91733, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Tiara Jená
pickleballReviews.text:
I love the abundance of pickleball courts and it’s such a fun community.

The Friday night socials have great music and snacks and the tournaments are always a blast.

pickleballReviews.author: Jeff Chan
pickleballReviews.text: Plenty of tennis courts and pickle ball courts. Really clean and neat. Love playing here!

pickleballReviews.author: You “You” N
pickleballReviews.text: Played pickleball here on Friday night open court play. This picture was taken at midnight. Open really late and lots of players. $15 to play. Parking is a bit challenging.

pickleballReviews.author: Michael Carralez
pickleballReviews.text:
Clean courts and nice staff. However if you park here DO NOT park in a “dirt” spot. There was a “Officer Lampkin” with the LA county sheriffs dept that came by and gave ~8 cars parking tickets for parking in spots that he considered park of the “lawn”. He said that the court had asked the sheriffs dept to do patrols of the area because understandably there is no lighting in the area.

Officer Lampkin in his zeal for his job decided it was fair to ticket everyone that was enjoying some Monday night exercise. Guess we were the big law breakers. Terrific community outreach officer.

Again - great courts but it really put a sour taste in my mouth yesterday evening. Be careful when parking.

pickleballReviews.author: Andrew Loh
pickleballReviews.text:
Where’s all the pricing / reservation info? Would love to have reference to this stuff online.

Unfortunately the website seems to lack any details about fees / reservations. Is there a per court fee? Per hour? Per day? Is there a per player fee? Per day? Per hour?

courts.name: Worthy Park
courts.address: 1801 Main St, Huntington Beach, CA 92648, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Rebecca C
pickleballReviews.text:
Worthy Park is a large 6.61 acres park settled behind Huntington Beach High School. There is decent parking, a playground and a handful of amenities surrrounded by an all grassy area.

🚻 Restrooms available. ALWAYS CLEAN!

🐕 This park is ideal to bring your dogs to

🧺 Benches for picnics or sitting.

🏞 Large Grass areas

🚗 Parking in a large lot

💧 Water Fountain

🗑 trash bins available but not often used. Weekends and Mondays are the dirtiest

🎾 Pickleball Courts (about 6)

⚾️ Baseball Diamonds

The playground is rather large rubber mat area containing 2 playground units and swings with 2 for infants and 2 full sized swings.

One of the playground structures is intended for ages 2-5 and another for 5-12 years old. Both structures offer multiple slides at varying sizes, and stairs to run along.

Overall this is a great park to spend the day at and plan for a picnic or watch a baseball game. Be aware of the homeless in the area and be prepared for a great deal of trash scattered by the birds and weekend visitors.

pickleballReviews.author: josh kim
pickleballReviews.text:
Four pickleball courts here. They have lessons here which take 2 courts. The other two is first come first serve.

No wind blocking fencing , need to adjust to wind play.

This park is right next to the high school.

Very nice courts, clean lines, and straight netting.

pickleballReviews.author: Hashim A
pickleballReviews.text: I love this spot. Clean restrooms, playground and courts

courts.name: Park West Park
courts.address: Midway City, CA 92655, USA

pickleballReviews.author: James Challender
pickleballReviews.text: I was there didn't see any Lake but I used the bathroom a couple times took a nap in the car in the shade there was a cool breeze it was nice Park had tennis courts

pickleballReviews.author: Vincent Nguyen
pickleballReviews.text: A nice park with a gazebo and several tennis courts. Overall pretty standard park that's situated next to an open home community that a lot of people walk their dogs or get some running in at.

courts.name: Mallows Park
courts.address: 520 N Indian Hill Blvd, Claremont, CA 91711, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Yoshimi
pickleballReviews.text: It was a small park, but had tennis courts.

pickleballReviews.author: Al-faro Hernández
pickleballReviews.text:
Mallows Park is a great spot for lunch or a break

It is clean, well-maintained, and quiet.

It is situated on the northeast corner of Indian Hill Boulevard and Harrison Avenue.

The picnic benches, public restrooms, tennis court, and playing field make it a versatile place for various activities.

Mallows Park is Claremont's oldest and smallest community park.

The original name was Triangle Park.

It officially opened in 1926.

It was renamed after
Reverend J.H. Mallows, who was actively involved in the community

pickleballReviews.author: Kristin mizar
pickleballReviews.text: This is a small park on Indian hill close to the village. It's quiet and quaint with a tennis court which is cool. The only downside is that there are often some shady characters around that park. Plus side - there are public restrooms!!

pickleballReviews.author: Sharon Kennon
pickleballReviews.text: Went for the tennis/pickleball court..love the park

courts.name: McDonald Park
courts.address: 1000 E Mountain St, Pasadena, CA 91104, USA

pickleballReviews.author: taylor tea
pickleballReviews.text:
This park is really nice and is the perfect size. There's a large grass area in the middle with a walking path around it that has picnic tables and seating sprinkled throughout. It's well shaded from the gorgeous trees and is generally clean and well-kept everytime I've been here.

There's a covered eating area that's perfect for birthday parties or gatherings, basketball courts, handball walls, children's play area, and bathrooms. Overall this is a great place to spend an afternoon.

pickleballReviews.author: D. de Silva
pickleballReviews.text: Large, beautiful park. Plenty of street parking around the perimeter. Park has a ton of green open space, basketball courts, handball courts, children playgrounds, benches, and trees. Highly recommend!!

courts.name: Syd Kronenthal Park
courts.address: 3459 McManus Ave, Culver City, CA 90232, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Jim Kara
pickleballReviews.text:
My turnaround at the east end of the Ballona Creek Bike Path! I enjoy a rest stop here to take a break before heading back to Playa Del Rey! For locals, it also makes a good place to depart from when riding westbound towards the ocean.
It’s a good medium sized park that’s nestled within a Culver City neighborhood. It may also serve as the site of regional play, with school teams from across the LA area.
The recreation building was closed when I’ve passed thru, tho outside access public restrooms were available on the field side. With game play and spectators, these small facilities may be overwhelmed and messy.
It has lot’s of free parking, shaded picnic tables, sports fields, BBQ’s, playground, recreation building and a tennis court. The park is within constant view of the Wrapper Building of Culver City and frequently, the Metro E-Line light rail train in passing.

courts.name: Public Outdoor Pickleball Courts
courts.address: 7200 Plaza St, Westminster, CA 92683, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Pickleball System
pickleballReviews.text: This is a dedicated pickleball facility with multiple courts. Great place to play!

courts.name: Newport Ridge Community Park
courts.address: 6331 Newport Ridge Dr E, Newport Coast, CA 92657, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Daniel Seyyedi
pickleballReviews.text: Its a nice and quiet park with plenty of space for kids. There a kids playground. Few basketball courts. Shelters with bench and bbq grills.

pickleballReviews.author: Tiana G
pickleballReviews.text: Nice and small community park. Has tennis courts, basketball courts, tables, a playground, and plenty of benches & trees along with shady spots.

courts.name: Garvey Park
courts.address: 7933 Emerson Pl, Rosemead, CA 91770, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Kaia Kim
pickleballReviews.text: Neat little dog park. Pretty easy to find as you see the dog prints near the parking lot. Lots of grass and pretty spacious even tho as someone mentioned the large dog area is in a T shape next to the tennis courts. Seems like a good use of extra space. As another reviewer also mentioned it seems they don’t come daily to clean the park as the trash cans were full and the dispensers were empty but saving that there was only a little bit of poop someone didn’t seem to pick up near the entrance of the dog park. There are also shaded tables on each end of the large dog side and other benches spread out in the middle. I didn’t explore the rest of the park. It it also seemed very clean and full of plush grass if you decide to walk around (which I have not done yet).  Also parking is very ample!

pickleballReviews.author: Carlo N.
pickleballReviews.text: Garvey Park is a well maintained and family oriented small-midsize park in SG Valley. No sketchy homeless folks around the park. It’s located in a good working middle class neighborhood. This park has plenty of amenities such as Tennis Courts, Baseball Fields, Fitness Zones, Picnic Tables, Children's Play Areas, Swimming Pools, Splash Pads, Gymnasiums and Restrooms. Parking lot is small, however, ample of street parking. Overall, it’s a good park to chill, enjoy family picnic and play sports.

pickleballReviews.author: Calvin Blinkenberg
pickleballReviews.text:
Got my first puppy who coincidentally happened to be born right around the same time this place opened. Gotta say it's my favorite, not only because it's the closest and most convenient dog park near the house; but also because it has a nice design. First off, it shares a fence with tennis courts which means a steady supply of free tennis balls for the pups which is giving engineering at it's best. As well, the small and larger dog sections are both fairly substantial for the modest amount of space they had to work with. The two sections are also separated by a chain link fence with a wooden base board to encourage friendly interaction but still limit any unwanted unfriendliness. My dog is larger but gentle and so a puppy so with the consent of any owners there, I can usually enjoy both sides. Because of course with a public dog park the only real downside is when you get a bad dog owner but as long as you watch your dog and don't just start playing on your phone it's usually nothing too bad. Also some people suck so you do need to watch out for the occasional landmine of abandoned poop but I will say it's not that bad and if probably better than most averages. It seems like the city does a good job maintaining it, keeping it stocked with free poop bags emptying the trash and cleaning up after most of the aforementioned landmine leavers. It does seem like the park keeps on having one area become a bit muddy even without rain so I wonder if there is an issue to be addressed with the sprinklers or drainage. But that's a mild concern and the excellent water bowl, fountain and bottle filling stations are so good!

Will stay a go to of mine

pickleballReviews.author: Claire Lee
pickleballReviews.text:
A small park with picnic tables, restrooms, fitness area, tennis courts, and grassy area for other sports.

I saw this very sweet cat here and I found my ultimate happiness :)

courts.name: Brush Canyon Park
courts.address: 28282 Brush Canyon Dr, Yorba Linda, CA 92887, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Arun Raj Ramalingam
pickleballReviews.text: Nice little park. Rail road right behind so noisy when train is passing by. 2 lighted tennis courts. Children's play area and picnic area.

pickleballReviews.author: Rich Vohra
pickleballReviews.text:
My kids recently attended an agility training camp at Brush Canyon Park in Yorba Linda, and they absolutely loved it! The park offers a variety of amenities, including benches, basketball courts, tennis courts, and a huge grass field where they did their training. The location is off of Gypsum Canyon, and it’s very clean and spacious.

I highly recommend Brush Canyon Park for anyone looking for a great place for sports activities or just a day out with the family. It’s well-maintained and has everything you need for a fun and active day.

courts.name: Westfield Park
courts.address: Palos Verdes Peninsula, CA 90274, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Tony Fu
pickleballReviews.text: We came here mainly for hiking, there is a nice tennis court. Walking towards Crenshaw, you can have a quick visit of Pueblo, the beautiful and friendly horse. Walking the other way, the trail terrain and unpaved surface are slightly challenging. It’s fun hike with fresh nature and some city view.

pickleballReviews.author: Dan Grant
pickleballReviews.text: Geocaching adventure. Peaceful area, cute micro park with one tennis court.

courts.name: Tennis/Pickle ball Courts - Rossmoor Park
courts.address: 3232 Hedwig Rd, Los Alamitos, CA 90720, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Neelabh Choudhary
pickleballReviews.text: Nice courts!

courts.name: Portola Springs Pickle Ball Courts

pickleballReviews.author: Jesse Wang

pickleballReviews.author: Ela Tzaferi

Alexa
Call me if u have questions
Alexa

pickleballReviews.author: Alex Yerkes
pickleballReviews.text: Only 4 but good pickleball courts. 1 challenge court for the really good players, 2-3 courts depending if a lesson is going or not for all skill levels. People are nice and will play down to your level

courts.name: Student Recreation Center
courts.address: 800 N State College Blvd, Fullerton, CA 92831, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Tati Morales
pickleballReviews.text: The Cal State Fullerton Student Recreation Center is an excellent facility for both students and visitors looking to stay active. The center is spacious, modern, and well-equipped with a wide range of fitness options, from state-of-the-art cardio machines to free weights and strength training equipment. It also features basketball courts, a rock climbing wall, and a swimming pool, offering something for every type of workout. The staff is friendly and always available to assist, and the atmosphere is welcoming, whether you're a beginner or an experienced athlete. Additionally, the center offers various fitness classes and intramural sports leagues, making it easy to stay engaged and motivated. Whether you’re looking to get in a quick workout or enjoy recreational activities, the CSUF Student Recreation Center provides a top-tier experience.

pickleballReviews.author: collin rada
pickleballReviews.text: The workers don’t do their work and are very lazy.  they don’t clean the courts at all even with requesting this a major safety hazard

courts.name: Queen Anne Recreation Center
courts.address: Queen Anne Park, 1240 West Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90019, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Carlos F Vilchez
pickleballReviews.text: Nice park in the neighborhood. Came Sunday morning to do a bit of yoga and play some basketball. Park has new workout machines that are all open to the public next to the kids playground and the basketball court. Mostly street parking but there is a lot you might have some luck at. Park also has a baseball field and about 3 tennis courts.

pickleballReviews.author: Chan Eats
pickleballReviews.text: There’s this rude tennis ball boy who doesn’t know how to nicely tell people there’s a 30min time limit for the tennis courts. I still had fun though.

pickleballReviews.author: Bruce Nelson
pickleballReviews.text: Holy cow they redid this thing even better than it was before yes they had tennis courts yes they had a ballfield yes they had grass and basketball courts but now they have a workout area and a playground and a picnic area is great location nice and clean nice people that go there highly recommend it I like it even better now.

courts.name: Lyon Recreation Center
courts.address: 1026 W 34th St, Los Angeles, CA 90089, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Chethan Surendran
pickleballReviews.text: A great resource for USC community to stay fit part from the village fitness center. You have to reserve the time slot in advance. Basketball court is now closed. However Racquetball courts are open for reservation. The facility gets busy in the mornings. It also has swimming pools. Its clean and has locker facilities as well.

courts.name: Trinity Recreation Center
courts.address: 2415 Trinity St, Los Angeles, CA 90011, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Juaquin Vides
pickleballReviews.text:
Nice park!
Basketball court
Soccer field :NO CLEATS allowed
Public bathroom available.
Street vendors: Great food

Cons:
Parking is hard to find.

courts.name: Montecito Heights Community Center
courts.address: 4545 Homer St, Los Angeles, CA 90031, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Monica Pan
pickleballReviews.text: Not a bad park right off the freeway yet tucked into a residential area..nice jungle gym for kids, basketball courts, a couple of large fenced in fields. It looks like they have a senior center and another small building next to it. Large graffiti mural next to the bathroom area. The bathroom entrance looked downright scary but I generally never go to the bathroom at parks. Nice park to go during the day but like most parks it’s always best to go during the day. Lots of parking at the park next to the rec center.

courts.name: Hoover Recreation Center
courts.address: 1010 W 25th St, Los Angeles, CA 90007, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Frank MacGyver
pickleballReviews.text: Small park. A few trees for shade, picnic tables and hot coals dispensers. There's a nice playground for kids, basketball court, a field for soccer or baseball or playing tag, exercise equipment, restrooms and a gym.

courts.name: Downey Recreation Center
courts.address: 1772 N Spring St, Los Angeles, CA 90031, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Pauline **
pickleballReviews.text: A really nice park for soccer. They also had a basketball court, and a playground. Plenty of benches to sit on throughout the park. Best of all is the view of downtown at night.

pickleballReviews.author: Frank
pickleballReviews.text: Great place to bring the family to enjoy a day or night at the park.  Gym is very clean, restrooms have been newly redone, courts are in excellent shape, kid play ground is state of the art, soccer fields are great and baseball field is also impressive,  come and have a family fun day!

pickleballReviews.author: Mostafa Mahmood
pickleballReviews.text: I didn’t know that there is a nice little park at that corner… 2 mini soccer ground, mini baseball and football ground, kids park, basketball court and even a tiny little gym… loved it…

pickleballReviews.author: Sheila A Garcia
pickleballReviews.text: Downey Recreation Center is an excellent spot to get your family bonding underway. The gym was clean, the restrooms were newly renovated, and the sports courts and fields were in top shape. There is a state of the art playground for kids and plenty of benches surrounded by beautiful landscaping to not only play around in but also hang loose. Get a quality day out with your family at the Downey Recreation Center!

courts.name: Northridge Recreation Center
courts.address: 18300 Lemarsh St, Northridge, CA 91324, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Michael Diehl
pickleballReviews.text: Nice Park. Relaxing, but really the only downside is that there are so many holes in the ground that are quite deep and I almost rolled my ankle a few times because of the fact that there is so many deep holes and a lot of them are hidden by grass. We were playing between the tennis courts and the baseball field and there were quite a few holes. Needs to be patched up so no one hurts themselves.

courts.name: Bellevue Recreation Center

courts.name: Pecan Recreation Center

pickleballReviews.author: christof andre
pickleballReviews.text:
New indoor court, great outdoor covered court.

Great STAFF, ok Refs, kids need to play harder or programs need better coaching. Something needs to happen here.

pickleballReviews.author: Yü Wu
pickleballReviews.text:
I visited the park on a weekday morning and it looked lifeless. The pool is empty, restrooms are all locked, park is mostly empty and silent, the only people in the park are a few homeless and some might have spent the night here.
Otherwise this looks like a decent recreation center. There is a big field, a playground, the basketball courts are roofed!

pickleballReviews.author: Michael Clark
pickleballReviews.text: Never actually been in the gym part, but I've heard it's nice. The outdoor basketball court is pretty nice, and its covered so it doesn't get too hot. The public bathrooms are pretty gross, but still usable. It's a cool place.

courts.name: Whittier Community Center
courts.address: 7630 Washington Ave, Whittier, CA 90602, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Michael F
pickleballReviews.text: This place is great. Every city needs a place like this for their community to strive. Courteous and friendly staff as well.

pickleballReviews.author: CONNIE MORALES
pickleballReviews.text: The workers there were very courteous and helpful. I had a lot of questions and they didn't mind answering

courts.name: Rowland Heights Community Center

pickleballReviews.author: DBL.G.
pickleballReviews.text: This is a very well kept facility here for the community that provides Several tennis courts that are fenced off and a Basketball court that is very clean..there is a hall here for rentals for special occasions , they have land base activities here for dancing ,, instrument lessons and other educational activities. There are community staff leaders and a maintenance crew onsite . The bathroom's here are +10 on my books as the cleanest bathrooms I've been in all of my visits of Community Regional centers or any park for that matter.there is plenty of parking here also. There have been upgrades obviously to this beautiful Rowland Heights Community Center and a job well done for this community. I'm sure the residents here agree. Recommend a visit to this place. Above this center is Pathfinder Community Regional Park.

courts.name: Palms Park and Community Center

pickleballReviews.author: Spezialkrafte 03

courts.name: Palomares Park Community Center

pickleballReviews.text: Took my 3 yr old daughter, she had a blast. It's kind of small but big enough for her to explore. There's swings and jungle gym as well as an enclosed basketball court.  Small enough for easy monitoring but big enough to fill her afternoon. Recommended for all ages. Seating area and drinking fountain included.

pickleballReviews.author: Esteban Orizaba

courts.name: The Sports Park
