pickleballReviews.author: Tony Merc'd it
pickleballReviews.text: Scott soccer field basketball courts trail to walk and take your kids lot of helpful useful signs disabled parking playground as well Good place to bring the family

pickleballReviews.author: Angel Baltazar
pickleballReviews.text: Arrived at the park to enjoy a peaceful breakfast by myself found a nice empty grass area just adjacent of the basketball courts. I was Disturbed and rudely surrounded by hula hoops soccer balls obstacle course contraption that were being set up by the gentleman who apparently charges the community two exercise and get the kids moving without a proper permit .  i kindly ask the gentleman did I need to be worried about getting hit in the head while sitting down eating my breakfast his rude comment is what disturbs me the most, well yes ...   I do this all the time I asked the gentleman do you have a permit to hold these paid for sessions he replied no so he moved over just a little maybe about 10 feet away and continue to set up his obstacle course there were other areas that were bare of grass and I just found it to be very rude of him on a Sunday morning to be very inconsiderate about the fact that I was trying to enjoy my Sunday morning breakfast so if you visit this park make sure you don't see a gentleman and a Truck setting up obstacle courses completely around you and making money on city parks without permits.

courts.name: Veterans Sports Park
courts.address: 1645 Valencia Ave, Tustin, CA 92782, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Cesar Rocha
pickleballReviews.text: I am wondering why it’s Saturday @ 5:00pm and the park on google says open but the only lights that are on are the pickle ball courts. The lights in the north direction of this photo is the RV park behind the veterans sports park.

pickleballReviews.author: Jash (Team SoHo)
pickleballReviews.text: Good place to bring the kids. I hope the picture illustrates how nice is the park. As you can see there are courts for vball, bball, sball, tennis. There's also a track and skate park. The kids have a brand new playground area and it's very clean and well maintained.

pickleballReviews.text: Clean historic park very spacious, has basketball courts, skate ramps, soccer fields, and many more amenities, also a very good community here.

courts.name: Brea Sports Park

pickleballReviews.author: Jeanne L
pickleballReviews.text: There’s so much room to run around with my kids especially when there’s no games going on. There’s a basketball court, soccer, & playground. We love it here!

pickleballReviews.text: Very large complex supports many types of sports. It has two full size basketball courts. Clean restrooms and very well manicured grounds.

pickleballReviews.author: Paul Sullivan
pickleballReviews.text: Very nice sand courts total of 5 courts. Ideally the boarders at the back could be longer and the sand a little deeper but I was very impressed. The best outdoor net system I've ever seen. Net tension and height adjustment are independent so you can easily adjust the height of the net without messing with net tension. There are even spectator bleachers.

pickleballReviews.text: The sand is good now and the lights are great. It's very pretty at night here. Eventually the city will put material around the courts to keep balls from rolling down the hills and into the rough. It was designed to look great but it doesn't function well when balls roll all over the place.  It's currently a very hard to find, try to park in Lot 4. If you can make your way to the Carousel or the soccer stadium you are where you need to be.

pickleballReviews.author: Tony Alfiere
pickleballReviews.text: Pickleball...even if you come alone, you will pick up a game here.

pickleballReviews.author: Celina Garcia
pickleballReviews.text: My son started soccer training session on Sundays. I enjoy seating and watching the kids play. They also have tennis courts and also enjoy watching the matches.

pickleballReviews.author: Levi Schultz
pickleballReviews.text: I play hockey here, and the lights are pieces of crap but for the tennis court, they have the strongest lights I have ever seen, we have contacted the city about fixing the lights for the hockey rink but they keep giving BS responses like "we are working on it"

pickleballReviews.author: Shawn J Burke
pickleballReviews.text:
Local public park.  Heavily used by soccer, baseball, hockey, and other youth sports teams.  Home fields for AYSO 59.

Field conditions are descent but not perfect. Natural grass.

Outside roller hockey rink.

Outside racketball/tennis concrete courts.

Parking in main lot will fill during weekend games.  You can park in an adjacent school lot.   That lot lways has room, and adds less than 5 minutes to your walk.

Recently a taco vendor has been there on busy soccer Saturdays.  Which is awesome.

courts.name: LMU Tennis Center

pickleballReviews.author: Phil Pellouchoud
pickleballReviews.text: Viewing sucks.  I don’t know who designed this court configuration, but viewing is horrible.

pickleballReviews.author: Kyle Woodland
pickleballReviews.text: Beautiful and well kept courts. Usually open to the students and the public, and a great place to spend a Saturday afternoon!

courts.name: MoBear’s Tennis Courts

pickleballReviews.author: Clyde Cld
pickleballReviews.text: Even though the courts are open at night, the lights are not working...

courts.name: Sunset Tennis Courts

pickleballReviews.author: Manish D.
pickleballReviews.text: Lights stay on till 10:30p.  They have league play on Tuesday and Thursday, so hard to get courts for first come basis.  Otherwise only payment during weekdays is to pay for the parking in the structure which is like $9 for two hrs or something.

pickleballReviews.author: JC Chen
pickleballReviews.text: Good clean courts.

courts.name: Penmar Recreation Center Tennis Court
courts.address: Venice, CA 90291, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Agent 99
pickleballReviews.text: Newly surfaced courts, but ambiguous and frustrating reservations system. You have to wait in line in person. Also super noisy as it runs parallel to Rose Avenue and located right under the airport runway. With all the cars zooming by and planes taking off over your head, there’s no way to hear your opponent say the score. You need to learn sign language to be able to communicate.

pickleballReviews.author: Cristina Cabalquinto
pickleballReviews.text:
This review is specifically for Eddie and their system of reserving their tennis courts.

My bf and I got there at 9 am, we’ve only been here on Sundays so we’ve never had to reserve a court. We go to the office and my bf talks to Eddie, he says that all the courts are reserved and we should come back at 9:45 am to reserve courts for the 10-11 am hour.

We agreed, we wanted to follow their reservation system. Fair.

We come back at 9:45 am and Eddie books us court 4. As we go to court 4, he comes by and tells my bf, sorry you can’t play in this court because I forgot I promised it to these two girls.

My bf said okay.. but those girls weren’t in line. You said you have to make a reservation at 9:45 am so those girls were “promised” courts way before their own policy (just based on Eddie, I guess?).

Point is: Their system is based on Eddie. He promises courts ahead of time for people but doesn’t value those who wait their time that Eddie said was policy. So he doesn’t even follow their own rules and policies. Good job, Eddie!

pickleballReviews.author: Dj Darren
pickleballReviews.text: These are great courts, I play here with my homies sometimes. Brand new painted only a few months ago.

pickleballReviews.author: Peter Stewart
pickleballReviews.text: 6 courts with no fencing in-between. The courts are in need of resurfacing

courts.name: Elysian Park Tennis Courts

pickleballReviews.author: Nicole Ridgely
pickleballReviews.text: Nice couple of courts, seems well maintained.  Usually they’re occupied but was surprised to find them empty early Sunday evening.  Plenty of parking around.

courts.name: Los Cerritos Park Tennis Court

pickleballReviews.author: Gary Wu

pickleballReviews.author: Alexandra Pencer
pickleballReviews.text:
Great park, big soft ball field. Nice playground for kids.
They also have really good tennis courts

pickleballReviews.author: DT Comer
pickleballReviews.text: Not crowded early. Good hidden spot for tennis. It will be amazing when they get the 2nd set of courts finished.

pickleballReviews.author: Jake La Fronz
pickleballReviews.text: beautiful, not enough courts, but they are beautiful now

pickleballReviews.author: Tao Of DAO
pickleballReviews.text:
Nice that there's a tennis wall, but you can't use it when people are playing on both courts.

There was a transient guy with all his stuff behind the gym last time I was there. Probably harmless, but don't leave your kids unsupervised.

courts.name: Jim Gilliam Park Tennis Court

pickleballReviews.text: They have 2 courts for tennis, and one of the courts has been converted into a skate park. There is so much going on in this obscure park---playground, baseball diamonds, etc. It's a lot larger than it initially appears.

pickleballReviews.author: Monica Ticas

pickleballReviews.author: Edward G Yeo
pickleballReviews.text: Great park with exercise machines, tennis courts, basketball courts and it's nice to walk. Accessible from La Brea but all the buildings are closed now so no bathrooms.

pickleballReviews.author: Miles Silverman

courts.name: South Gate Park Tennis Courts

pickleballReviews.author: Cristobal Gutierrez
pickleballReviews.text: The courts aren't exactly level (slight grade), but considering how they were before and what part of the greater LA area they're in, these courts are pretty good. If u hit ur tennis balls over the fence there are lots of passers-by who are cool enough to throw them back to u.

courts.name: Scherer Park Tennis Courts

pickleballReviews.author: paty “CAMILIA” R
pickleballReviews.text: I really enjoyed playing tennis with new friends.  Saturdays and Sundays i usually see people playing doubles.  Very fun and friendly. I found this place by accident 4 well maintained courts .  😀

pickleballReviews.author: Russ Lacuata
pickleballReviews.text: Well-maintained tennis courts.

pickleballReviews.author: Mari Garcia
pickleballReviews.text: He must be more excited on the tennis court

courts.name: Valencia Heritage Park Tennis Courts

pickleballReviews.author: Drew
pickleballReviews.text:
Nice courts, but generally only 1 court is open every night because there are endless classes on the other two every day day of the week. :(

So if it’s taken you’re SOL.

Why did the city feel it necessary to only build 3 courts at every bloody park?!

courts.name: Mar Vista Recreation Center Tennis Courts
courts.address: Los Angeles, CA 90066, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Rebecca Scott
pickleballReviews.text: The fact that there are six courts is great, and I appreciate that we can play at night.  I've found that the courts are slippery and the ones closest to the park drop a lot of leaves on the courts that aren't often cleaned up.  The courts tend to get really busy in the evenings, but early mornings and midday there are open courts.

pickleballReviews.author: Samara Reed
pickleballReviews.text: 6 tennis courts that are open for play, you don’t have to reserve them ahead of time. Most parks on the west side only have 2 courts so this park has a better set up for most likely finding a court open at any given time. However I have waited up to an hour for a court before, and I’ve seen people disregard the rules and play longer than they are supposed to even though there is a queue. That is not the parks fault but something to be mindful of!

pickleballReviews.author: Christopher Roman
pickleballReviews.text: Since there are 6 courts here, we were able to get a spot after failing to do so at two other parks. The courts are lighted as well! The only downside is the courts are not in great condition. PLEASE fix the nets and do some basic maintenance!

courts.name: La Cañada Flintridge Tennis Courts
courts.address: 4490 Cornishon Ave, La Cañada Flintridge, CA 91011, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Garen Alaverdian
pickleballReviews.text: There are 8 courts at this location and one can usually get a free one to use aftter a short wait. The courts are well maintained.

pickleballReviews.author: Ben Lee
pickleballReviews.text: So busy courts.  But it has 8 courts.

pickleballReviews.author: G G
pickleballReviews.text: UTTERLY ridiculous venue for such an affluent community! When the courts were resurfaced a few years ago (for a six-figure sum), they were not properly prepared and began to crack/delaminate before the warranty was up less than a year later. Very little was done to correct the issue after I complained to the city, then only lip service. Actually waiting for a lawsuit against the city that we'll have to pay for when someone trips and breaks a kneecap or something! DISGRACEFUL!!!

pickleballReviews.author: Robert Hogg

courts.name: Rancho Cienega Recreation Center Tennis Court

There are cameras in the park patrol by the police department I'm assuming so it makes the park feels pretty safe.

courts.name: CSUDH Tennis Courts

pickleballReviews.text: Lots of open tennis courts are available on weekends when I play. The best part is they have a hitting wall to practice on, kinda rare in these parts. They also have a baseball field and a park with nice benches.

Atleast there's still a restroom, just remember to BYOB. The community garden is relatively new and nice. I guess you could get water from the spiget(if there is 1).

courts.name: Pueblo Park

pickleballReviews.author: Elena Chernousova

pickleballReviews.author: Ren Unt
pickleballReviews.text:
Dinksf Pickleball Place has quickly become my favorite spot for playing pickleball in San Francisco. The staff here are incredibly welcoming and friendly, creating a great atmosphere for both beginners and experienced players alike.

What makes Dinksf special is the convenience of having water and bathrooms right on site. It may not seem like a big deal, but it's a rarity on SF pickleball courts and adds to the overall enjoyable experience.

Playing indoors at Dinksf eliminates the wind factor, allowing you to focus solely on your game. The organization and management of the facility are on point, making reservations easy, and they host fun events at reasonable prices that bring the pickleball community together.

The coaching here is exceptional, whether you're a newbie looking to learn the basics or an advanced player aiming to improve. The instructors are patient and dedicated to helping you become a better player.

In summary, Dinksf Pickleball Place is a top-notch pickleball venue in San Francisco with friendly staff, indoor courts, and great coaching. It's my go-to spot for pickleball in the city

pickleballReviews.author: Ashlei Khanthaphixay
pickleballReviews.text:
DinkSF is one of the best places to play pickleball and meet other players (of all levels). I look forward to every Sunday for open play from 2:30-5:30pm!!! I've met so many great people, coaches, and really think my pickleball skills have improved by practicing here. It's a super fun way to meet people on top of getting an incredible workout!

One of the owners, John, is very sweet and welcoming. He would watch when I play and give me pointers that have really helped improve my game! I've seen him do this for everyone and you can tell he's really passionate about helping others improve.

Whether you're a pro at pickleball, or just learning, I highly recommend coming to DinkSF!

pickleballReviews.author: Kathy Cheun
pickleballReviews.text: I get it now, I understand why pickleball is so popular. I started with a beginner’s class, have taken a number of workshops and now I play twice a week most weeks at Open Play, Thursdays and Sundays. It’s a great indoor facility, parking is easy, and most importantly the people that play here are friendly and supportive. All the coaches are awesome and it’s just a great community.

pickleballReviews.author: Geo W
pickleballReviews.text:
This place can do a lot better! The "Experience" isn't really on par with the prices they charge. This is my input as a member for a few months now.

On my first time coming here to play, I wasn't given any instructions on how to que up for games. I even had to ask the receptionist for a tour, but he didn't even try to guide me anywhere, nor did he explain anything. I played for a few weeks before I even knew they had a locker room, sauna,  and showers...

This was way different than the Hub in San Jose. Nonetheless, I was able to figure everything out on my own by exploring and talking to other players. They really need to be better at introducing new clients to the space if they want to grow.

Not having staff that are welcoming or motivated to grow their business will definitely hurt them in the long run. I recommend they have a checklist for what to tell new visitors and a quick tour around the facility to show them around.

Next would be the amenities. They have showers, but no towel service. So you have to bring your own towel to shower every time. At the prices, they charge monthly or even daily, they should have towels. Also, the main water fountain to fill up your water bottle in the front lobby seems to constantly be out of service. They should add another one there to help. Everyone uses it so it's better to have more. Having to walk up the stairs to refill your water bottle sucks when you've been playing all day.

Lastly, for exposure, they have no real marketing plan to get new members for pickleball. Sometimes I come here on what should be busy days, and find that almost nobody is playing. It would be nice if there were more people to play with. So, being able to bring someone with you for free if you're a member would be a good place to start. They did have a special "event" this week that allows members to bring one extra person with them, but apparently, it's "only for fitness" so no pickleball. Wow, what a lame plan to celebrate your founding. This would have been a great way to get more people to come and play, but they missed the drive with that one.

The weekend hours are what I really don't get. They close at 8pm on Saturday and 6pm on Sunday. They should be closed later on those days since most people are off of work. But, it seems like they might be understaffed to even have those hours.

Honestly, I'm really considering to stop coming here once spring or summer. But, I might be persuaded if they make this place better. I really doubt that will happen unless they get new management or an actual marketing team.

Some good things about this place are: Plenty of parking that seems safe. Sometimes, they have good events. (when it's announced or promoted right) The indoor lighting and temperature is perfect. The outdoor court lighting is okay.

This place has so much potential to be the best place to play in the area. I hope they do better.

pickleballReviews.author: Steven Richards
pickleballReviews.text: Best gym in Alameda by a mile. I’m a little upset at myself for not finding it sooner. It’s huge and has everything you need to be active and recover. I just joined and haven’t used the pickleball courts yet but the staff is super helpful in guiding you in the process (which is easy). Everything is renovated and clean. Nice selection of gym equipment that’s new (unlike the equipment from the 80’s you’ll be paying the same price for at Alameda Fitness and Spa)…. Clean steam room and sauna. Drink and snack bar. CLEAN locker room. Oh and the view 👌🏼

pickleballReviews.author: Ed VanTil
pickleballReviews.text: This is it! The best club around, for pickleball, working out, wet or dry sauna, fitness classes. A+. I play pickleball here twice a week, there are 7 indoor courts, and 8 outdoor courts. The videos are from a recent Pro event.

pickleballReviews.author: Carlos Thomas
pickleballReviews.text:
This is an A+ venue. If you want to be able to play indoors or outdoors in Alameda, you can’t beat this facility. There are 8 courts inside and 7 courts outside, which are smartly placed on the side of the building that doesn’t get as much wind. The nice thing about the courts are they are separated by skill level. Each court has a rating on them with a paddle rack. In addition, they have some challenge courts where the winners stay on.

$135 per month or $25 for drop in play for non-members. Some might see $135 per month costly, but if you are someone who lives near Alameda, loves the sport and plays multiple times a week…what is $135?

pickleballReviews.author: Angela Sundin
pickleballReviews.text:
The Hub is a great place to play pickleball. The facility and the courts are in good shape. The people who play there are generally friendly and welcoming. The lighting for the indoor courts is solid and there are places to sit on the sidelines and watch people play. They bring in outside vendors regularly to provide massages, stretching, etc.
One thing I would say they could improve on is to fix the outdoor lighting.

The Parks and Rec staff keep close eyes on their kids, and the baseball field merges into other open areas as well as the paths along the surrounding waterways.
A library branch finishes the setup, making this a very nice public space.

pickleballReviews.text: A cute little park with a Tennis & basketball court, baseball diamond, a jungle gym and a small library. There are only a few picnic tables. But it is so close the Harbor Bay shopping center which has quite a few good restraunts. Also near the park are walking biking paths that run along a whole string of lagoons lined with flowers, willows, wooden bridges and water birds.

courts.name: Marin Indoor Pickleball
courts.address: 440 Smith Ranch Rd, San Rafael, CA 94903, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Pickleball System
pickleballReviews.text: This is a dedicated pickleball facility with multiple courts. Great place to play!

courts.name: Bay Padel
courts.address: 29 Avenue G, San Francisco, CA 94130, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Deej
pickleballReviews.text: Awesome gym! I love coming here to play pickleball every week. The atmosphere is great: social environment with tons of friendly players, but also can find some real competition. The staff are very helpful and will answer all your questions. They even pushed me to play Padel one time and I loved it. I’d recommend to anyone wanting to find an activity that is fun, easy to learn, with friendly players of all levels. The social aspect is what makes you come back. They do tournaments, parties, DJs, and other socials. Outside the courts they have corn hole, ping pong, a small workout area, tv, music, and couches around the gym. Plus they just got a pool table.

pickleballReviews.author: Yusi
pickleballReviews.text:
This place is amazing! Thank you for doing this for the community! It got paddle ball, pickleball, tennis, table tennis, and places to hang out.
Used to be an old navy hanger that was obsoleted long ago. The building itself is amazing.

pickleballReviews.author: Greg Bybee
pickleballReviews.text:
Fantastic sports club for pickleball, padel, and ping pong. Outstanding courts and plenty of equipment for rent or purchase.

Great for personal fitness or company events! In fact, you can even rent out the space, and there’s tons of room for festivities.

Easy to get to if you have a car and plenty of free parking. If you’re coming from SF, there’s no bridge toll. Treasure Island is a fun place to spend an afternoon- grab food at Mersea and a drink at Gold Bar or Treecraft Distillery.

Glad they opened a (smaller) location in Dogpatch, but with it had more pickleball (it’s primarily padel).

pickleballReviews.author: Steve Guttbinder
pickleballReviews.text: Blown away by this place! I discovered Padel when visiting a friend in Las Vegas and thought I’d see if there were any places to play in the Bay Area… and lo and behold this place just had their grand opening! Located on Treasure Island, it’s a bit of a drive especially with all the TI construction, but it’s worth it. Located in an old hanger, the space feels industrial in a good way, had well lit and maintained courts, and has racket rentals too. Fingers crossed this becomes more of a thing out here in addition to becoming more accessible. I passed on feedback that on their website they don’t really include details about their “Memberships” other than reduced rate court time (vs. other benefits such as discounts on gear, if there is any free court time, access to certain things etc.)

courts.name: Arrillaga Center for Sports and Recreation
courts.address: 341 Galvez St, Stanford, CA 94305, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Jade Huang
pickleballReviews.text: A manager in ACSR doesn’t let us set up volleyball court when there’s empty court on 2023-03-18 morning. The policy is first come first serve. Though he claimed that one soccer team will come, but the team never come. We don’t even know if it is real. We have over 12 people waiting at the front desk for 1.5 hrs with a empty court. His manner is mean and did not help solve any problems. I will file a serious complaint to Stanford with pictures of him.

courts.name: Glen Park Recreation Center
courts.address: 70 Elk St, San Francisco, CA 94131, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Elliot Schwartz
pickleballReviews.text: Newly renovated playground looks great. It has a low wooden play structure for toddlers, and an elaborate rope structure for older kids. Slides are built into a rocky hill. Rubber base. Restrooms in the rec center building. Sport courts still under construction.

courts.name: Golden Gate Recreation Center
courts.address: 1075 62nd St, Oakland, CA 94608, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Dream League
pickleballReviews.text: One of the best places to play basketball, especially indoors. We run some of our basketball league games there and it even has a shot clock with a nice spacious court with bleachers and even a stage (we utilize NBA rules/format, email us if you’re interested). Also outside there’s a playground with soft surface, outdoor blacktop court, and baseball field. We have only run our leagues at this location on weekends and can say that it seems on weekends, this modern, kid-friendly venue appears under-utilized.

courts.name: Upper Noe Recreation Center
courts.address: 295 Day St, San Francisco, CA 94131, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Robert Rivera
pickleballReviews.text: Great dog park within Upper Noe not to mention a huge baseball diamond, a basketball court inside and outside with the indoor basketball court doubling as multiple pickleball courts and the outdoor tennis court also available for pickleball via reservation.  Upper Noe also features a nice playground for the little ones and is full of parents and nanny's minding the kids.  All in all a great neighborhood rec center!

pickleballReviews.author: Karli P
pickleballReviews.text: Great place to bring your kids, has an outdoor play areas including a tennis & basketball courts, baseball field, indoor basketball court, indoor multi-use gym, which they use for exercise classes, as well as little kids play area, and a dog area which’s great for the dogs to run and play. They also have 2 bathroom areas which is great cause the park is always very busy all the time. Overall a great place. One thing I didn’t like was that they put up signs in their hallway area so no child care giver is allow to hang out and have a snack there. Very sad to have seen those prohibitions posted on their walls.

pickleballReviews.author: Emilie Porter
pickleballReviews.text: Wonderful neighborhood recreation center. A playground for the kids, friendly off-leash dog park (clay/dirt grounds) tennis courts, basketball hoops, and a baseball field are all packed in this safe and clean park. Just off Sanchez, with slow streets is a great place to walk the dogs.

courts.name: Richmond Recreation Center
courts.address: 251 18th Ave, San Francisco, CA 94121, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Neal
pickleballReviews.text:
Well-maintained recreation center with frequent events, basketball court open to the public, and ping-pong on Fridays.

This place was very clean when I visited, and had plenty of people, but wasn't crowded. The hallway has flyers and some art, and a calendar with the month's events. There are water fountains and restrooms. Outside, there are some concrete benches with words inscribed in them. Masks and vaccination cards are no longer required.

pickleballReviews.author: Allen G
pickleballReviews.text: First time playing pickleball w a friend. Nice indoor area; people are friendly. only issue, need to get use to all the different lines on court as same area used for basketball, volleyball and badminton

pickleballReviews.author: Ryan Alba
pickleballReviews.text: Awesome local rec center. Free indoor basketball most days (closed Sunday); goes after 5 on Wednesday and Friday. Courts are decent if not a little dirty.

courts.name: Sunset Recreation Center
courts.address: 2201 Lawton St, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Jeffrey Jiang
pickleballReviews.text:
The community doesn't support volleyball players.
The one slot a week for open gym volleyball was replaced with Jr. Warriors where parents paid over $100 per kid to play here. Don't come here from Wednesday 7pm - 9pm. The court is reserved for the basketball kids and parents.
Instead of moving volleyball to a different day, they decided to just remove it completely. Disappointed. Didn't realize there needed to be open gym basketball here everyday.
5 star for basketball players,
1 star for volleyball players.
Go warriors I guess.

courts.name: Palega Recreation Center
courts.address: 500 Felton St, San Francisco, CA 94134, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Mike Scanlan
pickleballReviews.text: We have had a great great time here with the family. Big green grass are to relax on. We played 9on9 softball, we played volleyball 6vs6 outdoor. We played basketball 3on3 outdoor Court. We played tennis, singles and doubles. We had bean bags out there too. It was so convenient and fun. Palega park is a great place to enjoy outdoor activities with friends and families... It's was awesome.

courts.name: Potrero Hill Recreation Center
courts.address: 801 Arkansas St, San Francisco, CA 94107, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Jman916
pickleballReviews.text: Dope spot, nice clean court, and its free during open hours.

courts.name: Hamilton Recreation Center
courts.address: 1900 Geary Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA

pickleballReviews.author: stefany leui
pickleballReviews.text: Love this place! The park we love. Haven’t checked out the pool yet but it does look really cool. The park is split into 2 sections to separate older and younger kids. Love it!!! Tennis courts. Rec center. Playground!! I feel people over look this place to often. Must keep this place open. ❤️❤️

pickleballReviews.author: B
pickleballReviews.text: The pickleball courts were nice with the resurfaced floor. Minus one star for two light fixtures not working on one side of the middle court. It was my first time there and I will go back.  Parking is a big challenge, with meters only for 2 hrs.

courts.name: Westlake Community Center
courts.address: 145 Lake Merced Blvd, Daly City, CA 94015, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Tony S
pickleballReviews.text: Dirty unmaintained courts. Old metal light posts that dont work in your run path, and so much silt and grit on the back edges of the court its easy to slip and wipeout when running, but it is free and easy to get a court.  There's quite a slant to the courts so most of your balls will eventually roll to the last court.

courts.name: Southgate Community Center
courts.address: 26780 Chiplay Ave, Hayward, CA 94545, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Chad Mark Glen
pickleballReviews.text: The community center is not very large, but it suits most events. It’s nice that there’s a park with Pickleball courts, basketball, and other activities there.

courts.name: Booker T Anderson Community Center
courts.address: 960 S 47th St, Richmond, CA 94804, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Johnnie Walker
pickleballReviews.text: A great park to visit they have pickle ball. Baseball field soccer field add a playground for your little one. If you're in the area you might one-stop by.

courts.name: Barrett Community Center
courts.address: 1835 Belburn Dr, Belmont, CA 94002, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Andrew Stromberg
pickleballReviews.text: A smaller play structure, some swings, basketball courts, a pair of baseball diamonds, and a lot of open grass for kids.

courts.name: San Ramon Sports Park
courts.address: 5261 Sherwood Way, San Ramon, CA 94582, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Daisha Paz
pickleballReviews.text: This was a nice park. It has basketball courts, baseball fields, soccer fields, open field and a picnic area with grills and rest rooms.

courts.name: Alden E. Oliver Sports Park
courts.address: 2580 Eden Park Pl, Hayward, CA 94545, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Tim Busco
pickleballReviews.text: Very big park with soccer, baseball/ softball fields and some tennis courts.

courts.name: Fallon Sports Park
courts.address: 4605 Lockhart St, Dublin, CA 94568, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Muthubatcha Purushothaman
pickleballReviews.text: Plenty of options for kids and family to enjoy the facilities. Apart from Soccer, Softball and Baseball fields, there are tennis courts, basketball courts, cricket pitches, batting cages, bocce ball areas, picnic tables, kids playgrounds and walking trails for all to explore. Best sports facility in the area

courts.name: LL8
courts.address: Parkside Dr, Pleasanton, CA 94566, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Samuel Wesley
pickleballReviews.text: It's really good park. It has several baseball fields, it has a football field, also has a couple of basketball courts in addition to a volleyball net. It's a pretty big park maybe a few miles in total around. You can walk the most of the park. The park is keeped up as well. I haven't been in the bathrooms yet but I seen a cleaning crew cleaning them out so by the way the whole park looks, I'm going to say they're probably pretty clean.

courts.name: Central Park Synthetic Cricket & Soccer Field
courts.address: 1110 Stevenson Blvd, Fremont, CA 94538, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Bram Warrick
pickleballReviews.text:
Fully fenced in, AstroTurf soccer and cricket fields.

The area is switchable between soccer and cricket. Fully new and located where the tennis courts once stood.

courts.name: Jack Farrell Park
courts.address: 2509 Fordham St, East Palo Alto, CA 94303, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Don Don
pickleballReviews.text: Out Of The 4 Parks In East Palo Alto, This Would Be Second Place, Although It Is Big And The Only Park In The City That Has A Basketball Court, I'd Rate It Second Place. Love Jack Ferrel Park When You're On This Side Of Town.

courts.name: Crystol Red Park
courts.address: 20 Virginia Gardens, Berkeley, CA 94702, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Anon E. Mouse
pickleballReviews.text:
Crystol Red Park is a small two-court athletic park off of the Ohlone Greenway and opposite the main lawn of Cedar Rose Park. The park is entirely dedicated to the two courts -- there is no green space. It is considered a separate park from Cedar Rose despite the proximity and park size.

There is one basketball court and one miscellaneous/racquetball court.

The courts are well maintained and popular with basketball players. Some outdoor fitness classes are occasionally taught here.

pickleballReviews.author: Robert “RJ” Barrett
pickleballReviews.text: About 4 acres of grassland split by a road. Basketball court on one side, w a fenced in children's playground, field hockey/football field, and enough space for picnic grounds. Another road splits the last portion of the park from multiple tennis courts/handball/racketball courts. Bathroom facilities and plenty of parking. North Berkeley BART is maybe 300ft away where there is an overflow parking area that is always empty. All in all a very nice park w friendly people.

courts.name: Albert Park
courts.address: 151 Andersen Dr, San Rafael, CA 94901, USA

pickleballReviews.author: P
pickleballReviews.text: Nice little neighborhood park with open areas for picnics and play, Bocce Ball Courts, nice Children's playground, Community center, Wildcare animal rescue, tennis courts, baseball area - All of the park was donated to the people, in perpetuity, by the prominent and benevolent Albert Family of yesteryear.

courts.name: Highlands Park Field
courts.address: 298 Aberdeen Dr #200, San Carlos, CA 94070, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Anne Rehwald
pickleballReviews.text:
Clean turf soccer field
Tennis courts
Nice playground
Very maintained restrooms

courts.name: Jack London Park
courts.address: Rose Drive @, Hastings Dr, Benicia, CA 94510, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Diane Elisa
pickleballReviews.text: I remember when this park was first built and the play structure was bigger. They still have two sections, one for toddlers and one for bigger kids. There's a basketball court in the back, an open grass area, a space for soccer, and a baseball field. There's a paved path that leads behind the adjacent elementary school to a residential area, a safe way to get to the park without taking the narrow sidewalk along the road. There's a barbecue and picnic area that overlooks the playground, and plenty of parking if you're hosting a party. For the geographically inclined, find the rose garden and you'll find a compass built into the ground, with arrows pointing to different cities like San Francisco, Beijing, or Moscow, with distance to them in miles or kilometres. A little something for everyone.

courts.name: James P. Lang Athletic Fields
courts.address: Gough St &, Golden Gate Ave, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Wei-Ai Tai
pickleballReviews.text: Large new soccer field, with a big playground area for younger kids, as well as basketball and tennis courts. Entrance from Golden Gate Avenue side, as well as from the Turk Street side, but there seems to be more parking spots on Turk Street. Clean and functional bathrooms.

pickleballReviews.author: Ousseynou Niang
pickleballReviews.text:
This is one of my favorite spots in the city.
I would recommend this park to anyone who loves sports or just wants to enjoy a beautiful, warm and well-maintained field. The attention to detail and overall atmosphere of the park made for a truly memorable experience. Whether you're a seasoned soccer player or just looking for a fun activity with friends and family, this park is definitely worth a visit. There is a few basketball courts as well as tennis courts within the park. People play all kind of sports/leagues in the park: volleyball, football, baseball, frisbee, hockey, rugby,...

courts.name: Alice Marble Tennis Courts
courts.address: 1200 Greenwich St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Krishin Asnani
pickleballReviews.text:
Sweeping , Widescreen cinematic views that need no close captioned subtitles to explain their beauty; I could just gaze at this beauty forever instead of playing tennis; courts are lumpy but then again I am a mediocre player; like meets like.

Love the random solo tennis or basketball players hitting against a wall who later find random partners , creating a community.

pickleballReviews.author: Tom Guerreau
pickleballReviews.text:
First come first serve basis.
Fantastic courts in SF, views are stunning

pickleballReviews.author: Chris
pickleballReviews.text: Beautiful park with some of the best views of SF. That being said, the tennis courts are the worst I’ve ever played on. Instead of standard hard court, some strange playground  surface was used instead. There are parts of the court that are peeling and the bounces produce a thud almost anywhere on the court. If you’re a serious tennis player 4.0+ I would never even consider playing here under any circumstance. Amazing park though aside from the tennis courts

courts.name: Margaret Osborne DuPont Tennis Courts
courts.address: 336 31st Ave, San Francisco, CA 94121, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Lucas Chang
pickleballReviews.text: Well maintained set of 4 tennis courts that are frequently used

pickleballReviews.author: Johnny Ma
pickleballReviews.text: Well maintained courts with restrooms and benchs. Wasn't very busy on the weekday afternoon I went, but can be different on weekends. There are schools near by that might also reserve those courts for practice and matches. Also, there are houses right next to the courts, be aware if you tend to hit fly balls. Courts also tend to pool water on the corner courts during rainy days.

pickleballReviews.author: Lance Mock
pickleballReviews.text: Courts are still in good shape. Little hard to park. Gets very easily wet if there is just a vit of fog.

pickleballReviews.author: Abigail Chin
pickleballReviews.text: Nice tennis courts. No lights for night play but they have a huge wall for single player mode (practicing with the wall) if you’re into that 😄

pickleballReviews.author: Sukhrob Golibboev
pickleballReviews.text: Really nice place to play! Courts are in a very good condition.  Never have to wait.

courts.name: Tennis Courts | Cataldi Park
courts.address: 2943 Cataldi Dr, San Jose, CA 95132, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Zot Stuff
pickleballReviews.text: Decent courts, but the locals are very territorial and instructors take over multiple courts for hours at a time on any given day; the city does nothing about it, despite paid lessons being explicitly prohibited. Locals will literally sit on a court the entire day and rotate their newly arriving friends on and off the court, instead of queuing like they are supposed to. Don't bother arguing, they'll either pretend to not speak English or give you attitude for daring to call them out for breaking the rules.

pickleballReviews.author: BeCasMap
pickleballReviews.text: Best park for tennis and hangout. There 7 courts and it ALL FREE for public. It not too busy in weekday. Alot parking lot and more. Public resroom.

pickleballReviews.author: George DeCarlo
pickleballReviews.text: Plenty of room for the kids to run and play, see the playground. There are 9 tennis courts no lights for night time and lots of tree debris. Bring an electric blower because there is no power source. You'll find every level of player to hit, singles and/or doubles.

courts.name: Hearst Tennis Courts
courts.address: 2651 Bancroft Way, Berkeley, CA 94704, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Tony Wu
pickleballReviews.text: Double cages with three courts in each surrounded by high fences and above a parking lot; the tennis courts themselves are very nice (no cracks, high nets). Would love to play here publicly.

pickleballReviews.author: Lu-Yu Huang
pickleballReviews.text: The structure located above the parking lot has a hollow floor, so the ball bounces a bit differently and feels like a slow hard court. The ground is in good condition and feels like it has been re-surfaced regularly.

courts.name: Flint St Tennis Courts
courts.address: 26 Flint St, San Francisco, CA 94114, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Woobin Park
pickleballReviews.text: Hidden gem hard to find. I think there are also pickleball courts next to the tennis courts. Yes there still is the ball bag.

pickleballReviews.author: Alex Yang
pickleballReviews.text: Great tennis court. There were balls in a bag so we had unlimited balls which were nice. Not super crowded on a sunny day which surprised me. Nice environment, next to a park. I’m not that good at tennis and never play so I have little to compare it to, but the court seemed alright.

courts.name: Diablo Vista Park - Tennis Courts
courts.address: Crow Canyon Rd, Danville, CA 94506, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Devarajan Sundararajan
pickleballReviews.text: One of the great courts of San ramon with lights.

pickleballReviews.author: Yousef Hammad
pickleballReviews.text: 2 tennis courts with available lights.

courts.name: Tennis Court 1 | San Jose Public
courts.address: 25936084, San Jose, CA 95110, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Jagadeesh Rahul
pickleballReviews.text: This place has two courts. One of the court is damages with plenty of cracks on the court that could significantly impact your game. This place is does not need any reservation. Pros is that it has lighting facility for night games and a beautiful view of the Adobe and SAP centre. Parking was a hassle on games day at sap centre. As it’s close to downtown it’s pretty packed at eve and on weekends

pickleballReviews.author: Richard Yang
pickleballReviews.text:
These 2 courts are good quality and have nighttime lighting too. Nets are a little bit loose and one of the courts has a crack down the middle, but otherwise not bad..
Edit: San Jose has been great at keeping this maintained. I regularly submit issues like broken lighting or nets via the 311 app and they get fixed within a week

pickleballReviews.author: Leon Ransom
pickleballReviews.text: Fairly large homeless population here. It is quiet and for anyone who may have trepidations....you have nothing to fear. The courts are extremely nice, fully enclosed and unless you are worse at tennis than I am you will not have to concern yourself with losing tennis balls. I will surely make use of this facility again. The one thing that is an issue is parking. Wherever you find a place to park, you will have to feed a meter. The walk from the car to the courts offers a great opportunity to get loose.

pickleballReviews.author: Corsentino (Corsentino)
pickleballReviews.text: Some homeless nearby, and cracks on the court.

pickleballReviews.author: Kyle O'Dea
pickleballReviews.text: Courts are ok.  Only two are set up for tennis and the nets are sagging.  Lights also do not seem to work.

courts.name: SFSU Tennis Courts
courts.address: 1600 Holloway Ave, San Francisco, CA 94132, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Gomez Addams
pickleballReviews.text:
The courts are pretty shabby and not maintained well at all. They are usually dirty and often have tree droppings on them. Often many are filled with USTA leagues and various private coaching programs so it can be a challenge even to find an open court.
On the positive side, most of the nets are in good shape and there are 14 courts.

pickleballReviews.author: Pinoe Chu
pickleballReviews.text: SFSU courts have both pros and cons. The cons are that the courts are not very well maintained. The nets on several courts are broken and have holes under the white tape. Lots of leaves and dust on all courts. I think a leaf blower before hand would benefit a lot as it can get slippery. Lastly, the courts are adjacent to each other so it's easy to have a ball fly into your court and stop your play. The pro is that there are about 15 courts there so there are plenty of courts to play on.

pickleballReviews.author: Eugene Ingerman
pickleballReviews.text: 15 tennis courts in ok condition. Some cracks and net tears. Down below, so they are shielded from the wind.

pickleballReviews.author: Habanero Pepper
pickleballReviews.text: Courts are in horrible shape as of oct 2021. Most of the nets are broken and sagging. Debris on all courts. In need of some serious maintenance.

pickleballReviews.author: David Jefferies (djisin415)
pickleballReviews.text: Courts need to be resurfaced and new nets. Also wish the paths to get down to the courts weren't so steep.

courts.name: Hurlbut Tennis & Garden Park
courts.address: 1 E Richmond Ave., Richmond, CA 94801, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Peter Thelin
pickleballReviews.text: Lovely local tennis courts and hidden park between the tunnels.

courts.name: Thamien Park Tennis Court
courts.address: 4321 Lick Mill Blvd, Santa Clara, CA 95054, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Sebastian Molina
pickleballReviews.text: This is the best tennis court I’ve ever been too. Would give it 6 stars if I could.

courts.name: Rose Garden Tennis Courts
courts.address: 1200 Euclid Ave, Berkeley, CA 94708, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Anon E. Mouse
pickleballReviews.text: Three fenced tennis courts and a half-court practice wall located inside of the Berkeley Rose Garden. The courts are well maintained. These are the best tennis courts in North Berkeley, so it can be hard to get an open court during peak hours. You can take a stroll in the Rose Garden or hike at Codornices Park while you wait.

pickleballReviews.author: Andrew Horne
pickleballReviews.text: These are adequate for amateur fixtures but need to be reserved.  They aren't cool. Cool courts, you're the one that's crazy if you show up with a reservation.  Try San Pablo if you're cool, bushrod if you're willing to face down a couple pickle bros or Defermerey in Oakland if you're truly bad ass and your game can back up your mouth.

courts.name: Chabot Tennis Courts
courts.address: 6898 Chabot Rd, Oakland, CA 94618, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Maria Boukhval
pickleballReviews.text: Those are public old hard courts, kind of dirty and the Bart line is right on top. Always busy and noisy here. Restrooms are bio cabins. Indeed not the top courts for pros and regular players. However, maybe a good option for beginners and those living close by. There is also an app you need to download to reserve.

pickleballReviews.author: Denis Golovin
pickleballReviews.text: It is easy to find, has a parking lot next to it and there was always one court available on Sunday while I was playing my match, but it needs some TLC and public restrooms.

pickleballReviews.author: Robert Barbosa
pickleballReviews.text: Got there around 8 AM on a Saturday and had a great time hitting the ball with my friend. Sweet courts and easy going players.

pickleballReviews.author: Gaganpreet Thind
pickleballReviews.text: We've gone two times and usually someone gives us a court within 15 mins.

courts.name: Freitas Park Tennis Courts
courts.address: San Rafael, CA 94903, USA

pickleballReviews.author: amit madhukar
pickleballReviews.text:
Serious maintenance is required as there are several cracks on court.
Curtains in fences are in very bad shape.
Only good thing is that lights are there so you can play till 10 pm

pickleballReviews.author: Kesava Kotha
pickleballReviews.text: Only 2coirts and there are cracks all over the court. Not worth for paying money.

courts.name: Birch Grove Tennis Courts
courts.address: 5975 Smith Ave, Newark, CA 94560, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Yuchen Zhou
Maurice Younes
pickleballReviews.text: Four good tennis courts available where good friends practice, play tennis and have fun

courts.name: Eden Shores Tennis Courts
courts.address: 2841 Sea Haven Ct, Hayward, CA 94545, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Addy
pickleballReviews.text: Great courts, playground and park

courts.name: Serra Park Tennis Courts
courts.address: 1568 Hollenbeck Ave, Sunnyvale, CA 94087, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Sergey Blashkov
pickleballReviews.text:
Good tennis courts with well maintained equipments and cover.
There are tools to keep track of when people got started and expected to finish a game.
Also there are clear and nice rules printed on the board so the use of courts will be fair to everyone.
The park around the courts is quite good too.
Courts are well lit in the evening.

pickleballReviews.author: Santosh Patil
pickleballReviews.text: 4 tennis courts available. Comparatively less croweded . 2 courts have some shead so good for afternoon play as well. Close for clean in on Friday (till noon)

pickleballReviews.author: Vandana Bhardwaj
pickleballReviews.text:
Very nice
Good parking spots
Tennis court nice but very busy all the time
Restrooms clean

courts.name: California High School Tennis Courts
courts.address: 9900 Broadmoor Dr, San Ramon, CA 94583, USA

pickleballReviews.author: emin turan
pickleballReviews.text: Courts need re-surfacing. Trees shade 2 courts in the afternoon. No nearby public restroom.

pickleballReviews.author: Gary Larsen
pickleballReviews.text: Convenient location, but hard to get a court and there are some cracks and surface area coming off the courts.

courts.name: Alta Vista Park
courts.address: 715 Julia Ave, Redondo Beach, CA 90277, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Matias Bustos
pickleballReviews.text: Nice park. Small playground. Big free parking lot. Huge area to play baseball and soccer. Many court to play tennis.

courts.name: Eaton Blanche Park
courts.address: 3100 E Del Mar Blvd, Pasadena, CA 91107, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Arthur Smocks
pickleballReviews.text:
Love it. Great for all ages.

Playground
Basketball court
Tennis courts
Picnic space

All clean and ready to use. There was even a ball to shoot around with

pickleballReviews.author: Jack B
pickleballReviews.text: This park is very nice and I recommend going here. The basketball courts are nice and will do the job if you wish to play here. The tennis courts are nice as well. The playgrounds are good as well and your kids will have fun playing here. The bathrooms are the only problem. They are dirty and at times can be filled with homeless people. The picnic area is nice, and the parking lots are substantial for a good amount of cars. Nice park.

courts.name: Independence Park
courts.address: 12334 Bellflower Blvd, Downey, CA 90242, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Cesáreo Jara
pickleballReviews.text: Surprisingly nice skate park. Complete with tennis courts and caged soccer courts. Was there with the Grandkids found a corner picnic table. Took a stroll around the neighborhood. This park is huge lots of families. Will definitely return with much warmer weather.

pickleballReviews.author: Sapat Lang
pickleballReviews.text: very clean park. tennis courts and baseball field are very well maintained. also they have a skate park with full of skaters from beginners to expert levels. lol. restrooms are also clean and have tissues. problem with this, lnot enough trees for shades. i suggest more picnic tables with shades. by the way, first to saw a public park with EV charging station. kudos to Downey city government. Los Angeles City parks department must visit your place to see the big difference. LA public parks are so poorly maintained.

pickleballReviews.author: Jorden Augustus
pickleballReviews.text: As big as the park is there’s room for everything except basketball? A park that has multiple tennis courts, a skate park, baseball/kick ball field, soccer courts, a playground for the kids but not a single basketball court in sight. Pretty insane for a park to be as big as this and no courts.

pickleballReviews.author: Alexandro Cuevas
pickleballReviews.text: Lots of parking has tennis courts plenty of restrooms (mostly locked) skate park and baseball fileds.

courts.name: Fox Hills Park
courts.address: Green Valley Cir &, Buckingham Pkwy, Culver City, CA 90230, USA

pickleballReviews.author: A. Van Gogh
pickleballReviews.text:
Fox Hills is well maintained but lacks accessibility. It's a good park for strength training, though. There are several workout equipment stations along the park's exterior path. There are many pickleball and tennis courts, eight, in total, I think. There is a small playground. There are four stalls in each gendered bathroom. Kids sports clubs play here. Street parking is free, but limited around the park entrances. It's generally a middle-class hood with generally safe apartment living on the opposite side of the street. Tuesday is street cleaning on the park side from
10 am-2 pm.

pickleballReviews.author: Natalya B
pickleballReviews.text: Ample parking around the park. Not a huge park but also not small like a block by block square /park. Multiple tennis courts. Basketball court. Picnic tables with grills. Playground (for toddlers and older kids. Seesaw, slide, but no swings). Slight hill walk to enter. Can enter for two streets entrances. Can also walk around the park. Takes me about seven minutes to do one circle at an average pace (not fast).

courts.name: Marina Vista Park
courts.address: 5355 E Eliot St, Long Beach, CA 90803, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Lisa E McKim
pickleballReviews.text: One of my favorite places in the Long Beach area.  Across from Marine Stadium, it's a large park with tennis courts, kids' play area, nice palm trees and lush green grass.  Well-placed and clean public restrooms as well.  You'll often find local people out on their fitness walks, kicking a soccer ball around or hosting a large picnic.  Especially fun on 4th of July, Memorial Day, etc.  But come early to get a good spot!  Also a great spot for walking your pup!

pickleballReviews.author: Rebecca Ochoa
pickleballReviews.text: The kids love the trees for climbing,  it's right by the farmers market and there's a beautiful new restroom too. Lots of room to run.  Covered play structure for younger kids. Tennis courts as well.

courts.name: Mar Vista Recreation Center
courts.address: 11430 Woodbine St, Los Angeles, CA 90066, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Jim Kara
pickleballReviews.text:
This urban park is a bit better than the average city park, with tree shaded picnic areas and space for groups to gather without all the crowding.
There’s a recreation center, roller hockey rink, basketball courts, soccer field and a playground for the kids!
Also there’s a large swimming pool, open during the late spring thru the fall of the year.
It has expected amenities of a large public park including restrooms, trash containers and free parking. Lot parking is available just off the side streets, as well as along the streets as permitted.

pickleballReviews.author: Miyoki and Kevin
pickleballReviews.text: Love the indoor courts of the rec center. They have badminton club and have tennis courts and basketball courts and volleyball courts. Nice soccer league and teams. The outdoor playground can do an uplifting and the pool needs better equipment but still a very great park for the public.

pickleballReviews.author: Sara Prado
pickleballReviews.text: Mar Vista is such a great park with something for everyone. There are tennis courts, basketball courts, a baseball field, a roller hockey rink, soccer fields, some outdoor workout machines adjacent to the soccer fields, a playground good for both older and young kids, tons of picnic benches in multiple areas, and general open grassy space for general use. The pool is only open during the summer and isn't necessarily my favorite in the area, but it's still lots of fun. The park is large and feels like an oasis. It's great for a nice walk/run around the perimeter as well.

courts.name: The King of Padel
courts.address: 4370 Jutland Dr, San Diego, CA 92117, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Hiep Huynh
pickleballReviews.text: Due to the rain, I decided to try playing pickleball here during a weekday (Open Play is $9). The games were relatively good. However, the wait to play is kinda too long (12-16 waiting paddles on each court). There were only 4 available courts, as supposed to 6 indicated on their website.

pickleballReviews.author: Matthew R.
pickleballReviews.text: Great indoor spot to play padel indoors!!! Good lighting, good ventilation. Owners/managers are super nice. Also have some ping pong and pickleball courts too. Not to mention there’s plenty of seating and relaxing spaces if you want to bring the kids or friends along to hang out. Definitely give it a go.

pickleballReviews.author: Hal Jurgensen
pickleballReviews.text: Amazing facility, very kind workers. The courts have ton of room on both sides (pickleball) for moving around. The food truck was outside. I could spend so much time here, can't wait to come back.

pickleballReviews.author: Stephanie Tenorio
pickleballReviews.text: This place is amazing!! It’s a new indoor sports club with 6 padel courts and 6 pickleball courts. They also have a shop to purchase any equipment or you can rent yours there. The food truck outside has amazing food and drinks which is convenient if you want to grab some food before or after your game. The staff is very friendly and are always there to help. I love going to KOP!!!

courts.name: Gershwin Park
courts.address: 3549 Conrad Ave, San Diego, CA 92117, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Zach Burton
pickleballReviews.text: Fun park in North Clairemont. Swings, play structures, a small nature walk with logs and boulders to hop to. Tennis courts, a decent sized open grassy area, a few picnic tables and bbq pits. There is a bit of paved area for bikes and scooters too! They keep it very clean, we love coming here!

pickleballReviews.author: Rich Salo
pickleballReviews.text: This is a nice neighborhood  park nice an quiet. They have a fun little playground for the kidos to play on. Tennis courts an basketball court an they also have a horse shoe pit my favorite. They also have a new wood (made out of real trees like stumps an logs) obstacle course for the kids and the adults looks pretty cool and fun while the playground is closed (do to the Virus) but they're Woods structure is open for play. Check out the pictures

pickleballReviews.author: Sueki L
pickleballReviews.text: This park is a nice mid day getaway for me. It’s always peaceful and well kept. There’s a little playground and tennis/basketball courts.

courts.name: St. Michael's Pickleball
courts.address: 2775 Carlsbad Blvd, Carlsbad, CA 92008, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Pickleball System
pickleballReviews.text: This is a dedicated pickleball facility with multiple courts. Great place to play!

courts.name: Carol Lee Park
courts.address: Carol Lee Park, Escondido, CA 92026, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Jeff Weber & Aurora Ruiz
pickleballReviews.text: Wonderful Park with lots to do for Toddlers. I went on a Sunday and there were many parents there with small children. They also have pickle ball courts and basketball hoops. Dogs on leash are allowed. No restrooms.

pickleballReviews.author: Dustin Steeve
pickleballReviews.text: Beautiful park. Great playground and picnic area. There are also pickle ball courts and a basketball court. There are some shade trees and the picnic area is partially shaded. The playground structure has some shade over it, but is mostly exposed to the sun. Equipment likely gets hot on hot days.

pickleballReviews.author: Steve Hernandez
pickleballReviews.text:
Nice play structure &
area for younger children.
Ages 5yrs 12yrs
Perfect for a medium size
gathering. Includes
Two electrical outlets,
4 BBQ charcoal grills,
volleyball sandpit,
half court basketball,
2 tennis court, 2 paddleball tables.

No public bathrooms.

courts.name: Altamira Pickleball and Tennis Courts
courts.address: 6750 Paseo Del Norte, Carlsbad, CA 92011, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Pickleball System
pickleballReviews.text: This is a dedicated pickleball facility with multiple courts. Great place to play!

courts.name: Little Italy Pickleball Court
courts.address: 1747 Pacific Hwy, San Diego, CA 92101, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Pickleball System
pickleballReviews.text: This is a dedicated pickleball facility with multiple courts. Great place to play!

courts.name: Colina Del Sol Park
courts.address: 5319 Orange Ave, San Diego, CA 92115, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Amy Huang
pickleballReviews.text:
If you want a park that has poop smeared on the wall and bathrooms the same… this would be it! But it does have good tennis and pickleball courts. Other than this… yeah. Playground is okay… but not 100% safe - with broken slides and possibility of things on the ground.

All around, other than tennis and a good tennis wall, I wouldn’t choose to come here for the park.

pickleballReviews.author: Samuel Golden
pickleballReviews.text: Nice park, nice pickleball and tennis courts. However, don’t go at night. We had a guy pull a knife on us while we were trying to play pickleball. That cleared the courts out pretty fast. Stay aware past dark.

courts.name: Coronado Cays Park
courts.address: 99 Grand Caribe Isle, Coronado, CA 92118, USA

pickleballReviews.author: M Abalos
pickleballReviews.text:
2006 through 2009 … the years that brought me to this park back then, when my daughter and son played for club soccer. This past Sunday was the first time I had returned to Coronado Cays Park. This time, it was for pickleball practice.

The pickleball courts were packed around the time we arrived (230 pm). Good thing my friend reserved a week prior: $20 for 2 hours. On opposite note, from the looks of the park’s field, not a whole lot of action going on. All I saw was a huge space of grass area (so much of it) and random people walking by on the sidewalk.

As court time ended, I head towards my car that was parked across the street. I look back at the park thinking, it’s still nice park 👍🏼

PS restrooms and playground are still there

pickleballReviews.author: Brian E
pickleballReviews.text: This is a great park for families to enjoy. Wide open with plenty of room to run your dog or play a game of soccer on the grass fields. We went to play basketball on a really nice sunny day with zero issues. Plenty of people enjoying the tennis courts and open park areas.

pickleballReviews.author: KB360 Solutions
pickleballReviews.text: Coronado Cays Park is a combination of beautiful and functional. This park is perfect for letting the kids play on the playground. Soccer tournaments are held here regularly. You can’t beat the weather. Views are amazing. The tennis courts are absolutely fabulous. The nets are maintained and don’t sag. This is a great place for a large group party or entertaining event.

courts.name: San Diego Pickleball
courts.address: 1775 E Mission Bay Dr., San Diego, CA 92109, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Pickleball System
pickleballReviews.text: This is a dedicated pickleball facility with multiple courts. Great place to play!

courts.name: Countryside Park
courts.address: Chula Vista, CA 91913, USA

pickleballReviews.author: William Osborne
pickleballReviews.text: Very nice basketball court at this park. However the court has some very sticky syrup like substance all over it. Unable to play on the court because of it.

pickleballReviews.author: Raymond Lozano
pickleballReviews.text: Ate some lunch on a bench & table with shade. Saw a basketball half court, grills, playground, and can park on the street curb.

courts.name: El Toyon Park
courts.address: 2005 E 4th St, National City, CA 91950, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Mark Eckman
pickleballReviews.text: This park could be a 5 if it wasn't for a sad playground and nasty restrooms. The playground equipment is simple and unimaginative. The wood chips and sand are so hard they might as well be dirt. Otherwise there are basketball & tennis courts, horseshoe pits, plenty of picnic tables, and lots of grass with a perimeter walking path. Plenty of free parking and located away from any busy roads.

pickleballReviews.author: Shelley Baber
pickleballReviews.text: Spacious park with walking paths, tennis courts, basketball courts, tables, benches, shade trees and a young children's playground. Such a nice beautiful park with people enjoying their time there.

courts.name: Escaya Park
courts.address: 1075 Camino Prado, Chula Vista, CA 91913, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Claudia Ortiz
pickleballReviews.text:
Escaya Park is located in Chula Vista, it is a beautiful neighborhood park in the middle of a residential area. The park features a vibrant colored playground along with lots of greenery space, basketball court, gazebos with built- in grills, and sidewalks & pathways.

The playground has lots of unique climbing structures, musical equipment, slides, swings, and also fun balancing equipment.

We had a fun experience exploring the park and my son loved observing the many roly polys in the small garden area.

Bathrooms are available and parking lot area & street parking available.

pickleballReviews.author: Manuella Chimello
pickleballReviews.text: Escaya Park is a beautiful place to go and enjoy the space. Beautiful sunset and the infrastructure is well-equipped, they have basketball courts and you can play many sports. The only problem that I have been noticing recently is the lack of respect from dog owners, who aren’t picking up after their dogs.

courts.name: Olive Grove Park
courts.address: 6075 Printwood Street, San Diego, CA 92117, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Mrs. Jackal
pickleballReviews.text: It's important to note that as of Nov. 2024, the basketball/tennis courts and grass are still open, but the playground and baseball fields are under construction.

pickleballReviews.author: Claudia Johnson
pickleballReviews.text: This park is in construction through fall 2025. The field, playground, and courts are closed and unaccessible. There is a nice grass area with trees that is still open to the public. Also, there are no bathrooms, just portajohn.

pickleballReviews.author: Mark Leo
pickleballReviews.text: I enjoy walking my dog here before stopping by the nearby comic book store. When the field is open folks let their dogs off leash and it seems like a lot of people here are courteous to pick up after their dogs. Nice neighborhood park with a good parking lot.

courts.name: Hilltop Community Park and Recreation Center
courts.address: 9711 Oviedo Way, San Diego, CA 92129, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Andrew
pickleballReviews.text: Awesome park, basketball court stays pretty busy on a nice day. Facilities are a plus.

pickleballReviews.author: Thai Le
pickleballReviews.text: This is a fully equipped park with party space for rent and for community events.  Concrete walking paths that are laced on the side with exercise apparatuses and large gazebos with picnic tables, benches, and even trash cans for hot charcoal.  There are basketball courts, table-tennis tables, clean restrooms and fully equipped kids sanded and soft cushioned play grounds.  There is an entrance to hiking tracks that take you up the Black Mountain top that is dominated by large satellite dishes and antenna towers or its lower Miners Ridge over looking million dollar newly built homes.  The park itself is high up on a hill top (hence the name) and breezy, over looking Carmel High School's and Black Mountain Middle School's football and baseball yards, surrounding residential neighborhoods, and spetacular views. Although the park closes at 7pm, 5 pm on the weekend , it is well lighted and there are people here playing basketball, walking, and playing late into the night! This park is very popular and a hidden gem for the locals!

courts.name: Better at Pickleball
courts.address: 2800 Olympic Pkwy, Chula Vista, CA 91915, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Pickleball System
pickleballReviews.text: This is a dedicated pickleball facility with multiple courts. Great place to play!

courts.name: Fairbrook Park
courts.address: 10351 Rue Fontenay Ct, San Diego, CA 92131, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Paige C
pickleballReviews.text: Lovely place to play pickleball. There is a half court for basketball and very nice landscaping. There weren't too many people, making it a peaceful experience. There is quite a lot of street parking if needed.

pickleballReviews.author: Clara Chia
pickleballReviews.text:
(also posted on their Yelp page)
This review is for the pickleball court. There is only one court, but it is its own court with lines and a net. There are no wind guards and no lights. It will be hard to play in the dark when the sun goes down. Next to the pickleball court is half a basketball court. This place looks very new or not used much yet.  There is a bench outside the court but no awning for shade.

There is no dedicated parking lot here. You have to park on the streets, but it's free. There is a play area and jungle gym on the other side of the pickleball court. Good for dogs and small children. The park in general is small and quiet.

pickleballReviews.author: Maverick
pickleballReviews.text: Overall, Fairbrook Neighborhood Park is a small but pleasant community park with basic amenities for families and children. The park has a plethora of picnic tables and two covered picnic areas that are available for rent. You will a half basketball court and a Pickleball court. There is also a playground for the younger kids. Fairbrook Park is tucked back in a neighborhood so the traffic is pretty low and the noise is minimal. There are also bathrooms located off the concrete path and water fountains are also available. This park is dog-friendly so bring your fur baby. This is a really nice place to spend a sunny afternoon in San Diego. Enjoy!

courts.address: 2775 MacKenzie Creek Rd, Chula Vista, CA 91914, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Robert Bixler
pickleballReviews.text:
8 pickleball courts. Two are usually set up as Challenger courts, and the other six are open for all levels of play.

Grab a paddle. Bring a friend. And get ready to pickle!

pickleballReviews.author: Alfonso Torres
pickleballReviews.text: great pickleball courts but NO singles allowed to play. you must accept whatever group want to play with you. i’ve seen people get the ranger called on them if you refuse to play doubles

pickleballReviews.author: Chris Mountain
pickleballReviews.text: Great pickleball place. It seems like pickleball never ends here. The courts are new and modern. There are bathrooms right there. If the parking is full you can park in the  mall behind and walk up. There is a gate in the back. There are shade tree covered tables. The courts are organized by level. Just watch to see where you fit in and lay your paddle against the net post. People are very friendly and nice. No one is a stranger. You can find just about any level of play anytime.

pickleballReviews.author: Jerry Salamante
pickleballReviews.text:
Nice modern community park. Not much open land, but good basketball courts, playground, and picnic areas. On this night, the tennis courts were ablaze with activity... for Pickle Ball!
The parking lot is very, very small. So if you're attending a party there, expect to park on the street and walk a little.

courts.name: Poinsettia Park
courts.address: 6600 Hidden Valley Rd, Carlsbad, CA 92011, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Vera
pickleballReviews.text:
This is a great park with great facilities for everyone. Tennis courts (very busy on weekends), athletic fields, a very nice dog park, a very nice playground for younger kids, basketball courts, and a great walking path.

Too bad, people can be ignorant to their best like unleashing their dogs on the grassy field while the dog park was empty not far from it.

pickleballReviews.author: Daniel Winter
pickleballReviews.text: A nice park to relax in. Has a small dog park, 2 baseball fields, 2 basketball courts, a soccer field, a playground, and plenty of tennis courts! Been coming here since I was in middle school and it's never stopped being a good place to just spend time outside.

courts.name: Mountain View Sports & Racquet
courts.address: 6401 Skyline Dr, San Diego, CA 92114, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Lucas White
pickleballReviews.text: Excellent place to play tennis. The coaches are all very nice and knowledgeable, the courts are very well maintained and there are lots of events such as tournaments and other various clinics.

pickleballReviews.author: Daniel White
pickleballReviews.text: Great facility overall. Courts are resurfaced often, and are always in very good condition.

pickleballReviews.author: Jesus Osuna
pickleballReviews.text: The people are amazing, and the new courts and programs make it a great experience

courts.name: Pickleball courts | Coronado Cays Park
courts.address: 16 Bahama Bend, Coronado, CA 92118, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Pickleball System
pickleballReviews.text: This is a dedicated pickleball facility with multiple courts. Great place to play!

courts.name: Montevalle Recreation Center
courts.address: 840 Duncan Ranch Rd, Chula Vista, CA 91914, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Erin Barron
pickleballReviews.text:
Parking can be a little tricky on Tuesdays at 6, but it clears out fairly quickly. It is a beautiful park to play, walk, run, or hike.

The facilities offer 2 playgrounds, fields for baseball, tennis courts, indoor and outdoor basketball courts, and dance studios, as well as large fields for soccer, lacrosse, football, and rugby.

pickleballReviews.author: Mrs. V
pickleballReviews.text: We love the playground is safe for toddlers and school age children. We really like how the dog park is gated and close to the playground. There's a tennis court, basketball card and even a skateboard area.  Plenty of parking and a recreation park. Also there's tiny tots. Definitely recommend this park for a party a picnic or even a Sunday morning walk.

courts.name: Allied Gardens Recreation Center
courts.address: 5155 Greenbrier Ave, San Diego, CA 92120, USA

pickleballReviews.author: JWWJ
pickleballReviews.text:
We went to the outdoor concert in the park last Friday evening, Sept. 6th, 2019 & had a great time. The band was "High Tide Society" playing a classic mix of Yacht Rock. The band played from 6 pm to 8:15 pm & the large crowd had wonderful time dancing the night away. Another positive aspect, this is a very friendly dog park & dogs are also welcome to attend the concert.
Ideal Plumbing provided much of the free food which included hot dogs, grilled cheese sandwiches, chips & bottled water. Grocery Outlet gave out free popcyles & Ponce's Mexican restaurant offered free chicken or beef tacos.
People brought their blankets & beach chairs, ice chests & anything comfortable to relax on to enjoy the music, friendly neighborhood atmosphere & beautiful weather.
This is a large grassy park, with a 1/2 mile circular sidewalk for those avid walkers or runners. There's a large, safe playground for the children to play on & 2 basketball courts, indoor & outdoor.
There are many picnic benches scattered throughout this friendly park & it's a popular place to celebrate birthdays & holidays. Also there are many exercise, yoga & self defense classes that meet here. There are several very large trees that provide much needed shade & comfort on those hot summer days. There are public bathrooms that are open during public hours.
As for parking, there is plenty of on street parking as well as a parking lot just for the park, with handicap spaces. This is a very safe park with little, if any, crime reported. No graffiti, drug or alcohol use is allowed. The park is very well lit during the evening hours & no overnight camping/sleeping is allowed. There are many trash cans & doggie poop bags available for free. Everyone pitches in to keep this park clean, beautiful & safe for all, young & old to enjoy.

courts.name: Bostonia Recreation Center
courts.address: 1049 Bostonia St, El Cajon, CA 92021, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Pamela S
pickleballReviews.text: Love playing pickle ball there and the people are friendly.

courts.name: La Jolla Recreation Center
courts.address: 615 Prospect St, La Jolla, CA 92037, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Amy Mikkelsen
pickleballReviews.text: We were staying a few nights in La Jolla and my teenage son (who always travels with a basketball) was thrilled to see this park with bball courts nearby our hotel and played until after dark. It felt safe and was well lit but I did stay with him as it was a new city to him.

courts.name: Linda Vista Recreation Center
courts.address: 7064 Levant St, San Diego, CA 92111, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Mohammad Qutishat
pickleballReviews.text:
