A very nice recreation center with tons of activities, it has a fantastic skating park, gymnasium, tennis courts, softball fields, a multi-purpose court, a basketball court, a handball court…etc.
I also read that they have some events, so make sure to check out their website to catch the next event while you are in the area.

pickleballReviews.author: Adriana G
pickleballReviews.text: Indoor Basketball Court 🏀  very nice staff, definitely going back.

pickleballReviews.author: Rod Dillard
pickleballReviews.text: Linda vista recreation center has a nice skateboard area for all the kids , teenagers, and adults to ride and enjoy yourself. There is a outdoor basketball area tennis courts racket ball court plenty of space to play soccer , baseball, football, most any sport you want to play. They have a outdoor swimming pool for the summertime nice place to have a pic nic with a date or friends. Linda Vista recreation center home of the monstars basketball team.

courts.name: Balboa Park Activity Center
courts.address: 2145 Park Blvd, San Diego, CA 92101, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Jasmine Johnson
pickleballReviews.text:
Went to watch my volleyball team play at the San Diego Sr Games.  This center is located in Balboa Park.  There is plenty of parking and a short walk to the center.   The entrance doors are above the parking lot, which has a few steeper inclines to walk up.  Some handicap spots, closer to the entrance but limited in number.

Center was set up for a volleyball tournament,  so 6 courts and some seating on the side areas.   It was 83 degrees that day, so much more humid and muggy inside the center. No A/C, but did have some larger fans circulating air,  but still warm inside.

Restrooms are available inside the lobby area before you enter the main area.

I spent 4 hours there,  watching the tournament and my team.

pickleballReviews.author: Jerome Cooper
pickleballReviews.text: If you like volleyball, pingpong, bad mitten, or pickle ball you should checkout Balboa Park Activity Center. They have a schedule you can pickup and find out al their planned tournaments and events. It’s huge and open to the public first come first serve.

courts.name: Golden Hill Recreation Center
courts.address: Golden Hill Recreation Center, 2600 Golf Course Dr, San Diego, CA 92102, USA

pickleballReviews.author: André Evangelesta
pickleballReviews.text:
Decent space with a playground, two outdoor basketball courts and two baseball diamonds.

We came when the city was putting on an Easter egg hunt so it was busier than usual.

This is right next to the golf course and is pretty breezy since there's nothing to obstruct wind. It's also directly in the flight path for the airport so expect planes to frequently fly right overhead.

pickleballReviews.author: Eben Piazza
pickleballReviews.text: Great local resource basketball courts, playground, teen rec area, movies in summer, and baseball fields.

courts.name: Village Park Clubhouse #2
courts.address: Encinitas, CA 92024, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Wendy Rees
pickleballReviews.text: Nice big pool with diving board and nice pickleball courts. They finally remodeled the bathroom so they're not so terrible.

courts.name: Carmel Mountain Ranch / Sabre Springs Recreation Center
courts.address: 10152 Rancho Carmel Dr, San Diego, CA 92128, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Marlon De Andrade
pickleballReviews.text: I totally ❤️ this place its always clean and well maintained.  A great place to take your dogs to play catch and run around for some much needed exercise. There's also a very nice playground for the kids. The Recreational center has indoor basketball and pickleball so many amenities so cool

pickleballReviews.author: Janice Sherman
pickleballReviews.text: Carmel mountain recreation center is lovely facility with basketball courts, pickle ball, a studio space.  Yoga will now be offered at the Center beginning September 13,2023

courts.name: Views West Park
courts.address: 12958 La Tortola, San Diego, CA 92129, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Patrick and Nathalie Goldie
pickleballReviews.text: Views West Park is our go to choice for my son’s birthday party.  We reserved this parked twice already and it’s perfect.  There’s a flat area for a bounce house, a volleyball court, really good size gazebo, big grill, more grills, plenty of tables, chairs and the best part covered playground.  The park is secluded and easy parking.  There’s also a football field and nearby restrooms.  This park will always will be close to our hearts.

courts.name: Grove Park
courts.address: 1325 Santa Diana Rd, Chula Vista, CA 91913, USA

pickleballReviews.author: R Micks
pickleballReviews.text:
This is a very nice neighborhood park.  It is so new that the trees are still growing so there is no shade yet.

Huge open grass area for soccer, football, baseball.  It has very nice basketball courts and new pickle ball courts.

Parking is a challenge because this is a neighborhood park.  It has a padded surface playground for 3 to 5 year olds.  They have very clean bathrooms.

pickleballReviews.author: Claudia Ortiz
pickleballReviews.text:
Grove Park is a new park located in Chula Vista, definitely a fun playground that did not disappoint. The kids loved the double slide and had a great time climbing to the very top. There is a separate play structure for the smaller kids and the big kids. There are lots of climbing equipment, two spinners, balancing equipment and bridges. There is also a large grass field, bathroom, and basketball courts.

Your kids will have a great time!

Bathrooms available

Street parking is only available

Full court basketball

pickleballReviews.author: Jon Chee
pickleballReviews.text: This is a great park! The climbing structure with slide is my kids favorite. Clean park with restroom access nearby. Basketball and tennis courts as well.

pickleballReviews.author: M ARMN
pickleballReviews.text: Beautiful park with 2 full basketball court, tennis/pickleball ball court, jungle gym, gazebo, picnic tables, and a large open field.

courts.name: Pine Park
courts.address: 755 Chestnut Ave, Carlsbad, CA 92008, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Sam H
pickleballReviews.text:
Pine avenue is a nice park with a playground for the kids and barbecue area with picnic tables. Basketball courts and so far clean bathrooms with soap to wash your hands.
Next to the community centers for youth and seniors.
NO DOGS allowed in this park.

It looks like this allowed
Homeless sleeping, people drinking alcohol by the corner  In the park  and RVs parked all day is what you will also find here.

courts.name: Canyonside Park
courts.address: 12350 Black Mountain Rd, San Diego, CA 92129, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Andrew Perez
pickleballReviews.text:
This an expansive and very well kept park. It's no wonder so many people like it.

They have plenty of baseball fields (many times taken up by league games), grass areas, play grounds, tennis courts and more. They also have indoor facilities for classes like gymnastics and such.

It can get quite busy after school and on some weekends/holidays (hit or miss).

I personally and simultaneously highly recomend and not reconmend this park. Recommend because it's so great you can wind up spending quite a bit of time down there. Not recommended becuase I like this place less crowded :P

Have fun, be safe, and enjoy this recreational center for all it has to offer!

courts.name: Pacific Beach Recreation Center
courts.address: 1405 Diamond St, San Diego, CA 92109, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Megan Allen
pickleballReviews.text:
Outside: There are 4 courts, mostly taped, and 2 nets provided by PB Rec when they’re open. 2 courts are inside tennis area, 2 courts are in basketball area. People also bring their own nets.

The hours you see posted on the website and inside the gym are for indoors pickleball. The indoors people can be unwelcoming to say the least, and barely tolerate you if you’re at a lower level. So if you’re new, a beginner, playing for FUN, use the outdoor courts to practice and improve your game.

On Fridays and Saturdays, the outdoors courts are pretty full, so there may be a wait. Just place your paddle on the ground next to your chosen court and your time will come up.

Better players naturally gravitate toward one court or another, so if you’re really good you will have some competition. Otherwise, look for your level and jump in. It’s free, it’s chill, it’s PB. 🤗

pickleballReviews.author: Andrew Sutton
pickleballReviews.text: Great spot for pickup basketball and volleyball. The open gym schedule is posted on the wall of the indoor court so it’s good to be aware of what sport has the indoor gym reserved for the evening. There are also various leagues or classes that occasionally have the gym reserved but that is posted on the schedule as well. I usually only go for basketball, which typically has good competition and isn’t overly crowded except for Saturday mornings on the indoor court. The outdoor courts aren’t the greatest, and are slanted somewhat, but they definitely aren’t the worst. Monday-Thursday afternoons and evenings (outdoor courts have lights) as well as Saturday morning are typically the best for basketball. Other than the courts, there is also tennis courts, a playground, and occasionally access to the large softball field next door.

pickleballReviews.author: Sam A
pickleballReviews.text: Great neighborhood park and rec center. They have indoor and outdoor basketball court, indooor volleyball, tennis, kids park, and baseball field.  The rec center has classes and youth sports leagues.  Love this place!

courts.name: Pacific Highlands Ranch Recreation Center
courts.address: 5977 Village Center Loop Rd, San Diego, CA 92130, USA

pickleballReviews.author: A Z
pickleballReviews.text: It was a pretty good place, I would have given it a 5 star but now I can't. I am a high school student that plays badminton at this recreation center, and we used to have the whole gym for us for free play on Tuesday and Thursday afternoon. However, starting today (with no warning in advance), they started a basketball class on one side of the gym, which leaves us only 3 courts (it used to be 6). Why I am mad is because there are a lot of people playing badminton, high school and middle school students  and other adults. Just taking away half of the courts is not acceptable. The signup sheet now is very full, and it is impossible for us to play when we come at 4 pm even though the badminton time ends at 5:30 pm. Plus, the classes are EVERY WEEK and on TUESDAYs and THURSDAYs, exactly when the afternoon badminton times are. We students cannot come anytime else, and when we come now, the courts are all full! This is discrimination against us badminton people, mind you! I am very disappointed >:(

pickleballReviews.author: Deqiang Zhang
pickleballReviews.text: The newest community recreation center in San Diego as of today.  It has an indoor gym, a multipurpose room, an outdoor basket court, a standard grass field, a skate park and a dog park.  Plenty of functions.

pickleballReviews.author: Judy Sperling
pickleballReviews.text: Had a few competitive games of pickleball.  Too few players there.  Need more.

courts.name: Black Mountain Recreation Center
courts.address: 9353 Oviedo St, San Diego, CA 92129, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Charlotte Sikorski
pickleballReviews.text: As of 3/14/22 they have open play Pickleball Mondays from 5:15pm - 8:15pm for free. There are three nets provided, you just have to set them up and take them down yourself, but that's really easy. Everyone seems to play with each other and switch out players so I didn't have to wait at all to play.

pickleballReviews.author: Michael Lagrand
pickleballReviews.text: We play basketball there in gym. Assume they call it a multipurpose room? Has 2 basketball courts. Use it twice a week. Tuesday and Thursday from 6pm to 9pm. Regular indoor basketball court. Does have bleachers, and a stage with curtain for events.  Restrooms outside gym. Plenty of parking, including handicap. An attendant is present during time were there. Clean.

pickleballReviews.author: Percival Sarmiento
pickleballReviews.text: This Gym is hella cool....you can ball till you drop long as no one is huggin the whole courts

courts.name: Cypress Canyon Park
courts.address: 11480 Cypress Canyon Rd, San Diego, CA 92131, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Susram Rahul
pickleballReviews.text: Very nice and well maintained park with kids play area , courts for basketball and pickleball, baseball ballpark. Evenings would become more happening with kids of all ages playing happily.

pickleballReviews.author: Loren Wimmer
pickleballReviews.text: Has everything you could want. Ball field, restrooms, drinking fountains, paved sidewalk, play area for the kiddos, and pickleball courts.

pickleballReviews.author: Patricia Winters
pickleballReviews.text: This park is cute and just for babies and toddlers. I wish park would think of shade for kids. Most parks are designed by tree around them and none providing shade for kids. This park is surrounded by trees, tennis courts, baseball area, walking area, plus a cross on the top of the hill. Bring your kids and have a picnic, but remember that the slide will get hot during the pick hours. God bless 🙏

courts.name: Innovation Park
courts.address: 1151 Armorlite Dr, San Marcos, CA 92069, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Rebecca Fuller
pickleballReviews.text:
Nestled into the ally between the new Marc San Marcos apartments and Palomar Station apartments is Innovation Park. When we first pulled up I thought maybe it was restricted to the surrounding residents but it wasn’t gated and is listed as a public park in San Marco’s parks and recreation list. It was small so we didn’t spend a whole lot of time here but my son found the fun in running under the man-made rock arches and watching the teams play pickle ball.

📍approximately 1206 Armorlite Dr, San Marcos, CA 92069
💰This park is free
🚙Free 2 hour street parking on Amorlite Drive
🎠The play structure has a mulch ground surface and is shaded with canopies. No swings.
🪨Climbing rock arches also in mulch
🚽No restrooms
🧺Multiple picnic tables under pavilion
🪑Park benches at playground
🖼Small lawn
🌴Pretty palm tree landscaping
🏏Pickle ball courts
🐶Small fenced-in turf dog park

pickleballReviews.author: tes oligo
pickleballReviews.text:
First time going there to play pickleball.
Lots of good players!
Mixed ages
Easy access parking.

pickleballReviews.author: Samantha
pickleballReviews.text:
I live in the apartment complex directly facing innovation park. I can not stand it. Pickleball players come before designated times to line up with no regard to the people living in the area.

They also stay much later than when it is supposed to be locked. I have even heard heard a GROWN MAN say, "just 15 more minutes", like a child begging for more time on a swing.

Residents at each complex are putting together a petition to change court hours because it is so out of control. Who needs to blast music while playing pickleball?

I have no idea why their is even a park between where people live.

However, the parents who visit the park with their kids are great. Respectful, kind and pick up after themselves.

pickleballReviews.author: Martha Martinez
pickleballReviews.text: There is 2 hour street parking. Playground is behind the pickleball courts. Playground is perfect for littles 5 and under. Clean and a few benches to sit on.

pickleballReviews.author: Jack
pickleballReviews.text: Very nice & clean park! Went for pickleball. There are 4 courts and people do camp out regardless of people waiting.

courts.name: El Toyon Recreation Center
courts.address: 2005 E 4th St, National City, CA 91950, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Silvia Saenz
pickleballReviews.text:
Perfect place for afternoon walks. Basketball courts,  tennis courts, k8d's playgrounds.
Small dog and large dog fenced areas. Plenty of parking.
Be nice pick up after your dogs and enjoy gorgeous sunsets everyday.

courts.name: Murphy Canyon Recreation Center
courts.address: 10395 Orleck St, San Diego, CA 92124, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Hali Clacher
pickleballReviews.text:
One of our favorite playgrounds in all of San Diego!

Things I like about it-

✨️Three different levels of play structures for different ages.

✨️Tables and benches for sitting

✨️A gazebo for parties

✨️Lots of parking close to the playground

✨️One entrance/ exit into the playground. Makes it easy to see who is coming and going.

✨️The playground is fenced in and away from the busy street

✨️There is grass, sand (for the volleyball court), and a sidewalk for all kinds of activities. (Bike riding, soccer, or sand castles).

✨️Always a friend or two to play with for my kids.

💥The downside of this playground is that there aren't restrooms located in the park. We have to go down the street to McDonald's or Starbucks.

courts.name: Egger-South Bay Park
courts.address: 1885 Coronado Ave, San Diego, CA 92154, USA

pickleballReviews.author: whit ennis
pickleballReviews.text: Small but clean, it has 2 playgrounds, baseball fields, soccer/ recreation field, outdoor and in door basketball courts, tennis and hand ball courts as well. And there are these beautiful old trees covering the playground area. Love to bring my little  ones to play here!

pickleballReviews.author: Albert Sais Jr.
pickleballReviews.text: Excellent park and Recreation for neighborhood use. Perfect for parties, picnics, playgrounds or just chillin.  Two playgrounds, outside court, gazebos, lots of shade trees and passive turf areas plus plenty of parking. Staff in Recreation Center is absolutely amazing!!

courts.name: City Heights Recreation Center
courts.address: 4380 Landis St, San Diego, CA 92105, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Shelene Matsumoto
pickleballReviews.text:
Come get COVID tested!! No Line, No waiting!! BACK IN to the parking spaces along the tennis courts & the fields. You will get a $52 ticket if you park head first! Be considerate of the people who live here and don't block their driveways!

Scan the QR code with your camera. Look for the site code below the QR code. Fill out the first section without leaving            --NONE-- for any of the answers. Birthdate format 00-00-0000 and NOT 00/00/0000.

Actual time here is 5 minutes or less as there is no line!!! No waiting!!!

pickleballReviews.author: Anna Castellow
pickleballReviews.text: The pool is open and it’s awesome! There are a lot of kids with fowl language and seem to give the lifeguards grief on the weekends but during the week it’s nice! The tennis courts are nice as well and since the Covid testing stopped it has been way less problematic with people coming into the neighborhood and taking up parking and driving erratically.

pickleballReviews.author: Ethan Van Antwerp
pickleballReviews.text: I come for the tennis courts. The courts are great and lit for night play. The sign out front says “open daily from 10-6”, when in reality the place has only been open half the time I’ve visited during these times. They don’t answer the phone, and they close the courts when there has been rain in the last 48 hours. 5 star facilities. 2 stars off for erratic closures and less than helpful staff.

courts.name: Kearny Mesa Recreation Center
courts.address: 3170 Armstrong St, San Diego, CA 92111, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Jennifer St.Clair
pickleballReviews.text: This place used to have lush green grass outside the Tennis courts and was in pretty clean condition.The Tennis courts are still in good playable.Condition with nice nets and there's a great skate park here, ball field, etc.  The area certainly has a lot of riffraff and trash laying around everywhere and I don't know how safe it would be to stay here in the evening or at night. Be careful 🧐

courts.name: Hillsborough Recreation Center
courts.address: 1208 Manzana Way, San Diego, CA 92139, USA

pickleballReviews.author: L C Willis
pickleballReviews.text:
Nice little area. Wish they had a better playing around for toddlers.  The playground is for 5 years and older. The swing seats are high and the basketball courts are for older kids/adults.
I took my grandson,nephew who is 4 years old and my niece 10 years old who wanted to play basketball. He had a kids ball and still tried to make the shots. They would have enjoyed the courts if their was a kids court.

courts.name: Mira Mesa Recreation Center
courts.address: 8575 New Salem St, San Diego, CA 92126, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Sarah Martin
pickleballReviews.text: My boyfriend and I came here to play pickleball. We were there in line 5 min before this place even opened. We got to the courts and these old ladies and asians immediately took over both courts (they clearly come play everyday and never give anyone else a chance). We waited for a game but were just so frustrated at the situation, the way they wouldn’t even give us a chance to play despite probably playing everyday, and acted like they owned the place. I will not be coming back here and would not recommend even attempting to play a game here it’s just awful.

pickleballReviews.author: Brandon Leuangpaseuth
pickleballReviews.text: Been coming here since I was a kid. Iconic 4th of July fire works here, basketball courts, ping pong, baseball field. Playground. Great place to enjoy the outdoors

courts.name: La Jolla Community Center
courts.address: 6811 La Jolla Blvd, La Jolla, CA 92037, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Mary Engles
pickleballReviews.text: Pleasant center with nice courtyard , concerts & presentations. EaSy to find , only street parking

courts.name: Oaks North Community Center
courts.address: 12578 Oaks N Dr, San Diego, CA 92128, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Sean McHugh
pickleballReviews.text: There's a well stocked library, woodshop, art studio, ceramic studio, pool, hot tub, saunas, pickleball and tennis courts, lawn bowling, classes in many mediums and a small gym room in this 55+ community of Oaks North.

courts.name: Pine Ave. Community Center
courts.address: 3209 Harding St, Carlsbad, CA 92008, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Dawn Hill
pickleballReviews.text: Clean area inside, beautiful Pickleball courts and a nice meeting room. Nice outside area with a playground and covered patio area. Parking was ample during the week and staff were helpful.

pickleballReviews.author: V F
pickleballReviews.text:
Beautiful facility. Great staff and classes. Try the cooking class, it's amazing!

We tried the basketball court and it was great.

courts.name: Mountain View Community Center
courts.address: 641 S Boundary St, San Diego, CA 92113, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Randal Childress
pickleballReviews.text: Softball, baseball and soccer fields indoor basketball court great place for local youths offering opportunities for clean fun for boys and girls community events like Thanksgiving and Christmas dinners please donate for places like this encourage chances for better role models to lead by example wonderful examples

courts.name: Lakeside Community Center
courts.address: 9841 Vine St, Lakeside, CA 92040, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Pounder Pounder
pickleballReviews.text: This community park is truly community oriented. Consisting of a library, a community building with many organized outings and instructional classes for all ages, a n indoor basketball court, dinning room , a scenic lake, skate board park and workout stations and 2 mile trail around the park. Can't beat this place

courts.name: Sports Park
courts.address: 425 Imperial Beach Blvd, Imperial Beach, CA 91932, USA

pickleballReviews.author: CW Fink
pickleballReviews.text:
Better than a sharp stick in the eye...no, really.
Very nice skate-park. Half court basketball. Several (4?) Base/softball fields. Home to I.B. Little League. Old geezers play there on Tuesdays. Picnic area with BBQ grills and pavilion. Large building for activities. Public restrooms. Recently installed EV charging stations. Parking for all. Nearby bus stop. Large grass areas for the pets. (Keep off! the ballfields! Even IF you pick up) This park is kept clean by our city workers (thanks Jeff and others!) AND the birds that nest here! Egrets and herons plus resident Ospreys in the field lights.

courts.name: Leo Mullen Sports Park
courts.address: 951 Via Cantebria, Encinitas, CA 92024, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Priscilla Mendez
pickleballReviews.text: Nice small park with a turf soccer field, basketball court and playground.

courts.name: Henderson Sport Complex
courts.address: 1035 S 45th St, San Diego, CA 92113, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Heaven Morgan
pickleballReviews.text: Also known as 45 Park this place hasn’t changed in decades. Very basic sports complex in the inner city. Lots of open space and grass areas. Small playground. Basketball courts. I have many years of memories going to day camp here as a child. Sand in the playground. Valencia Park Pop Warner practice location as far as I remember. Decent parking but has become a site for people to dump their junk it seems. Overall a long-standing local park in need of some love.

courts.name: Nobel Athletic Area
courts.address: 8810 Judicial Dr, San Diego, CA 92122, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Jonathan (Jonathans.business)
pickleballReviews.text: This is a great park. Particularly because it connects many areas to this giant multifunction park where many people are using it happily but all coexist very functionally and peacefully. There's lots of grass for various things, there's a basketball court, there's a kids playground for families, there are soccer fields and good bathrooms and also a great dog park. A lot of use gets made of this park by many people who enjoy it.

courts.name: On The Rise Tennis Carlsbad
courts.address: Aviara Golf Club- attention Marc Picker, 7447 Batiquitos Dr, Carlsbad, CA 92011, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Elias Manneh
pickleballReviews.text: My daughter been training with " On The Rise Tennis" for the past six months, and I can't recommend the team enough. Their deep understanding of the game combined with their personalized approach to coaching has truly transformed her game. The private classes with the team has helped her improve her technique and strategy, but it has also boosted her confidence on the court. The Rise team passion for tennis is contagious, and their dedication to their students is evident in every session. Whether you're a beginner looking to learn the basics or a seasoned player aiming to take your game to the next level, Tennis on The Rise is the perfect choice. Thank you for everything!!!

pickleballReviews.author: Leila Sefidgari
pickleballReviews.text: I've had the pleasure of entrusting my daughter to this community for the past two years, and I couldn't be happier with her progress. The coach's dedication to his students' development is evident in every lesson. The coach tailors his instruction to suit her individual needs, ensuring she continually improves while fostering a love for the sport. Under his guidance, my daughter's skills have flourished, and she's gained both confidence and competence on the court. I wholeheartedly recommend this community to anyone seeking top-notch tennis instruction.

courts.name: Woodland Park Tennis Courts
courts.address: San Marcos, CA 92069, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Joe
pickleballReviews.text: Best tennis courts in San Marcos. There are 7 courts.

pickleballReviews.author: Jude LeVieux
pickleballReviews.text: Pretty good courts, well built for anyone. You can play pickleball and tennis there. It is apart of the school so it isnt open for that long and there sometimes are kids from the school but if you're in the area definitely would recommend it

courts.name: Marisol Park Tennis Courts
courts.address: 900 N Rancho Del Rey Pkwy, Chula Vista, CA 91910, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Elva Felix
pickleballReviews.text: Excellent park to exercise if you like to play tennis, there are very clean courts, everything

courts.name: SDSU Tennis Center
courts.address: Plaza Deportes, San Diego, CA 92182, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Shelley Lynne Susman
pickleballReviews.text:
While I never got ( so far lol) to play here I find it an amazing g venue especially compared to what we had back in the late 80's .
I hope to be around when my son James Susman takes the court.
He will rock it !!

pickleballReviews.author: Nicholle Willis
pickleballReviews.text: Tons of clean courts, water fountains everywhere, has adult classes available for about $50. You have to enter in through the Aquaplex entrance and then go to the back. Parking always costs ~$3 here, so I'd recommend parking elsewhere and walking in if you already have a SDSU parking permit.

pickleballReviews.author: Kona Boyz
pickleballReviews.text:
What is up with the fence! People pay their taxes to the State of California and this gate better be open! I will make so much trouble if these courts are not available for taxpayers of San Diego!

Aloha,
Murray Estes, CPA
SDSU Alumi

pickleballReviews.author: Indigo Thompson
pickleballReviews.text: Beautiful facility and very friendly staff. The courts are very well taken care of and i had a great experience when I attended the mountain west tennis conference championships!

pickleballReviews.author: Grace
pickleballReviews.text:
Very good tennis courts and the parking is far, but not bad.
These 12 courts are very good, and everybody is verynice

courts.name: Roosevelt Middle School Tennis Courts
courts.address: 3321 Richmond St, San Diego, CA 92103, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Aimee Martinez
pickleballReviews.text: Nice place to walk dogs, nice tennis courts, no bathrooms or play ground. Good place to walk around a path. Nice neighborhood. I come here often with my kids to walk and have a picnic.

pickleballReviews.author: Nicholas Altman
pickleballReviews.text: Court closest to the street is in rough shape. None of the nets have functioning straps in the middle. Other than that it's a great place to play considering it's free.

pickleballReviews.author: David
pickleballReviews.text: On school days the gate to the court is locked until 5pm.  Not useful for the public during winter

courts.name: Montecito Park
courts.address: 16, 1501 Santa Diana Rd, Chula Vista, CA 91913, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Christian Cruz
pickleballReviews.text: This park is very clean and very neat. The have a playground, tennis courts, and basketball courts. They do have a grass area but it's pretty small and there is people practicing there most afternoons. They also have this clubhouse thing where they have a pool, gym, etc.

courts.name: Scripps Legacy Tennis Courts
courts.address: Eastridge Place &, Legacy Rd, San Diego, CA 92131, USA

pickleballReviews.author: James Sweeney
pickleballReviews.text: Private tennis courts for the residents of the Scripps Legacy neighborhood.  Key is passed on with property.  Surface and surrounds well maintained.

courts.name: Mission Hills Tennis Courts
courts.address: 1500 Washington Pl, San Diego, CA 92103, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Sophia Joy
pickleballReviews.text: Great courts! Not very busy midday on a weekday, there was an open court when we got there. Wish there was some shade though cause it was so hot and no shade there

pickleballReviews.author: Scott Barber
pickleballReviews.text: Bad nets, cracked courts & lots of leaf litter.

courts.name: Barnes Tennis Center
courts.address: 4490 W Point Loma Blvd, San Diego, CA 92107, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Ramesh D Foodie
pickleballReviews.text:
Visiting Barnes for second time, this place is just amazing. Great tennis courts and nice to see all tennis people around. Lessons, drills, practices and matches all around. They got some clay courts and pickle ball courts too.
The parking lot could get tought during huge tournaments but they have extended gravel parking lot too.
The pro shop is great and staff is very friendly!!

pickleballReviews.author: Lana Til
pickleballReviews.text: A great place by the ocean. Magnificent tennis courts. There are also padel tennis courts. Everything is new. The changing rooms and toilets are clean. Very large free parking. A good sporting goods store.

pickleballReviews.author: Ro
pickleballReviews.text: It is very professional and well equipped, with 24 tennis courts, which is great. We went there to play and it was a real pleasure. It was a total of 3 days of play and we enjoyed every day.

pickleballReviews.author: Luis Gutierrez Prieto
pickleballReviews.text:
The worst service and lack of respect..!!! We paid money to be in a tennis tournament in this “supposed” tennis club and when we were in the middle of the game, next to the court a party started with loud music and people shouting and getting intoxicated. When I went to complain to the administration they told me “We can’t do anything”

I feel really disappointed that this once good tennis club has fallen.

pickleballReviews.author: Gary Young
pickleballReviews.text: One of San Diego's finest tennis facilities. Always holding great tournaments for the juniors and is now home for the Easter Bowl. last time I was there in 2017 the courts needed resurfacing but that's probably been upgraded. There is ample parking and there are hitting walls in the back. The center stadium court is always well maintained and they still have 4 red clay courts from when the Davis cup played Britain a few years back. The food and beverage selection's r very limited but other than that it's great. Staff is professional and extremely friendly.

courts.name: Cottonwood Creek Park tennis courts
courts.address: 472 Arroyo Dr, Encinitas, CA 92024, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Youssef Samir
pickleballReviews.text: Beautiful place to play tennis or pickle ball, most of the time it’s available, and the good thing is, it’s free

pickleballReviews.author: Matthew Rausche
pickleballReviews.text: Great place to hang out with friends. Has a nice field, playground, basketball court, and many pickleball quarts.

pickleballReviews.author: Teresa Koecher
pickleballReviews.text: The pickleball courts are first come first serve

courts.name: Cuyamaca College Tennis Courts
courts.address: 900 Rancho San Diego Pkwy, El Cajon, CA 92019, USA

pickleballReviews.author: MP Ryan
pickleballReviews.text: I have seen people on the courts and the gate has been unlocked. I don't think they have summer tennis classes, so it must be open for public use.

courts.name: Rancho Peñasquitos Tennis Center
courts.address: 12350 Black Mountain Rd, San Diego, CA 92129, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Brett LaCues
pickleballReviews.text: I played a Christmas tournament here and I was very impressed with the courts and the surrounding area. I felt like I was out in the country with scenic hills and clean air. Most people here seemed friendly.

pickleballReviews.author: Scott Thomas
pickleballReviews.text: Waited ~1.5 yrs to get into this club and left after 1. The Club's resident 'Karen' (aka Julie M) being the reason. What an obnoxious leader to have running a tennis club. The courts are in good shape though, if you like melting in the sun with no shade. Not worth the $$$

pickleballReviews.author: Ken Reynolds
pickleballReviews.text: My tennis club.  Have been member for many years.  Courts are well maintained and monitors are helpful and friendly.  Annual membership fees are reasonable.  Public court is available on first come first basis for a fee.  Private lessons and clinics are available.

pickleballReviews.author: Jacmac
pickleballReviews.text: They don't have anyone to collect fees between 11am to 4pm so they lock the courts up and nobody can use them. It's a public park. Welcome to California.

courts.name: Indoor Pickleball Social at YBA
courts.address: 1091 Tinker Rd, Rocklin, CA 95765, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Pickleball System
pickleballReviews.text: This is a dedicated pickleball facility with multiple courts. Great place to play!

courts.name: Eastern Oak Park
courts.address: 3127 Eastern Ave, Sacramento, CA 95821, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Pavel A Manzyuk
pickleballReviews.text: Very beautiful new Park. My boys are into soccer and this Park is their new home for them. Soccer field, futsal court, basketball court, pickleball courts and playground, did I miss anything this place has it all. They also have two shaded picnic tables areas what BBQ Pits.

pickleballReviews.author: Samantha Donaldson
pickleballReviews.text: There's a pickleball court, soccer field, playground, basketball court, dog park and excellent level concrete to walk laps. I enjoy coming here to walk laps. Family friendly and clean.

pickleballReviews.author: dale phillips
pickleballReviews.text: A well used park.  There is a dog park, pickleball courts, a walking path, a large grass area for soccer, playground, picnic area, and a restroom.

courts.name: Gibbons Community Park
courts.address: 4701 Gibbons Dr, Carmichael, CA 95608, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Karol Cyrklaff
pickleballReviews.text: This is a wonderful, large park with plenty of space for activities. There are tennis courts, basketball courts, playgrounds, water fountains and bathrooms, citrus trees, and acres of grass. I took entirely too many pictures to give a sense of the space. There are two places to park your car/motorcycle - the large parking lot near the community center, and street spots on Cypress.

pickleballReviews.author: Family California
pickleballReviews.text: I love this park, a lot of space and a lot of trees, there is a playground for small children and for older children, a sandbox. barbecue area, two large tennis courts.

pickleballReviews.author: Vandana Rana
pickleballReviews.text: Great neighborhood park, with two kids playareas, tennis court, basketball court, volleyball court, barbeque area, shaded picnic area , restroom and  lot of shaded area to relax. It has ample parking space.

courts.name: Magnolia Park
courts.address: 251 Greg Thatch Cir, Sacramento, CA 95835, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Jess Brown
pickleballReviews.text: This park is amazing!! We live in antelope and drive about 20 minutes just to go here. There are benches to sit, tons of grass and two play grounds. One for 2-5 year-olds and the other one for 5-12 year-olds. In the summer they have two small splash areas for kids to get misted, and a shaded picnic area with small grill. To the far right there are also two tennis courts. Whenever we come here we are almost always the only ones playing. The neighborhood is peaceful and quiet. Hardly any through traffic so it makes it that such safer I feel

pickleballReviews.author: Jason Fortun
pickleballReviews.text: Tennis court review only: The court is not maintained. Overgrown weeds coming out of the cracked concrete. We found poop on a corner of the court. One of the tennis netting had a soccer-ball- sized hole. Faded lines. Never coming back here.

pickleballReviews.author: Justin Williams
pickleballReviews.text: Nice local park for this community. Lots of safe areas for kids of all ages, tennis courts and ton of green open space. It feels safe and I've been there at all hours walking my dogs.

courts.name: The Courts at Gibson Park
courts.address: 201 Gibson Dr, Roseville, CA 95678, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Heath Sherratt
pickleballReviews.text: City engineers put no thought into these courts. They could have put them at a different angle, and the sun would not be such a major factor in the later hours of the day. It basically makes them unplayable during certain hours. That and the placement of the gates...they could be a lot better. A few of the courts have dead spots in them as well

pickleballReviews.author: Johnny Crimson
pickleballReviews.text:
9 pickleball courts with seating areas inside. Everything is really clean including the bathrooms. There's also an "outdoor" seating area by that I mean outside of the pickleball courts. Also they have really good grip so even if there is light rain you can still play.
This is the first phase of the project. They plan on adding basketball courts, tennis courts, and some walking trails.

pickleballReviews.author: Sean Langwell
pickleballReviews.text:
Very nice new pickleball courts, divided into 3 groups of 3 courts by skill.
The official pickleball paddle queue rack was not visible from the courts though, so everyone was just using the standing bench inside as a paddle queue rack. Be aware of that when you go and check with everyone on the courts to make sure you're actually in line to play, unlike me at first 🤣

pickleballReviews.author: Micah McAllister
pickleballReviews.text: Well thought out layout of courts.  Paddles up system works well in a shaded area to rest. People were friendly and games were competitive.

pickleballReviews.author: Zaid Alsultani
pickleballReviews.text: Very nice and new pickleball courts, I hope the city will build Tennis courts as well!! there is plenty of room next to it, and we dont have public tennis courts in Roseville.

courts.name: Lembi Park
courts.address: 1302 Riley St, Folsom, CA 95630, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Raybies Flynn
pickleballReviews.text: It's a nice park. Pretty expansive, with the ball fields and courts. The play area is small, but a useful, added touch for young kids. There are restrooms.

pickleballReviews.author: Adrian Peralta
pickleballReviews.text: Nice park with plenty of room for pickleball. The courts are divided into beginner, intermediate and advanced players. The best thing is that even though it gets packed, the rotation of players is quick and you can play without waiting for too long.

pickleballReviews.author: Kim Tran
pickleballReviews.text: They turned all the tennis courts into pickleball courts. These are probably the best maintained courts in Folsom which is good for the pickleball players but not for the tennis players. Other tennis courts are lacking and sadly, the city doesn't have enough funding.

courts.name: Oasis Park Pickleball
courts.address: 8104 Whitelock Pkwy, Elk Grove, CA 95757, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Pickleball System
pickleballReviews.text: This is a dedicated pickleball facility with multiple courts. Great place to play!

courts.name: San Juan Park
courts.address: 5509 Mariposa Ave, Citrus Heights, CA 95610, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Jon Waldrep
pickleballReviews.text: Nice neighborhood park with a playground and swings for kids and a large open, grassy area for kicking a soccer ball, flying a kite or just letting kids run around. Also has a tennis court and public pickle ball courts. Not a ton of shade on really hot days but on cooler days probably a good place for a walk. Public Restrooms on site

pickleballReviews.author: Jaime Benefeito
pickleballReviews.text: I entered from Kalamazoo, not Mariposa, so the small parking lot works as a waiting area for any appointments. From the Mariposa side, there's a restroom, play area, and tennis courts. It seems very nice for BBQs or children's parties. At times, there can be a lot of traffic on Mariposa, but the park is set back enough that it's not a safety concern for small children.

pickleballReviews.author: J Schultze
pickleballReviews.text: We had a great time on the pickleball courts!! Great to have lighting on the courts as not many parks provide lights.

pickleballReviews.author: Imagine That
pickleballReviews.text: This park is clean. The restrooms are well maintained (at least on my visit it was) i.e, toilet paper stocked, hand soap filled, hand dryer functions as it should.  It has 4 tennis courts, if my memory serves me right. The lawn is well maintained and there's plenty of it for a picnic or party or just laying down and relaxing. Overall, nice location, well kept, and great park to have a birthday party or hangout and relax.

courts.name: Rosemont Community Park
courts.address: 9326 Americana Way, Sacramento, CA 95826, USA

pickleballReviews.author: don Johnson
pickleballReviews.text:
The parking area was quite and shady. Stopped by again and noticed new basketball, tennis and pickleball ⚒️ courts, nice. Lawns are manicured. Restrooms were open. Lots of barbeque areas. Children's play areas.

Darn nice 👍 park 🏞️.

pickleballReviews.author: Arab GentleMan
pickleballReviews.text: Really nice park for this area, perfect for the neighborhood. It Has a Lot of space, baseball diamonds they use for Little League and well maintained Tennis courts and 2 different playgrounds, one for smaller children which is useful if you have youngsters. At times there can be questionable activity so beware if you send your children their alone without supervision.

pickleballReviews.author: Tara Curtis
pickleballReviews.text: Very nice park. Full size tennis court and 2 official pickle ball courts with lights. Also a basketball court with lights. My favorite spot to pickle!!!

courts.name: Wackman Park
courts.address: 5851 Laguna Quail Way, Elk Grove, CA 95758, USA

pickleballReviews.author: John Lagousis
pickleballReviews.text: Nice neighborhood park.  Two tennis courts that are also lined for pickleball!  Lot of grass for the kids and dogs.  Nice playground for the kids!

pickleballReviews.author: Carolyn Boq
pickleballReviews.text: This is one of many starting points for our Saturday Morning Community Walk.  We also like to play pickle ball when we can get a court.

courts.name: Rusch Community Park
courts.address: 7801 Auburn Blvd, Citrus Heights, CA 95610, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Dineen Anderson
pickleballReviews.text: This park is huge. There are play structures, many ball fields, pickle ball courts, a nice community pool, a stream runs through it and I logged a 2.5 mile walk on paths and around the perimeter.  It's a lovely park

courts.name: Walnut Park
courts.address: 2700 Lillard Dr, Davis, CA 95618, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Jason Perry (Xome)
pickleballReviews.text: This park has a huge grassy lawn for sports. It is really ready to go for soccer with ample goals, just get them unlocked...  There is a parking lot as well as plenty of street parking. There are bathrooms on sight too. There is not much shade here at the field and play structure, so bring hats and sun screen. Nice wide bike/walking path along park. Around the bend where the art butterfly thingy is, there is a dog exercise area, please clean up after your dog... Also, a volleyball sand court. Several picnic tables are nestled under the trees here. Lots of shade and a cool Delta breeze. Also, at the far end are 2 play structures that are a lot of fun! This I a nice quiet large park, another gem in Davis.

pickleballReviews.author: Ryan B
pickleballReviews.text: This is a big park with a little bit of everything. The fields are sunny and the picnic area is shady. Lots of tables and grills. One playground that's part of the adjacent school, another near the center, and a third on the opposite end. Several large soccer fields but they are reserved during a certain time of year. About 6 tennis courts and 1 sand volleyball court (with net). There are basketball hoops at the school. Parking is not often a problem. They have several parking lots and there is access from all the surrounding streets.

courts.name: Woodbridge Park
courts.address: 415 Sierra Blvd, Roseville, CA 95678, USA

pickleballReviews.author: L
pickleballReviews.text: "What a beautiful Sunshiny day. Oh happy days. When Jesus washed our sins away". I love singing that song when I'm walking through parks. The trees and breeze running through my skin refreshes me for another day or so. Woodbridge Park is a beautifully landscaped and playground pit for the kiddo's and tennis courts to swing that racquet and ball.

pickleballReviews.author: Eddie Litvinov
pickleballReviews.text:
Nice Lil Park which has a half-court basketball court and a few tennis courts. I particularly liked the gazebo area that it has.

Don't worry about tables and 2 grills.

courts.name: Pauline and Richard Roccucci Park
courts.address: 2110 Symphony Ave, Roseville, CA 95747, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Kaye Swain Roseville REALTOR
pickleballReviews.text: Great little park. My grandkids and I loved the zipline and playing on the slide. It has pickleball courts! Terrific!

pickleballReviews.author: Carlo Lacambra
pickleballReviews.text: Picnic shed has 4 tables. The playground has a beach/summer decor. Has character. There is a couple of tennis courts on site, but there appears no public restroom. The lawns are trim and green. Nice and quiet place until the afternoon crowds arrive to hang out. Not a bad thing. Play structure appears to be for kids between 6-12 (I did not check the signs).

courts.name: Miller Park
courts.address: 8480 Sunset Ave, Fair Oaks, CA 95628, USA

pickleballReviews.author: joe fosteson
pickleballReviews.text: Great park, excellent use of a small space. There is a playground,  9 hole disc golf course. The park offers tennis courts with lights. One of the only places with a pickle ball wall. There are clean bathrooms, large area for parking. Lots of trees for shade.

pickleballReviews.author: Annette Burton
pickleballReviews.text: Great place to relax. My granddaughters favorite park. They bring their scooter, skateboard, and frisbees. There are tennis and basketball courts, nice frisbee golf course, and plenty of area for the kiddos to burn off energy.

courts.name: Cabrillo Park
courts.address: 1825 67th Ave, Sacramento, CA 95822, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Kim Johan-Nass
pickleballReviews.text: Clean, street parking around perimeter.  Large grassy area, benches, picnic tables, tennis courts, baseball field and two play areas for youngsters.

pickleballReviews.author: David Merritt
pickleballReviews.text: Glad to find two open pickleball courts in my old neighborhood this Christmas weekend. Others in town were crowded witg families eager to play this newly popular game. The game's boundaries are painted over the tennis court lines, but that works all the same.

courts.name: Davies park
courts.address: Tennis courts, 91 Valley Falls Pl, Folsom, CA 95630, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Ajay S
pickleballReviews.text: Best neighborhood park hands down! Always super clean and family friendly. Tennis courts, 2 sets of basketball courts, jungle gym, & a huge green grass field to run around in. Also love the trails & barbeque areas. Our favorite park for the kids and parents!

pickleballReviews.author: John Hough
pickleballReviews.text: Great little community park with two covered picnic areas, two basketball courts, two tennis courts, a playground area and a large open well kept field. Great for multiple recreational activities.

pickleballReviews.author: Helen Ben Maor
pickleballReviews.text: Nicely kept,  large park with baseball fields fenced in, small children's park, water fountain,  tennis courts, and walking paths

courts.name: Alyce Norman Bryte Playfield
courts.address: 1225 Carrie St, West Sacramento, CA 95605, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Cristina Dzh
pickleballReviews.text: So much space for kids to run around, and there are 2 playgrounds not far from each other. from basketball court, to baseball field. Love the variety!

courts.name: Redwood Park
courts.address: 1001 Anderson Rd, Davis, CA 95616, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Robert Cunningham
pickleballReviews.text:
Nice pickleball courts. Not too crowded.easy access from parking lot.
Temporary restroom

pickleballReviews.author: Jim Van Velzer
pickleballReviews.text: Lovely place.  But with a school, Tennis courts and playground close together a bit crowded at one end.

courts.name: Village Park
courts.address: 919 Arnold St, Davis, CA 95618, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Jennifer Trujillo
pickleballReviews.text: Super shady park with two playstructures, bench swing, picnic tables and basketball court. Right off of a nice bike path that leads to diamond park and the oakshade shopping center.

courts.name: Lembi Park Tennis Courts
courts.address: 1302 Riley St, Folsom, CA 95630, USA

pickleballReviews.author: AY Y
pickleballReviews.text: The tennis courts are clean and always lite at night. They are designed in series so you do have to go through each court to get to the next one. It’s not crowded that much. There are plenty of parking available. Public bathroom is also available in the park itself.

pickleballReviews.author: Joey Balay (JoeyB)
pickleballReviews.text: Great pickleball crowd!

courts.name: Joe Hernandez Park
courts.address: 6901 Ballantrae Way, Rocklin, CA 95677, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Roger Bautista
pickleballReviews.text: I like that this park has lights on the basketball court. It's not super bright but it's enough. I don't play basketball, just do sprints on the court, lol. I came after work aroun 10PM and it was enough to see what you're doing.

courts.name: Oasis Dog Park
courts.address: Whitelock Pkwy & Ped Crosswalk (EB, Elk Grove, CA 95757, USA

pickleballReviews.author: DavidC EG
pickleballReviews.text:
The park is pretty nice. The dog park is quite large. There are also tennis courts and pickleball courts.

As far as pickleball courts go it's probably the one of the best and widest selections you're going to find South Sacramento down to Galt probably.

And the pickleball course were built from the bottom up so they're not just tennis courts with extra lines on them.

courts.name: Rusch Park West-End
courts.address: 7801 Auburn Blvd, Citrus Heights, CA 95610, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Justin Cone
pickleballReviews.text: Wonderful Pickleball courts that are lit until 10pm, Events center, beautiful public pool and several softball/baseball fields. Make sure you lock your car and hide your valuables, especially in the evenings.

pickleballReviews.author: Kevin Walker
pickleballReviews.text: Great park. Has bathrooms, multiple kids play areas, a basketball court, baseball field, a skate park, open grassy areas, plenty of walking paths, trash cans, a WWII Memorial, a dry creek bed (Cripple Creek - they named it, not me) a covered picnic area, barbeques, and fancy water fountains (dog bowl and water bottle fillers).

courts.name: LH Pickleball Courts - Private
courts.address: Lincoln, CA 95648, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Pickleball System
pickleballReviews.text: This is a dedicated pickleball facility with multiple courts. Great place to play!

courts.name: Exploration Park
courts.address: 12145 Hetch Hechy Dr, Rancho Cordova, CA 95742, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Christopher
pickleballReviews.text:
A fantastic new park, especially for kids.  Amazing playground with a basketball hoop and two pickle ball courts!

Draco and Skippy loved it too with all the grass and a dog water station.  Recently they also added poop bags to pick up after them.  They're still waiting though for a park with a dog park.  So many great parks now in the area but not a single one with an area for the doggies to run free.

pickleballReviews.author: Ellen Wysocki
pickleballReviews.text:
I really must commend the park designers on this one! Probably most important is there is a lot of shade over the structure which will be especially helpful in the summer. I also appreciate that the picnic spot is up on the hill and overlooks the park so us parents can have a view of everything while the kids are being independent. There have also always been other kids there any time we go which I really like to help my 2.5 yo with learning important social skills. Also, the playground is set back from the street so if you’ve got a runner, you’ve got some leeway.

It has pickleball courts which I haven’t tried, but there’s also always people there. And there’s a half basketball court.

Downside is no bathrooms.

pickleballReviews.author: Tyler Huson
pickleballReviews.text: This is an amazing park! The kids loved being here and can’t wait to go back! The pickleball courts are great!

courts.name: Eastern Oak Park Pickleball Courts
courts.address: Sacramento, CA 95821, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Pickleball System
pickleballReviews.text: This is a dedicated pickleball facility with multiple courts. Great place to play!

courts.name: Hall Memorial Park
courts.address: 285 E Chestnut St, Dixon, CA 95620, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Megan Dessel
pickleballReviews.text:
Nice park. It’s clean, has tennis courts, baseball fields, two children’s playgrounds, a pool, skate park, and tables for picnics. Oh, and a frisbee golf course!
Plenty of trees to provide shade and a nice walking path around the whole thing. I love to come by and throw the frisbee around or walk on my lunch. It’s perfect to come and unwind during the evenings and read, too.

courts.name: Johnson Ranch Sports Club- North
courts.address: 2501 Eureka Rd, Roseville, CA 95661, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Ed VanTil
pickleballReviews.text: Was here for a pickleball tournament. Courts a pretty good, with a few cracks here and there. The facility is super nice, and the staff was great! They allowed me to shower after my tournament, before my 2.5 hour drive home, thank you!

pickleballReviews.author: Vlad Linnik (Prosto Vlad)
pickleballReviews.text:
Great sports club, indoor and outdoor basketball court on this South side, lots of tennis courts the swimming pool is awesome, but is really busy at times (check the calendar for swimming competitions). Jacuzzi is super big and comfortable. Kids room is the best and they have an employee watching kids play. Looker rooms are clean. Great customer service

👍👍👍

pickleballReviews.author: Erika Englund
pickleballReviews.text: Spend a little more and go to Lifetime for a cleaner, much newer, friendlier facility. The sauna & steam room almost never work. There are few group ex classes and almost nothing on weekends/after hours, so if you have a job, you're out of luck. The staff is negligent. My son got a head injury during a kids' class and they didn't tell me. They also let my son leave kid's club alone. One night they closed without checking the pool and left me locked me outside alone without my keys or purse and no way to exit. They have one staff member at night, so if it's a male, the female locker rooms are a disaster and never have towels. The pickleball staff are nice, but they're always having tournaments, so it's tough to get a weekend  court. We wanted to have a better experience.

courts.name: Sunrise Pickleball Club
courts.address: 7801 Auburn Blvd, Citrus Heights, CA 95610, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Pickleball System
pickleballReviews.text: This is a dedicated pickleball facility with multiple courts. Great place to play!

courts.name: Johnson Ranch Sports Club- South
courts.address: 2600 Eureka Rd, Roseville, CA 95661, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Victor Almager
pickleballReviews.text: The most welcoming and complete sports club in Placer County, El Dorado County, Sacramento County, and surrounding cities and towns. Everything from 28 pristine lighted pickleball courts to Squash, Racquetball , Pilates, 25 lighted tennis courts, Yoga, Tabata, Cycling and Spin, full court indoor basketball, Cryotherapy and Massage, Swim classes off the hook, Sauna, Kids Club, Play Center, two Cafes, weight rooms and free weights everywhere. Top of the line performance and fitness machines for anyone striving to improve one's health. Plenty of instructors and professionals to get you going. Come check it out. Oh, and you'll love the members and friendly and proficient staff! ⚽⛹️🏀🎾 🏸🏃‍♀️🏃🧘

pickleballReviews.author: Siva Kumar
pickleballReviews.text: Friendly staff , plenty of activities,pool and pickleball courts are best.

pickleballReviews.author: Brian Clark
pickleballReviews.text: Great pickleball courts, everyone friendly

courts.name: Oak Ridge Pickleball Courts
courts.address: Harvard Wy, El Dorado Hills, CA 95762, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Pickleball System
pickleballReviews.text: This is a dedicated pickleball facility with multiple courts. Great place to play!

courts.name: Woodland Area Pickleball Association
courts.address: Any Street, Woodland, CA 95766, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Pickleball System
pickleballReviews.text: This is a dedicated pickleball facility with multiple courts. Great place to play!

courts.name: Broadstone Sports Club
courts.address: 820 Halidon Way, Folsom, CA 95630, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Alex Rana
pickleballReviews.text: Well managed sports club with friendly and helpful staff. Plenty of tennis and pickleball courts. And two swimming pools. Gym is very decent as well.

pickleballReviews.author: Kip Baumann
pickleballReviews.text: Excellent pickleball courts and fun time doing advanced liveball drills with Samantha and pro Dustin Davis!

pickleballReviews.author: Amer Malik
pickleballReviews.text: Beautiful club with lot of tennis courts. Played our sectional match here

pickleballReviews.author: Dan Delise
pickleballReviews.text: Been a member since 2008. Great facility with 22 tennis courts. I have also been taking tennis lessons from Alejandro Lacruz for the last six years, Alejandro is the "Very Best" at what he does, a great asset to Broadstone Racquet Club!!!

courts.name: Twin Oaks Park Tennis Courts
courts.address: 2820 Theona Way, Rocklin, CA 95765, USA

pickleballReviews.author: David Kislyanka
pickleballReviews.text: There are three tennis courts, very well managed and in great condition. There is also a decent basketball full-court right behind.

pickleballReviews.author: Kellie Borges
pickleballReviews.text: Great courts! They are pretty busy especially on the weekends.

pickleballReviews.author: Brian Rocuant
pickleballReviews.text: Nice clean courts.

courts.name: Galt Community Park
courts.address: 1000 Walnut Ave, Galt, CA 95632, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Pamela Glasgow Enmark
pickleballReviews.text: Clean, shady and great places for the children to play. They have tennis courts, a place for volleyball, restrooms and a large covered area for barbecuing and a party.

courts.name: Ed Mitchell Park
courts.address: 306 Willow Creek Dr, Folsom, CA 95630, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Dana Sutton
pickleballReviews.text: Nice quiet hilly park. Parking, Bathrooms, playground,  Sidewalks for long walks. Many tennis courts. Flat areas for soccer etc.

pickleballReviews.author: Sumaithri Mukkamalla
pickleballReviews.text: Nice walking space with lots of tennis courts. They do have lights, so can play after sunset too!

pickleballReviews.author: Sean O'Brien
pickleballReviews.text: Nice park and we'll maintained. We predominantly utilize the tennis courts of which there are many and they all have lights! There is also restrooms and a small playground. The majority of the park  is dominated by soccer fields. The park backs into the middle school and it is hard to tell where one ends and the other begins. But the large blacktop at the back of the school and the small old workout area is accessible from the park as well!

pickleballReviews.author: Kirsten Keana Brogdon (Keana Brogdon)
pickleballReviews.text: Very nice open park that never seems to be busy when we have come on both weekends and weekdays to use the tennis courts. We have also always found the tennis courts are available other than once for a tournament. Nice park to sit in the shade and have a picnic as well!

courts.name: Springfield at Whitney Oaks
courts.address: 2801 Springfield Dr, Rocklin, CA 95765, USA

pickleballReviews.author: David Louie
pickleballReviews.text: Great set up... all the typical Country Club things (gym, swim pool, tennis courts, billiards room)... plus nice facilities for arts and crafts.  (Although, I wished they had a steam room.)

courts.name: Curtis Park
courts.address: 3349 W Curtis Dr, Sacramento, CA 95818, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Hillary Jenning
pickleballReviews.text: A great park. One mile around so it’s easy to track your distance. Very dog friendly place. If there is sunlight there are people here, but it has never felt really crowded to me. Depending on the time of year you’ll see groups of varying ages playing organized sports. Lots of trees as well as cute interesting houses to look at. In the middle there’s a tennis court, and beside that a kid’s playground.

courts.name: Cannon Station Park
courts.address: Nut Tree Rd, Vacaville, CA 95687, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Ryan “Ebs” Eberle
pickleballReviews.text:
Great park. Large equipmentneith swings and multiple slides. A smaller kid section though it's a little sparse. Lots of concrete picnic benches. Large amount of green space with some medium sized trees. Shade is common but lacking on the equipment. 1 tennis court and 2 basketball courts, and a baseball backstop.

Beautiful park for all sorts of team sports, young kids, and families. Picnics a must.

Biggest downside is lack of a public restroom.

pickleballReviews.author: The Wilkerson Group
pickleballReviews.text:
Canon Station Park in the beautiful Foxboro/Southtown area of Vacaville!  Let me tell you, this community park is an absolute delight!  Whether you're looking to have a peaceful picnic or engage in some exciting outdoor activities, Canon Station Park has got you covered!
Calling all sports enthusiasts! Canon Station Park boasts two fantastic basketball courts and a top-notch tennis court. So, if you're up for a friendly game or two, grab your gear and head on over! The courts are waiting for some serious action!

But wait, there's more!  The open space in the park is perfect for any linear game you can think of! Whether it's soccer, frisbee, or even a game of tag, you'll have plenty of room to unleash your competitive spirit!

pickleballReviews.author: Maricruz Balbuena (Mari)
pickleballReviews.text:
This park has the biggest slides I’ve seen 😄 to
To top it off there’s 4 of them 😃 fun for all ages. There’s swings, monkey bars, a rock to climb, and a tennis court as well. Tables, benches, and a water fountain as well.  Unfortunately no restrooms 😣 so 4 stars it is.

courts.name: Miwok Park
courts.address: 9344 Village Tree Dr, Elk Grove, CA 95758, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Michael W.
pickleballReviews.text: Many parks in Elk Grove have playgrounds, tennis courts, picnic areas, and soccer fields. But not too many parks have them all. Miwok Park, one of the parks, has all of them. The park also has many big trees. Most of the areas are shaded. Walking in the park is enjoyable and comfortable.

pickleballReviews.author: Curtis A
pickleballReviews.text: They probably should the p ark "squirrel park". There are so many squirrels running around the park....it is crazy, but entertaining. The play structure is made with a type of wood product and it is safe for the kids to play on. This park has a tennis court and a lot of shade trees for comfort.

pickleballReviews.author: Ed Gonzalez
pickleballReviews.text: Nice community park.  Great for young children and teens.  Several tennis courts available also. Large grass area with soccer goals.

courts.name: Heritage Park
courts.address: 4016 Palmdale Dr, El Dorado Hills, CA 95762, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Daniel
pickleballReviews.text:
In front of the new apartment, there's a new playground and tennis courts.
The free parking area is spacious, and there are several tennis courts.

The playground is recommended for children under 5 years old.
A unique feature of this playground is that it includes play equipment where children can play musical instruments.

pickleballReviews.author: Antonio Starks
pickleballReviews.text: There's so many great features in this park! Love the green color theme. Very peaceful! This park is clean , fun and very big! I really wish one of the 4 tennis courts was a basketball court. There are some fun musical toys , a raft swing and large spinning toy to sit on and lots and lots of tables , benches and BBQ pits along with a bathroom area. Dog friendly as well. We have run into a few others who seem judgemental and one older woman who actually cussed us out for being at the park after dusk as we were on our way out ( she seemed old and miserable ) but other than that this park is always a blast! We try to come multiple times a week. Definitely recommended!

pickleballReviews.author: Carlos Castro
pickleballReviews.text:
This is a wonderful park to visit, if your a resident then you have full access to the tennis courts and the club house, but if not the park is very nice. This location has nice working bathrooms and a nice play area it could be alittle better if it had a few canopy sails but still a great place, also has some great paved trails for walking and lots of grass for dogs to play catch.

Overall wonderful place!!

pickleballReviews.author: Deepthi P
pickleballReviews.text: Very clean park with a great, well maintained playground and a large field. Has space for small get-togethers and tennis courts as well.

courts.name: Mahany Park
courts.address: 1545 Pleasant Grove Blvd, Roseville, CA 95747, USA

pickleballReviews.author: thegardengazer
pickleballReviews.text: Beautiful park filled with oaks and wildflowers. The trails are fun to explore walking or biking.  Healthy recreations like basketball court, soccer field, tennis courts and kids playground. It’s a fun place to spend time.

courts.name: Foulks Tennis Court
courts.address: 9401 Quesnel Cir, Elk Grove, CA 95758, USA

pickleballReviews.author: B Hochmann
pickleballReviews.text: Nice tennis courts. Recent resurfaced

courts.name: Willows Park
courts.address: 344 Ogden Way, Vacaville, CA 95687, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Brenda Carwile
pickleballReviews.text: Playground equipment rated for children 5-12.  Swings high for anyone under 5, no baby swings. Basketball court and picnic tables round out the park nicely.  A stretch of grass is often utilized by people to exercise their dogs with a game of fetch.  Water fountain present and working, no bathroom facilities.

pickleballReviews.author: James Zhang
pickleballReviews.text:
Has two picnic tables, a small lawn, and a basketball court! Good for hanging with friends.

No bathroom, but there’s a nearby shopping plaza with a Walmart (~4 min drive)

pickleballReviews.author: Nick Muresan
pickleballReviews.text: Great Park For kids ages 5 to 12. Basketball court a lot of picnic area very quiet my son had an amazing time.

courts.name: Del Norte Club
courts.address: 3040 Becerra Way, Sacramento, CA 95821, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Ryan Mundschenk
pickleballReviews.text: Wonderful and welcoming club that offers a fitness center, indoor AND outdoor pool, tennis courts, a bunch of classes, concession stand, kids care... I feel like I could go on and on. Incredibly kind staff. My wife, son and I come here just about every day and love it. Come check it out. You won't regret it.

pickleballReviews.author: Victor Horvath
pickleballReviews.text: Absolutely great! Very few people. Pool was perfect even in the middle of a 100F day. Machines available by the dozen, so as tennis courts. Nice staff, tons of activities available. Reasonable membership. I love ❤️ it. The pool is great for pro racers, depth, timer, etc.

courts.name: Life Time
courts.address: 110 Healthy Wy, Folsom, CA 95630, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Samuel K
pickleballReviews.text: Gorgeous gym, with absolutely everything you can think of. Membership is a premium membership ($199/person and up) yet there's all the top of the line equipment, different temperature pools, wet/dry sauna, hot tubs, showers, and much much more. New pickleball courts are also available to be used, but bring your own equipment. You can even leave your kids for up to 3hrs where they will be supervised at a dedicated daycare.

courts.name: Pickleball Courts at Bryte Park
courts.address: 1225 Carrie St, West Sacramento, CA 95605, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Pickleball System
pickleballReviews.text: This is a dedicated pickleball facility with multiple courts. Great place to play!

courts.name: Carmichael Park
courts.address: 5750 Grant Ave, Carmichael, CA 95608, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Sir Bader
pickleballReviews.text: Nice park. It is used by many but well kept. Roads aren't very well lit at night. There are not enough bathrooms for its size and number of visitors. It has a stage and large playground. Basketball and tennis courts. Disc Golf, but I'm not sure how many holes it has. Dog park divided between large and small. Has access on all sides. Several baseball and softball fields.

pickleballReviews.author: L Weaver
pickleballReviews.text: My dog loves the dog park and loves to bark at the resident squirrel population.  The tennis courts and frisbee golf course are well liked and the Sunday farmer's market runs year round.

courts.name: Swanston Community Center
courts.address: 2350 Northrop Ave, Sacramento, CA 95825, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Branden Tillman
pickleballReviews.text: Beware of Officer J. Mohamed (badge# 130)! Overzealous "peace officer" for the parks police. He willingly over looked the visabliy drunk (or high) unhoused gentleman who was vacillating between yelling and dozing on the bench mere feet away from the splash park (were my young childern happened to be playing), and the group of teens smoking weed in the tennis court as he was far to busy writing a minor fix-it ticket for my car. This is the sort of predatory ticketing that gives municipalities "black-eyes" and leaves park-goers with a bad taste. Officer Mohamed should be ashamed of himsef, and ought to propperly walk his beat in lieu of trolling the parking lot for ($25.00) low hanging fruit.

courts.name: West Sacramento Recreation Center
courts.address: 2801 Jefferson Blvd #5317, West Sacramento, CA 95691, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Colin Yu
pickleballReviews.text: No matter for kids or families, it is a true recreation home all time, specially during the summer! I like the swimming pool, gym and rock climbing area! My kids are fun of tennis courts and kids fun area as well!

courts.name: Foothill Community Center
courts.address: 5510 Diablo Dr, Sacramento, CA 95842, USA

pickleballReviews.author: John Berchielli
pickleballReviews.text: Free parking and entrance. Playground soccer fields lots of open space par fitness course tennis courts and a public restroom. The community Center is rental able and has several amenities. There is also a huge covered picnic area.

courts.name: Hagan Community Center
courts.address: 2197 Chase Dr, Rancho Cordova, CA 95670, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Victor H. Yanez
pickleballReviews.text: Good resource for community with rentable event space,  nice courtyard and entryas well as community pools

courts.name: Florin Creek Recreation Center
courts.address: 7460 Persimmon Ave, Sacramento, CA 95823, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Rosario Dowling
pickleballReviews.text: No basketball courts. Plenty of grass and shade from mature trees.

courts.name: West Sacramento Community Center
courts.address: 1075 W Capitol Ave, West Sacramento, CA 95691, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Lloyd Gavin
pickleballReviews.text:
I visit this library to help a young man who has problems with his high school math course. The library has a large communuty room(must be reserved), study rooms, areas for solo concentration,  and very comfortable cafeteria style booths one can share with another. The study rooms have a white board and ample seating for three. The booths are in the body of the library, so one should be courteous when talking to a partner.

The library staff is very friendly, helpful, and professional. The library is clean, well-lighted, inviting, and an excellent place to meditate, study, or concentrate. There is parking, but one has to depend on the gods at certain times of the day.

courts.name: City of Fairfield Community Center
courts.address: 1000 Kentucky St, Fairfield, CA 94533, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Sir Jones 78
pickleballReviews.text: Front desk attendee was knowledgeable and courteous.  Signed my son up for karate. This is the second time around. The activities are affordable for adults and children

courts.name: Hal Bartholomew Sports Park
courts.address: 10150 Franklin High Rd, Elk Grove, CA 95757, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Keith LaGrone
pickleballReviews.text:
Just got here.   Parking is a little difficult here, but the complex looks nice.  I'm here for the softball game, three diamonds and all the bleachers are covered.  It's not hot today, which is good, but it's covered nicely.

Soccer fields are turf and the tennis courts have a nice crowd Of people and I can't really see what's going on.

courts.name: Ernie Sheldon Youth Sports Park
courts.address: 362 Natoma Station Dr, Folsom, CA 95630, USA

pickleballReviews.author: BP
pickleballReviews.text: Large park but so unmaintained. The tennis courts are a disaster, people use them as their own personal dog park which doesn't help. There's broken lights, and ,debris everywhere. This park could use a serious revamping!

courts.name: Capital Sports Center
courts.address: 5209 Luce Ave, McClellan Park, CA 95652, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Shamsurahman Hazim
pickleballReviews.text: We've been playing volleyball at Capital Sports Center for a few years now, and it's always been a fantastic experience! The indoor volleyball court is top-notch, the facilities are well-maintained, and the service is exceptional. The overall atmosphere is perfect for a game. I highly recommend it and would definitely give it a 5-star rating.

courts.name: Stonegate Park
courts.address: 150 Stonegate Dr, Vacaville, CA 95687, USA

pickleballReviews.author: The Wilkerson Group
pickleballReviews.text:
I recently had the pleasure of visiting Stonegate Park in Vacaville, and I must say it was a fantastic experience. This park truly has something for everyone, from sports enthusiasts to families with young children.

One of the highlights of Stonegate Park is the well-maintained basketball court. Whether you're a serious player or just looking to shoot some hoops for fun, this court provides ample space and a smooth surface for a great game. It's wonderful to see a park that caters to the sports community and encourages physical activity.

Another aspect that impressed me was the vast open space available for various field sports. Whether it's soccer, football, or any other field-based game, Stonegate Park offers plenty of room to run, play, and compete. The well-manicured grass and clear boundaries make it a joy to participate in team sports or simply enjoy a friendly match with friends.

For families with kids, the park's play structure is truly awesome. Designed with safety in mind, the play structure offers a variety of engaging activities that keep children entertained for hours. It's clear that a lot of thought has gone into its design, ensuring that kids can climb, slide, and explore in a secure environment. The play structure is well-maintained and appears to be in excellent condition, which is a testament to the park's commitment to providing a safe and enjoyable experience for children.

Overall, Stonegate Park in Vacaville is a wonderful outdoor space that caters to a wide range of interests. The combination of a well-equipped basketball court, expansive field space, and an impressive play structure makes it an ideal destination for both sports enthusiasts and families with young children. The park is clean, well-maintained, and offers a welcoming environment for visitors of all ages. I highly recommend paying a visit to Stonegate Park if you're in the area; you won't be disappointed

pickleballReviews.author: Maricruz Balbuena (Mari)
pickleballReviews.text: Love the set up of this park. It has a basketball court, swings, shaded playground, & a lot of grass to play ball. Only reason I’m not giving it 5 stars is because there is no restrooms ☹️
