courts.name: Dugan Park
courts.address: 1432 Diamond Woods Cir, Roseville, CA 95747, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Sheng Lor
pickleballReviews.text: Great small community park to bring the kids. They don't have bathrooms but we did spot a porter potty near the walking/bike trail. They have a Basketball court. We complained to the city that the swings were chewed up by someone's dog possibly and they have replaced them.

courts.name: Kaseberg Park
courts.address: 1151 Rand Way, Roseville, CA 95747, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Finding The Force
pickleballReviews.text: I can’t believe we have been driving down foothills for years and never knew about this secret park. This place is humongous! Has a huge picnic area, bathroom, two playgrounds, two baseball fields, and a volleyball court. There’s so much wide open grass I don’t think people even know what to do with all of it. Plenty of trash cans and drinking fountains. Might be our new favorite park.

pickleballReviews.author: Elmer Maylene Penid
pickleballReviews.text: Very nice park. They have clean restrooms, barbecue grills, picnic tables with shade. Beach volleyball court, baseball fields and playgrounds for kids and for small children. You can walk, jogging and even biking. Plenty of parking in quiet neighborhood.

courts.name: McKinley Tennis Courts
courts.address: 3200-3298 McKinley Blvd, Sacramento, CA 95816, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Danaela Hutchinson
pickleballReviews.text: Loved it here! Thought it was 24 hours but the lights all turned off at about 11pm while we were on the court. Not sure if there is a switch or timer or something we had to trigger.

pickleballReviews.author: Sara Cullen-Fong
pickleballReviews.text: Lots of courts, good lighting for night tennis, and nice that it's open late!

pickleballReviews.author: Veniamin Milish
pickleballReviews.text: The courts "themselves" are nice and clean, but they're nearly always occupied. Either by classes or just other people. At times (especially weekends) very challenging to find a parking spot... And I feel bad for the residents whose parkings are always taken((

courts.name: Antelope Tennis Center
courts.address: 7900 Falcon View Dr, Antelope, CA 95843, USA

pickleballReviews.author: L Weaver
pickleballReviews.text: Great tennis courts.  Nice large oak woodland to walk the dog.

pickleballReviews.author: Erghe Poston
pickleballReviews.text: Love it here.  Lots of courts in Antelope and these are definitely the best.  Some courts have cracks so watch for that and most of them have windscreens all around.  One court has a ball wall at the end which is kinda annoying if you just want to use it and not take up a court.  Also, the bathrooms are all the way over on the other side of the baseball fields.  It's a walk... If they're open.  I'll update if I play at night for when the lights go down.

pickleballReviews.author: Czerina B.
pickleballReviews.text: Lovely tennis courts, clean and well taken care of. Occasionally there will be people that try to gatekeep the courts sorry but these are open to the public.

pickleballReviews.author: James Lauj
pickleballReviews.text: Good lighting at night, court is pretty niceee xD

courts.name: Marya Welch Tennis Center
courts.address: 345 Tennis Ct Ln, Davis, CA 95616, USA

pickleballReviews.author: pranav gupta
pickleballReviews.text: Nice courts

pickleballReviews.author: Greg Bartlett
pickleballReviews.text: Standard tennis courts.  Well maintained.

courts.name: Covell Park Tennis Courts
courts.address: 252 Mercedes Ct, Davis, CA 95616, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Jim Van Velzer
pickleballReviews.text: These tennis courts are in quite poor condition with many large cracks and crevices which significantly impact play.  Net is adequate.  Fencing is also adequate.  Nice location.  Trees and a berm limit wind.  Next to a children's play area.  Not usually crowded.

pickleballReviews.author: Mic.E Bay-B
pickleballReviews.text: Two tennis courts that are fresh an ready for the U.S. Open

courts.name: Tennis Courts | Hawkins Park
courts.address: 118 Coulter Way, Vacaville, CA 95687, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Roberto Bustamante
pickleballReviews.text: Nice tennis courts with playground for kids.Good walkway too.

pickleballReviews.author: Lawrence Brooks
pickleballReviews.text: Nice tennis courts,nice park.

courts.name: Cameron Park Lake Tennis Courts
courts.address: 2989 Cambridge Rd, Cameron Park, CA 95682, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Chris Lee
pickleballReviews.text: We love to play pickleball here.

courts.name: Pecan Park Tennis Courts
courts.address: 5945 Pecan Ave, Orangevale, CA 95662, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Robert Richman
pickleballReviews.text: Needs lights to play when it gets darker early. Nice court

courts.name: Cresta Park Tennis Court
courts.address: 4033 Cresta Way, Sacramento, CA 95864, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Elyse Ching
pickleballReviews.text: Only 1 court. On a Saturday morning it was available. Nice clean bathrooms too. Would recommend! Has pickleball lines too.

courts.name: Husted Park
courts.address: 1200 S Merrill St, Corona, CA 92882, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Kristopher Marshall
pickleballReviews.text: Nice park for baseball, pickleball, and a "half court" game of basketball.

pickleballReviews.author: Vanessa Guzman
pickleballReviews.text: It's a cute little park. There's a big field to the left and the kids playground is in the middle. Tennis court in the back. It's really peaceful. Down side is that there seems to be a lot of suspicious activity in the parking lot. Random people staying in their cars until the person theyre waiting for comes and then after they meet they both leave. It's constant. I don't know what exactly they do but one can speculate. They don't even go into the park. But during the day it's nice

pickleballReviews.author: Tony Valles
pickleballReviews.text:
I grew up in the neighborhood and this place has a special place in my heart. The playground has two play areas, one for 2-5 year olds and the second for 5-12 year olds.
There is half court for basketball and tennis court. The tennis court has no fence so good luck with the balls that get away. The park has handicapped and wheelchair accessible parking on Merrill. Regular parking is behind 11th street and the park in the alley. The restrooms were locked so come prepared.

courts.name: EHR pickle ball court
courts.address: Highland, CA 92346, USA

courts.name: Pickleball Chalet
courts.address: 18283 Pasadena St Unit 100, Lake Elsinore, CA 92530, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Pickleball System
pickleballReviews.text: This is a dedicated pickleball facility with multiple courts. Great place to play!

courts.name: La Ladera Park
courts.address: 29629 La Ladera Rd, Menifee, CA 92584, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Eduardo Sanchez (Mehtore)
pickleballReviews.text:
It's open to all, n created as part of the none gated housing community houses built around it, restroom is keyless, its roughly around 8 acres. With a small walking trail, but large open field. The walking trail is lead by a few self propel work-out machines, n resting seats along the path.
* 4 Tennis courts * 1 basketball court * 1 basketball court * 1 playground
The community sometimes does a awareness fair, along with a movie night with the right temperature of course. Also it's dog friendly, it's not a dedicated dog park, but know ure allowed to bring them along, it's asked u clean up after them, but sometimes we get it there's no baggies available u forgot ures, just keep in mind our children's run a mock here.
Tennis court is usually active,  just be warned when there are two Tennis being used at the same time be careful not to get hit by the opposing courts ball, if u know what I mean. It's usually always active with toddlers and parents during the day, n young adults at sunset-night seeking to mingle unsupervised, or either their riding their electric dirt bikes, unless ure trying to catch some Pokemon with ure  Pokemon GO app then u might encounter a good for nothing wombat, during mornings, n afternoons you'll encounter you're daily routine joggers/walkers burning them calories, or walking their dog. It's small but decent, enough for people to get by but a lack of parking space, but who needs parking space when it's next to ure home.
Thank u for taking a moment of ure time to read this.
P.S Pokemon Rules!!!

courts.name: Portola Park
courts.address: 28040 Glenn Ranch Rd, Lake Forest, CA 92610, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Song Song
pickleballReviews.text: I have been here for its dog park right next by, but just realized there are three well maintained, designed, regulated pickleball courts.  It is Monday morning now, a group of residents are having good time playing in one of the courts.  Door swing inwards.

pickleballReviews.author: Charissa Voss
pickleballReviews.text: This is a beautiful park all around and has everything from multi-ages playgrounds, stating the art workout stations placed all along the flat walking track, a flat open field ideal for bocce ball, frisbee, kite flying, picnicking, etc, clean restrooms, ample parking and 3 very well maintained pickleball courts, (note: the pickleball courts are closed between 1pm-2pm Mon-Fri for maintenance. There are also 3 dog parks located at the park, all three of which are gated and separated from one another and intended for large dogs, one for smaller dogs and one for “anti-social” pups! One of the best parks OC has to offer!

pickleballReviews.author: Spencer Gatt
pickleballReviews.text: Great new and clean park. Big grass field, a view, pickleball courts, a volleyball court and large 3 different area dog park next door. This place is awesome!

courts.name: Carrotwood Park
courts.address: 60 Bennington, Irvine, CA 92620, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Garry Kepes
pickleballReviews.text: It is important to understand that this is a very local neighborhood park. There are MANY parks in Irvine that are multipurpose. This is really a great park if you live in a very short walking distance. If you want a full amenities park,Irvine had lots of those, too. Even as small as it is, it still has two large kids play structures, a soccer field, half basketball court, and a volleyball area.  Give it a break.

pickleballReviews.author: Richard Woo
pickleballReviews.text: The park is just ok. Probably better for kids older than toddlers. The playground is a bit sparse and not that much to interact with. There’s a basketball court and volleyball court and soccer field for older kids.

pickleballReviews.author: Custom Wedding Gowns By Debra Green Design
pickleballReviews.text: Cute little park.  Soccer field, volleyball pit, basketball court, kiddy play ground. Actually love this park.  Ya it's small and that's the best part.  We take our Whippet (35 mph) here to run laps.  He loves it too.  He totally stays within the soccer field, bothers no one and when he's done, he gets his very own drink of water. Right now during COVID, the play ground is closed but it's a lovely walk-through park on our way to 6mile walks.  If you aren't into "long walks" don't get a Whippet.

courts.name: Foothill Ranch Community Park
courts.address: 19422 Rue De Valore, Lake Forest, CA 92630, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Charissa Voss
pickleballReviews.text: We adore this park! The playground is beautifully designed and adequately laid out for all ages! Plenty of shaded areas and picnic tables, as well as grassy areas! Lovely walking track (lightly gravels, stable but not paved or concreted, ample parking, clean restrooms, basketball courts, ball fields, soccer and open grassy fields, tennis and pickleball courts, etc…and it’s nestled safely next to a community church and at the top of a hill that is the entrance of several well maintained and well loved residential homes! Excellent park all around! Something for everyone in the family!

pickleballReviews.author: Alekya Varma
pickleballReviews.text: Pretty clean and love playing tennis/pickle ball here. They have two tennis courts.

courts.name: Border Park Pickleball Courts
courts.address: V94W+W37, Corona, CA 92882, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Pickleball System

courts.address: 33928-33994 Avenue E, Yucaipa, CA 92399, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Pickleball System
pickleballReviews.text: This is a dedicated pickleball facility with multiple courts. Great place to play!

courts.name: ID SPORTS
courts.address: 16872 Millikan Ave, Irvine, CA 92606, USA

pickleballReviews.author: simon sun
pickleballReviews.text: Big thumbs up to this new indoor pickleball and tennis court! Upon entering the door, the clean and bright environment gives people a good mood. Nets, rackets and other facilities are new, the size of the pickleball is moderate, good elasticity, the flight trajectory of the tennis ball is also very stable. Here, whether it is with friends, or alone practice, are super cool, directly fall in love with sports!

pickleballReviews.author: Andy Zeng
pickleballReviews.text:
I recently started playing at ID SPORTS, and it’s been a fantastic experience. The courts are well-maintained, and since it’s indoor, I don’t have to worry about the weather at all. The space is clean, and the setup is perfect for both casual games and more competitive matches.

The staff is super friendly and helpful, and the location is easy to get to with plenty of parking. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced player, this place is great for improving your skills and having fun. Highly recommend it!

pickleballReviews.author: Bryan Cho
pickleballReviews.text:
New indoor pickleball/tennis spot in Irvine! Found this place through Facebook and decided to try the place out because it's been windy.
Definitely recommend calling in before driving up here!
It is reservation only from what I know. The worker told me if you guys can't get ahold of the phone line it's possible that they're busy, so keep trying. :)
They have 4 official courts for rent and 3 miniature courts (no net yet) for dinking/warming up, very accessible for kids as well. No A/C, but if it gets hot from your matches just ask the worker and they will open the warehouse doors for you. It is still in there soft opening stage, so not everything is there yet such as fences.
Overall great to see another indoor spot opening up in SoCal

pickleballReviews.author: Vincent Nguyen
pickleballReviews.text: Place is very nice and affordable. There are 4 courts for pickleball available and 3 small courts for dinking. The place is still new and will be fully renovated really soon! Staff are very helpful and friendly as well!

pickleballReviews.author: Vishnu Manathattai
pickleballReviews.text: The indoor pickleball facilities were amazing, we were able to get a good experience playing indoors on a windy day. Located in Irvine with good proximity to other neighborhoods and restraints, the location is ultra convenient and made the experience even more amazing. The staff was friendly and will definitely visit again.

courts.name: Tustin Hills Racquet Club
courts.address: 11782 Simon Ranch Rd, Santa Ana, CA 92705, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Garrett Kerr
pickleballReviews.text: Participated in a great pickleball tournament hosted by Tustin Public Schools Foundation. The courts were in good condition. The rest of the facilities were in good condition. We enjoyed everything about the club.

pickleballReviews.author: Ruth Bruno Real Estate
pickleballReviews.text: Love playing pickleball and meeting new people at this beautiful club. This weekend they had a fun holiday event for the children meeting Ms. Clause. So Fun!  I highly recommend you check out the club, you will be happy you did.

pickleballReviews.author: Justin Bazant
pickleballReviews.text: Great spot to pickle, always courts available!

pickleballReviews.author: Addison Adams
pickleballReviews.text: This club is all about the tennis. The members are great and there are a lot of opportunities to play tennis. I like the men's doubles league on Tuesday nights. My wife plays on a team that has matches against other clubs. Most of the courts are in great shape. The clubhouse is dated and there is no bar or restaurant although they do offer beer and wine. The location is beautiful with nice views and quiet atmosphere.

courts.name: Ranch Sports Facility
courts.address: 16067 Euclid Ave, Chino, CA 91708, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Mitty Torres
pickleballReviews.text: Excellent spot for pickleball with three courts available. Also great for basketball, featuring two full courts. The facility is clean, offers great service, and is very affordable. Family-friendly atmosphere!

pickleballReviews.author: chrystel torres
pickleballReviews.text: Nice court. Clean restrooms. Friendly hosts. Will definitely come back.

courts.name: Redlands Community Center
courts.address: 111 W Lugonia Ave, Redlands, CA 92374, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Mr Pickleball
pickleballReviews.text: Redlands Community center has 8 permanent courts that are spacious. They are open from 8 a.m. till 7:30 week days and weekends 8 to 4:30 ... during regular hours they do have indoor restrooms. They have organized play on Monday, Wednesday, Friday, and Saturdays at 8:00 a.m. till last group quit. around 12. There are lights that the staff can turn on at night. All levels of play are accepted at the courts.

courts.name: North Lake Tennis Club
courts.address: 10 Eastlake, Irvine, CA 92604, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Matt Jew
pickleballReviews.text: Well maintained tennis courts!  Needed to be escorted in by Woodbridge residence.

pickleballReviews.author: Flora Fuller
pickleballReviews.text: For the Woodbridge residents, it is an excellent place to tennis.  Although with less assigned courts, it's a fun place to play pickleball.  Parking is a bit limited when the courts are busy.

pickleballReviews.author: Alen Beygelman
pickleballReviews.text: Awesome and well upkept private tennis courts!

pickleballReviews.author: A C
pickleballReviews.text: Great facility!  Only has 4 pickleball courts.  Needs 4 more!  Fastest growing sport in America is here to stay!

pickleballReviews.author: Erik Rashidi
pickleballReviews.text: Well maintained tennis and pickle ball courts, but you have to be part of their HOA to gain access.

courts.name: Wheeler Park
courts.address: 626 Vista Dr, Claremont, CA 91711, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Alvin Luna
pickleballReviews.text:
My daughter and I enjoyed our time playing pickle all at this park. The park seemed very clean, and there weren't any "scary people" around.

The pickleball courts were well maintained. We will definitely play here more often. Thanks, City of Claremont.

courts.name: Pickleball Courts - Brush Canyon
courts.address: 28282 Brush Canyon Dr, Yorba Linda, CA 92887, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Pickleball System
pickleballReviews.text: This is a dedicated pickleball facility with multiple courts. Great place to play!

courts.name: Bark Park Dog Park
courts.address: 2080 Erwin Ranch Rd, Big Bear, CA 92314, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Brittany Chapman-Holman
pickleballReviews.text: Beautiful park with a view of the mountains, lots of evergreen trees. Plenty of parking, and sizable dog park — fenced in, lots of benches, some shade offered for doggos. Tennis, basketball, & pickleball courts, a small but nice disc golf course! I think there is a ropes course of sorts here, a playground, and grass. My favorite park in BB.

pickleballReviews.author: Angel Alexander
pickleballReviews.text: Beautiful dog park with basketball courts, multiple tennis courts and an updated playground

courts.name: MacKay Park Bark Park
courts.address: 687 CA-173, Lake Arrowhead, CA 92352, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Rodney R. Ewing
pickleballReviews.text: Very clean park and wide open  area for pickle ball, volleyball and basketball. Great veiw if the lake and dam. Parking is somewhat limited though.

courts.name: Catawba Tennis Courts
courts.address: 11417 Plane Tree Rd, Fontana, CA 92337, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Diego Ortigoza
pickleballReviews.text: Good, local tennis courts. It's only about a 10 minute walk from my house to the tennis courts. The tables there are useful for a small picnic before playing. The restrooms were a bit nasty, but is acceptable if you really need to use it. Overall, I would recommend playing tennis here.

pickleballReviews.author: Miss L
pickleballReviews.text: I like that the neighborhood utilizes the tennis courts for tennis and rollerskating. I don't play tennis so when I come to skate,  I appreciate the smooth surface. I do believe as a skater that tennis players should have priority on the courts though. so accordingly, I will relocate when my tennis playing neighbors want to occupy the courts.

pickleballReviews.author: Laura Carp
pickleballReviews.text: We play pickleball on Friday and Saturday mornings from 8-1130 am

courts.name: Tennis and Pickleball Courts at Heritage Community Park
courts.address: 4601 Walnut Ave, Irvine, CA 92604, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Pickleball System
pickleballReviews.text: This is a dedicated pickleball facility with multiple courts. Great place to play!

courts.name: Tennis courts
courts.address: 900 Tomato Springs, Irvine, CA 92618, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Abdullah Riaz
pickleballReviews.text: Neat and clean tennis courts. There are 3 tennis courts but in the evening there are classes for kids, so you might have to check their schedule if you want a court for playing.

pickleballReviews.author: Daniel
pickleballReviews.text: 6 pickleball courts that are in amazing condition. I do think 2 courts have a slight lower net

pickleballReviews.author: A. Hashimoto
pickleballReviews.text: Great place to play pickleball. Taped lines, but nice surface and lights for night play.

pickleballReviews.author: Don Noble
pickleballReviews.text: Actually I was at the pickleball courts.

courts.name: Conestoga Park, Valley-Wide Recreation and Park District
courts.address: 32493 Western Hills Dr, Winchester, CA 92596, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Jeri and Jim McGee
pickleballReviews.text: Great park for all ages! Mommy and me swing, lots to climb, many slides, basketball and pickleball courts, soccer field, and the bathrooms were clean! We even had tons of space to fly a kite!

courts.name: San Dimas Sportsplex Tennis Courts
courts.address: San Dimas, CA 91773, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Sam Culotta
pickleballReviews.text:
Popular place for tennis players .Numerous courts and players. No problem finding others to play with. *Courts are well maintained with a few that could use newer nets.

*Since I wrote this review many of the nets have been replaced!

courts.name: Norco Pickleball
courts.address: 3950 Acacia Ave, Norco, CA 92860, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Pickleball System
pickleballReviews.text: This is a dedicated pickleball facility with multiple courts. Great place to play!

courts.address: 212 E 6th St, Claremont, CA 91711, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Steve Chang
pickleballReviews.text: tennis court

courts.name: Las Palomas Park
courts.address: 20550 Paseo De Las Palomas, Yorba Linda, CA 92887, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Michelle Kiernan
pickleballReviews.text:
Never a dull moment there at LP. 2 tennis courts, 4 pickleball courts and a doggie park. The people are wonderful and willing to teach new pickleballers. People are pretty fair for the most part when it comes to order of play. It’s a paddle system or just ask.

Parking can be tough at times. Do not park in front of any mailboxes. Park on the same side as the courts and not in front of houses.

Bring a chair if you plan to stay long. Lights out at 9:50pm.

UPDATE 10/14/24
Now it’s a reservation system and play is now from 8am-9pm

pickleballReviews.author: Sinnary Sam
pickleballReviews.text:
4 pickleball courts & 2 tennis courts. Pickleball is open play and open from 7am-10pm. Busy times are 8am-noon and then again from 5pm-close. Paddle system for drop in play per court.

Tennis courts also get busy, seeing people patiently wait. There are also some tennis classes held on the courts by the city.

Restrooms are conveniently located right next to the courts.

Night lights are very bright.

pickleballReviews.author: Gina P
pickleballReviews.text: Small, 3 well kept tennis courts. Tucked away in a residential neighborhood,  there is no way you would stumble across it, you definitely have to be looking for it.

pickleballReviews.author: Edwin Lu
pickleballReviews.text: Great pickleball atmosphere!

pickleballReviews.author: Evan C.
pickleballReviews.text: Just ok. Tennis courts are well maintained. They are a bit slow. Park is a bit "hidden" in the residential area.

courts.name: Vellano Park
courts.address: 16321 Aviano Ln, Chino Hills, CA 91709, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Tommy
pickleballReviews.text:
Not a ton of flat grass area for kids to run around on, but there's a small playground, full basketball court, picnic area, restrooms, and four pickleball courts. Parking lot is usually full during the evenings, but you can park along the street right outside of the lot.

Pickleball is public open play all the time. No challenger courts. Four off if there are at least 3 people in queue. If there are only 1 or 2 in queue, then winner stays and losers off. It can get pretty packed usually by 7pm, with 8 people waiting to play on each court. Everyone is pretty friendly, as there are a lot of beginners and lower level players here. There are only maybe 3 higher level players here on any given night. Mornings tend to have players in a higher age range, whereas evening tends to skew towards middle age and younger.

pickleballReviews.author: Brian Kung
pickleballReviews.text:
EDIT 3/21/24: They have lights at night, and they last until 10pm!

Came for pickleball and was delighted at how active the community was. No lights for night time, but that will be installed sometime in march 2023. Courts are nice and well kept. There is bathroom access but it's a 3 min walk from the court. Not a lot of parking if there are 20+ cars.

pickleballReviews.author: Cecilia Salcedo
pickleballReviews.text: We love this park! Clean, nice for picnics, or a short hike! The courts are well kept.

pickleballReviews.author: Cecilia Salcedo
pickleballReviews.text: Recently found this nearby park, great for pickleball, basketball, short hike or photos!

courts.name: Shamel Park
courts.address: 3650 Arlington Ave, Riverside, CA 92506, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Megan Jones
pickleballReviews.text:
It’s a nice park, on the smaller side… has a playground, tennis courts, ball field, and pool.

The playground has three sections one for little kids 2-5, another for 6+, and a sand box area. The 2-5 year old playground was great my 2 year-old loved it. The slides were not too steep or fast and she could climb up almost all the parts by herself. They had two swings for little ones too. There was also a large area of tables with a covering, perfect for birthday parties or events.

The tennis courts are in good shape. There are two courts here at Shamel Park and there are lights so you can play at night too. I think they are on a timer, but I’m not sure what the hours are.

The pool is a pretty good size with lanes and flags and all. We’ve had our kids in swim lessons here through the city which has been really good. It’s got a nice big area that is chest-high perfect for kids to play in. It’s also heated from solar, so it feels great. They have a little pool for tiny kids to enjoy too. Although, a recent post from the city said they don’t have recreational swimming at this park. They have bathrooms with changing area and showers to use before or after swimming.

The park is in good shape and has been taken care of. There are homeless here from time to time, but I’ve always felt safe. Definitely recommend the playground for little kids!

pickleballReviews.author: Jim Au
pickleballReviews.text: I came here for a public, family-friendly protest rally. The park was just right for this activity, attended by around 200+, many of which were families with kids. My friend who invited me to the event passed out free ice cream, and this added to the sense of festivity and patriotism among the diverse set of participants. The park proved to be more than adequate to host such an event. Ample parking, and easy freeway access. Looks like they have some decent tennis courts.
The park itself is great.  Tennis courts, playground, baseball field, grass area for soccer, and a pool.  My only complaint is that I've seen suspicious looking vans in the parking lot.

courts.name: Maddox Pickleball
courts.address: 4790 Irvine Blvd, Irvine, CA 92620, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Pickleball System
pickleballReviews.text: This is a dedicated pickleball facility with multiple courts. Great place to play!

courts.name: UCR Student Recreation Center
courts.address: 900 University Ave, Riverside, CA 92521, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Milan Milenovic
pickleballReviews.text: Good gym with a ton of equipment and courts for many different sports. Relatively reasonably priced, but during the school year almost unreasonably overcrowded. Reception staff is unfortunately pretty uninformed and incompetent when you need to interact with them, which is luckily rarely needed.

courts.name: CSUSB Student Recreation and Wellness Center
courts.address: 5500 University Pkwy, San Bernardino, CA 92407, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Pavan Kumar Reddy Kunchala
pickleballReviews.text: It's an awesome gym , with a charging station, basketball court and more

courts.name: Columbus Tustin Recreation Center
courts.address: 17522 Beneta Way, Tustin, CA 92780, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Daniel Olson
pickleballReviews.text: Good basketball court when set up single.  Double the walls are short. Good staff but the floors could use some waxing and dusting.  Just general tending to.  It would be cool if they opened early 20 minutes so league staff can at least dust floors.

courts.name: Circle City Center
courts.address: 365 N Main St, Corona, CA 92880, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Edgar Trujillo
pickleballReviews.text: Corona Badminton Club meets here every Sunday from 3-6pm. 6 full courts, a/c, great staff and phenomenal members.

courts.name: Village Park Recreation Center
courts.address: 4552 Michelson Dr, Irvine, CA 92612, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Prudvidhar Reddy Thangella
pickleballReviews.text: Do the tennis courts have public access?

courts.name: Anthony Munoz Community Center
courts.address: 1240 W 4th St, Ontario, CA 91762, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Karma C
pickleballReviews.text: Spacious park. Nice area. Clean. Big field to take your children for baseball practice & has basketball courts. Public pool & other fun activities.

courts.name: Lake Community Center
courts.address: 310 W Graham Ave, Lake Elsinore, CA 92530, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Kellie Conatser-Morris
pickleballReviews.text: This newly renovated building was a theater back in the day. Working the Election my poll station was located inside the indoor basketball court. Full kitchen,several restrooms, and a beautiful lobby. Only one handicapped parking spot. If the side doors are not open the parking areas are on both sides of the building.  Walking to the front from there may not be easy for anyone who has trouble walking.

courts.name: Yucaipa Community Center
courts.address: 34900 Oak Glen Rd, Yucaipa, CA 92399, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Ajit Pai
pickleballReviews.text: Really nice facility. The front desk staff are super friendly. I come to this place to play Pickleball with the Yucaipa pickleball club members. It’s a little echoey but fun overall. Lots of parking.

pickleballReviews.author: Darleen Adamek
pickleballReviews.text: Very nice center. Nice center w/ large reception area and indoor court for basketball and the like. Large well maintained park w/summer concerts.

courts.name: Eastvale Community Center
courts.address: 13820 Schleisman Rd, Eastvale, CA 92880, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Hong Phan
pickleballReviews.text: I came here during their open play on Wednesday at 8am, and it’s a really nice gym! Around 9am or 10am, more people started coming in but I got a solid 30-45mins of just serving practice on empty courts. I live in Corona and it’s definitely worth the short drive since there are no open play indoor courts in Corona that I know of. Will definitely be dropping by again!

courts.name: Lake Forest Sports Park
courts.address: 28000 Vista Terrace, Lake Forest, CA 92630, USA

pickleballReviews.author: John Mazurek
pickleballReviews.text: Great SPORTS park with many fields for baseball and soccer in excellent condition plus basketball courts and so much more. Field house for indoor activities such as dance and gymnastics. The park also had two or more children's playgrounds that were clean and nicely equipped. There were also several covered areas that were being used for parties, Lots of parking available with handicapped access available. Covered areas near the ball fields with comfortable seating.

pickleballReviews.author: J G
pickleballReviews.text:
This is a real nice park! And it is keep very clean! They have lots of soccer fields, lots of Baseball fields, some basketball courts, and a few trails, but if you follow the trial behind the park, Aliso Creek Trail, you can meet other trails.

Great park for sports playing, lots of open space. There is people always walking in and around the park. There is also a bike jumping trail, and a bike jumping little made up city that you can get to through the park, you won’t see it unless you follow one of the park trails and look down the mountain side.

Parking is plenty, and if you want to park by the Baseball fields, there are signs posted that says “Park at your own risk,” I assume that is because of a ball may fly out and hit your car, even though there are nets to capture loose balls, but I guess it is still a possibility.

Great park for walking, playing, running, biking!

pickleballReviews.author: Claudia Kaipa
pickleballReviews.text:
Beautiful facility. The grounds are super well maintained with gardeners pretty much daily. The softball/baseball fields are in tip top shape, with shaded dugouts. Each field has its own shaded bleachers with space for handicap. There is also a super cute covered playground and indoor and outdoor basketball courts (but I didn't personally see them)
I was here for a summer softball camp and the covered bleachers were perfect. I even found an open outlet so I was able to work while waiting for my child to be done with camp. Highly recommend this place for baseball/softball.

courts.name: Deleo Regional Sports Park
courts.address: 25655 Santiago Canyon Rd, Corona, CA 92883, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Ian Evenstar
pickleballReviews.text: Beautiful park with a great view and lots of family and dog-friendly things to do. The field weren’t as green as they could be for soccer, but the goals and nets are in good condition. There is a playground, basketball court, dog park, softball field, walking trial, and two barbecue pits.

pickleballReviews.author: Kathy Bundy
pickleballReviews.text: Enjoyed walking path around parameter of park. This park has something for all ages. Dog park, splash park, toddler playground, basketball courts, tennis and pickle ball courts.

courts.name: Lago Vista Sports Park, Valley-Wide Recreation and Park District
courts.address: 29100 Holland Rd, Menifee, CA 92584, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Jeff Meinardus
pickleballReviews.text: Good size newer park in the south eastern portion of the city. Good size baseball diamonds with a variety of dimensions. There is also 2 half court basketball courts that are back to back, a jungle gym, a full size soccer field and restrooms. There is plenty of parking on the street if the lot is full.

pickleballReviews.author: Ryan Beach
pickleballReviews.text:
This park has three large baseball diamonds, A soccer field, basketball courts, And a playground.
This is one of the larger parts in the area, it has a decent amount of parking available as well.
The restrooms look like they could use a little help 😝

courts.name: John Galvin Park
courts.address: 1072 N Grove Ave, Ontario, CA 91764, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Fidel Gonzales
pickleballReviews.text: Great location off the freeway. No fee. Open play futsal (soccer). Two courts. Bring a few friends. Drop in on whoever"s there. Play the beautiful game.

pickleballReviews.author: Christina Castillo
pickleballReviews.text: Favorite local park. It has a dog park, soccer field, playground and workout machines. Right across you have a second park with basketball courts and a baseball field.

courts.name: Sundance Park
courts.address: 4047 Sundance Ln, Norco, CA 92860, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Lisa Pietron
pickleballReviews.text: Nice grassy area for kids and dogs, horse corral, basketball court, clean bathrooms, drinking fountain, picnic tables. Park on street.

pickleballReviews.author: cxjxgerdes cxjxgerdes
pickleballReviews.text: Cool park with a shelter, restrooms, & a basketball court... very nice.

courts.name: Valley-Wide Recreation and Park District - REGIONAL PARK tennis courts
courts.address: 901 W Esplanade Ave, San Jacinto, CA 92582, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Walter Ibarra
pickleballReviews.text: It's 1 of the better parks within my neighborhood. If I have to complain about anything, it would be that you have to pay in order for the lights in the tennis court area to be on. It's a public park, and my taxes should be sufficient for lightning within a specific time frame.

courts.name: Tennis Courts 12-25
courts.address: Great Park, Great Park Blvd, Irvine, CA 92618, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Kulvinder Virdee
pickleballReviews.text: There are 25 tennis courts at this location. Half of them are reserved for Academy training. Remaining are available for individual use.

courts.name: Tennis Courts 5 & 6
courts.address: Corona, CA 92883, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Sue Chambers
pickleballReviews.text: Beautiful courts located in a clothing optional resort.

pickleballReviews.author: Stacie Smiles
pickleballReviews.text: Tennis courts are well maintained

courts.name: Wheat field tennis courts
courts.address: La Piedra Opp. Bayport, Menifee, CA 92584, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Andrew Buensalida
pickleballReviews.text: Nice courts with a hitting wall

courts.name: Canyon Lake Tennis Club
courts.address: 22210 Canyon Club Dr, Canyon Lake, CA 92587, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Ivanka Jones
pickleballReviews.text: Beautiful Place! I love the view a lot! The lake is so beautiful and the beach is always clean and a great way to spend some time with family. The tennis courts are very well maintained and clean. The layout is nice with some courts on higher elevation. The community is very nice and we visited around Memorial Weekend so there was a lot of nice people around. Some booths were set up and food trucks came. Try to do a day trip and visit on a holiday time!

pickleballReviews.author: Evan C.
pickleballReviews.text: Great courts by the lake. It could get really hot but not too bad for a quick hitting session. Nice place. 👍🏽

pickleballReviews.author: Stephen Schroeder
pickleballReviews.text: Sad that Pickleball is "all the rage" now.  But these are some AWESOME courts.

pickleballReviews.author: whitney johnson
pickleballReviews.text: Beautiful place. Love the tennis courts and the lay out of them.

courts.name: Foothill High School Tennis Courts
courts.address: 19061 Foothill Blvd, North Tustin, CA 92705, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Kevin Pang
pickleballReviews.text: Courts are generally clean, but busy. Bathrooms locked during certain times of day.

pickleballReviews.author: christian noiroux
pickleballReviews.text: Great courts. Generally in good shape. Lights are very good at night. Crowded on weekend mornings.

courts.name: Great Park Tennis Center
courts.address: 8242 Great Park Blvd, Irvine, CA 92618, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Molly BZH
pickleballReviews.text: The Great Park Tennis Center is a top-notch facility for tennis enthusiasts. The courts are well-maintained, with high-quality surfaces that make for a great playing experience. The center offers plenty of courts, so even during peak times, you can usually find a spot to play. The staff is friendly and professional, ensuring that everything runs smoothly. There are also excellent programs for players of all levels, from beginners to advanced. The surroundings are clean and pleasant, making it a great place to spend time on and off the court. Highly recommend for anyone looking to enjoy tennis in a great environment!

pickleballReviews.author: David Bradshaw
pickleballReviews.text:
This is an amazing tennis court. You wouldn’t think it’s free it is so clean and fancy looking.

We were hesitant that it wouldn’t be a free one. But it is. And I like that it is staffed so you can check in and know wait time if all courts are full. We usually go on weekday mornings and never have a wait unless summer camp is there. And even then never more than 10 min wait. The staff keep track of time and are always friendly.

Only downfall is getting to the staff. Sometimes they are on different sides of the tennis area. So it’s a long walk since there are so many courts. Also always plenty of parking at the park.

Courts are clean and gorgeous and staff are nice.

pickleballReviews.author: Yen-tso Kuo
pickleballReviews.text: Great courts with a slightly inconvenient booking system. All players must be present to book a court. Wait times vary. Lights are very bright so the courts are probably the best in OC for night games. When the orange light says says to blink, you need to hit the button outside or your lights will turn off. There's an ant problem so pocket those tennis balls attentively.

pickleballReviews.author: Ravi
pickleballReviews.text:
Editing the response after 2 years.
5 🌟 to 2 🌟

The facilities are great but the people they have put on to manage and allocate the courts are very rude and unreasonable.

Everytime I come here they make you wait inspite of empty courts. Then they also you wait for your partner.

They have very old style way of checking courts.

pickleballReviews.author: Darwin Nelson
pickleballReviews.text:
Enormous, ample parking, well lit. Staffed daily until 9pm daily lights off 10pm. Staff direct players to open courts packed and limited to one hour during busy hours.

Every two courts fenced from each other with full height. Shaded benches with power outlets. Energy saving lights that activate when pressed by a button.

Numerous bugs crawling from neighboring bushes. Staff will hose down courts sometimes depending on how busy it is at end of weekdays.

Surface is slow, gritty typical outdoor hard surface

courts.name: Tennis Court at Blaisdell Park
courts.address: 440 S College Ave, Claremont, CA 91711, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Nicolle Moyer
pickleballReviews.text: One court. Grew up playing here with my mom. Occasionally come here as a family to play doubles. Great times. Within walking distance of the village and train station. Street parking. Bring extra balls; backs up to a home. Restroom on-site.

pickleballReviews.author: James Duldulao
pickleballReviews.text: Decent court. Only one available. I don't think too many know about it as it is never busy. Nice tables and BBQs just outside of the court. Great parking.

pickleballReviews.author: Daniel Espinoza
pickleballReviews.text: Theres only one court and its ugl. They're are houses behind it, and if the ball goes over.. bye.

pickleballReviews.author: Danya Velazquez
pickleballReviews.text: Good place for tennis but only one court

courts.name: Brush Canyon Tennis Courts
courts.address: 28282 Brush Canyon Dr, Yorba Linda, CA 92887, USA

pickleballReviews.author: Salvador Monella
pickleballReviews.text: A regional hotbed of fun rolled into a tiny-sized park.  Lighted basketball courts, lighted tennis courts, grass, and a play area for the young kids with slides & stuff for the tiny primates to climb on. With it's readily available parking, it is destination more for local residents than swarms of outsiders. Considering it's nominal fee of zero $ and breadth of recreational activities, it is no wonder it is a favorite among those that go there. Note that the lights for the tennis courts shut off somewhere around 9:00pm, maybe 10:00pm, but that there is a switch you can hit nearby that turns them back on. I don't know about the basketball courts because I don't play basketball.

pickleballReviews.author: m johnson
pickleballReviews.text: This can be busy(the courts). But, everyone is friendly. There are restrooms, and picnic benches for a lunch afterwards. Also, has a dog fountain. A field to play other sports. Also basket/pickle ball court. Parking is easy with a parking lot, or parking on the street.

pickleballReviews.author: Tanner Teng
pickleballReviews.text: Two well-maintained tennis courts, might need to wait for a while.

pickleballReviews.author: Lydia A
pickleballReviews.text: There are 2 courts and they have lighting so thats helpful!

pickleballReviews.author: Jeff Glende
pickleballReviews.text: Tennis courts are usually not used, so if you are looking for a great place to play. There is seldom a wait.
